EmJtANdFPDDWIQCDNQC9vA.text: Bf's favorite place in Vegas, we have to stop here a few times when we're in town. He loves the adobo fried rice omelet. - for me, this place is alright. Everything I have ordered so far has been blah. Nothing memorable and delicious for me to want to come back.. and what's up with the tuna poke here??? Everytime I've asked for it, it was either sold out or not available. I gave up and stopped asking for it after the 5th time lol.   overall, I've had better hawaiian food but I'll continue to order diff items but not really expecting much from this place

NMlwAQGbgkIaUE4YcDVGyQ.text: Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, and I have tried all other "Hawaiian food" places in vegas. No body beats Aloha Kitchen Delicious!! But be prepared to wait at least 15-20 min for you food it's always busy but worth the wait! The only thing I hate is the bar next to it sometimes I can smell that "bar/cigarette" smell in the restaurant.

ObdQyH6NeVJeuIPvlsFCfA.text: Love this place!!! Great food great service!!! Best Hawaiian food in town!!! Prices are decent too, portions are perfect!!!

4QHoO037VGdrb02_KwP9sw.text: Some of the best things about this place - Open Late - Cheap - Lots of decent eats - Service is pretty quick - Local Spots (won't get those damn obnoxious out-of-town peeps in this joint)  The adobo fried rice omelette is pretty damn tasty but I don't see why they just can't make that as an option for the "rice portion" on any other dish. I would so pay extra to add that my bento box, loco mock, or breakfast i-log dish.   That's my only complaint about this place. Hopefully they'll heed my advice and add it as an option to their menu.

IxWugshJkmsMVCe1aMBVgQ.text: Always have been a fan of Aloha Kitchen.  My go-to meal is the chicken katsu with rice and macaroni salad. I've had the loco moco which is delicious. You can't go wrong with spam musubi either. They've got a great selection of Hawaiian and Filipino dishes on their menu.  Great tasting food, and the staff is always great to us. I highly recommend this location.

iTSoE4EZaxQjc45N0akofQ.text: Ono food!!  Coming from Hawaii to the mainland, its hard to find good, authentic Hawaiian food. I've been going here for YEARS and the food has always been the same every time, DELICIOUS!! A lot of the time I get Lau Lau and its always cooked perfectly. The pork in it is always so moist and there's lots of taro leaves to eat. This is the only place in town I'll get my Lau Lau from, other places are too dry.  Just recently I the adobo omelet and MAN! So good!  The customer service is excellent and they're always really friendly.  I love this place and will continue to go back again and again.

h91ZAA5eXEFP9kOk17BqGA.text: The worst service ever! My first and last time coming here. And to top it off the food was horrible! Definitely do not recommend this restaurant to anyone! If you want real Hawaiian food I recommend 808 grill.

XXG29RunvPmHHPxAKmHoKA.text: Awesome service, I recently had a party for graduation... Food was so good and had a great time with DJ karaoke.

EVv3Mf8cfVrK7BoXi96x1A.text: Recently tried the Kalbi Ribs and they were so good and they give you a lot.  Macadamia Pancakes were bomb too.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi

bF96OiS9HiX_rYhG4QVSRQ.text: My gal pal and I stopped by for a quick bite while in the neighborhood.   We placed our order at the counter, our first time so my friend asked how did they do their macaroni salad. My friend is from Hawaii originally and has had macaroni salad many different ways. She was curious so asked as she did not want to regret a double order of a style of mac salad she may not like...you catch my drift.  The clerk replied that she had no clue, however she added she "thinks" it may have chopped cucumber in it? She also stated she had never tasted it before. Ok so being the type we are, we go for it, and wield the consequences later...so double order of the "Mystery" mac salad it is.  It was a bit bland, not made with best foods, most likely store brand mayo. Not sweet, not very flavorful, however if mixed in with every other item on your plate, it does the trick.  We ordered the the Pork Lau-lau, served with Rice and Macaroni Salad. This dish was good, the lau-lau was a great presentation, very tender, juicy and tasty. It was a nice portion indeed. The sticky rice was good as well.  I also ordered a side of lumpia shanghai w/sweet chile sauce the way I like it. Mmmmmm yummy.  I make chicken lumpia at home, I will come here for my pork lumpia!  All in all was an ok meal, some goodness balanced with some blandness rates this review with a 3 Star.  Suggestion is have your employees know the food, questions about their menu is something they should be prepared for. Just saying...

b9ZwclFr8ottpKNEJqa-wQ.text: My review will strictly be on what I ordered:  Kalbi - These were just ok.  The marinade was nothing special... pretty much what I expected which was overly sweet with not much of a complexity of flavoring agents.  The meat itself was probably the thinnest cut of short ribs I have ever seen.  Even L&L serves up a thicker slab.  Katsu - This was actually pretty good.  Tender and juicy interior with a super crispy and light exterior.  Unfortunately I was not diggin' the dipping sauce.. it just tasted like hoisin mixed with oyster sauce.  Chicken Teriyaki - The teriyaki sauce is horrible.  It was thickened with so much cornstarch that it didn't have much flavor.    Adobo Omelette -  Don't know what everyone is raving about.  Imagine leftover adobo that mom made from the night before, which was fried with some leftover rice the next morning, then wrapped in a blanket of the flattest scrambled eggs I have ever sunken my teeth into.  I mean don't get me wrong, it definitely has that "homemade" and "comfort food" spot we all have, but please do not go out of your way just to make this purchase.  Mac Salad - Typical island mac.. peppery, sweet, & mayo-y.  Rice - Super sticky to the point where the rice balls on my plate were a congealed mass of mush.  Spam Musubi - Well, you can't mess up spam, but you can mess up the complimenting sauce and well, the sauce that was slathered between the spam and the rice did the spam musubi no justice.  OVERALL:  Not worth another penny from my wallet.  Maybe it would've been better if it were drunk food.  Also, the people that work here weren't very friendly.  Not one person had a smile on their face.  Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

ifa_Pfr0En0qpPUyD2TtSA.text: I'm a sucker for Hawaiian food, and the student special is by far one of the best values. The way the chicken is prepared makes it so delicious compared to other Hawaiian style Teri chicken. I simply can't get enough of it! I do despise the price of the musubi, at $2.50 a pop it's kind of ridiculous! Other than that the staff is always friendly and inviting. Food is prepared fast, but be weary of coming late at night. For some reason during night hours the rice seems like it's been sitting forever and is all mushy and disgusting. Great place for lunch and right down the street from my work!

Oe5wpvMs7xufi2hK9-QsDw.text: It's honestly embarrassing how much I eat here:) the food is seriously so bomb! It's so good. The teriyaki combo is what I always get. I do however love the mahi mahi. All the meat they use is fresh and quality. The macaroni is to die for. Not to mention the workers are so nice and friendly. And it's not expensive. Beware it's very addictive

SXuRcsuCQuRrzyVVv8zWDw.text: comfort food after a long night of drinking..... this is a great place to get that  I usually order the pork fried rice or adobo omelette to cap off that drinking night very good, not too greasy....gotta have a little though, hits the spot lots of good fried rice wrapped in a thin egg wrap or omelette as they call it lots of carbs to absorb all that bad alcohol!  I have ordered other dishes here, the chicken katsu is decent, curry ok teriyaki is well, teriyaki, nothing outstanding about it, good though loco moco is good if you need something a bit heavier than the omelette  place is opened til wee hours of morning too, so great place to hit after leaving that club/bar try it, you won't be disappointed....

Most of the djs are great they will look up what you need and want to sing but there is one guy who kills our vibe every time the African dj doesn't make our time enjoyable he seems to not like his job much and everytime he completely ruins our night I hear he's there Thur, Fri, sat beware you have been warned

eKTWFP7enzwpVKDNII96kw.text: I am so disappointed with this restaurant. Ordered the maja katsu and the fish had no salt whatsoever. The chicken katsu was overly cooked and was so dry. My son ordered saimin. It was salty. Everything we ate was either too salty or no salt. Never coming back to this place again! Too bad Yagyu Ramen close early otherwise we would have gone there for our katsu cravings...

X-Kt2z6Kg3t8-gupMrbVgg.text: The food is very good. I got take out, but  i was not happy when i checked the bank account the next day to see they had gone ahead and given themself a $7 tip. I didnt get his name he was the bigger hawaiian looked to be in his 20's working the evening shift.

0gkYZNXEf3S4_QMriiO2xQ.text: It is tradition that my friends and I visit Aloha Kitchen every trip to Vegas. I usually get their Moco Loco, Chicken Adobo Fried rice and Their Spam Masubi. We usually eat here late at night.

NCjZox6OE9PA01HoB0bzVQ.text: This grubbin joint never fails to fill that hunger craving. The best Kalbi Ribs in town and the Kalua Pig is pretty on point too. The best place to get a mid night snack, the service is always pleasant, and i always go back for more.

ewXL9z8DXk-tfonxjQ4Egg.text: Amazing Pork Adobo!..Loved the live music :)

f3EDknHXFcyM6a_W9BOCcQ.text: Continuing on the search to find a fabulous serving of pork lau lau, I was brought to Aloha Kitchen on S. Decatur Blvd.  Pulling into the lot, I recall seeing this place on yelp and was anxious to get my turn at it.  It's pretty crowded for a late Friday night and people are starting to pile in.  We join the line and perused the menu above.  The BF convinces me to go for the Hawaiian Plate at $8.99.  It's Kalua Pig and Pork Lau Lau, so this way he gets to try some of the kalua pig too!  This comes with two scoops of rice and one scoop of mac salad.  The BF ops for the Kalbi Combo at $7.99.  This give us Kalbi, Katsu, and Chicken Teriyaki.  It also comes with the standard two scoops of white rice and one scoop of mac salad.    I should mention, I've been to my share of Hawaiian joints, but my sister takes the cake.  She definitely makes it a point to try out any new ones that she comes across.  She also always substitutes the two scoops of rice and one scoop of mac salad for an additional scoop of mac and one less rice.  This is usually never a problem, and if anything, they might charge a bit more for the mac salad.  Well, I asked if I could do this.  The cashier had to ask another woman, and she in turn had to ask another guy (the manager/owner) I assume.  He flat out said no.  Wow.  They tried explaining something about not charging me for the rice, so they can't do that.  Anyway, I think I was just put off with the whole "No." answer.  They could have said yes and said they would charge me for the substitution, which I probably would have agreed to anyway.    We got our number, helped ourselves to beverages and condiments and took a seat in a booth.  One of the servers soon headed our way with my order.  Just as she was about to place it on the table, all this liquid came spilling out onto the floor and table from the plate.  (Wtf?)  She apologized and went to retrieve a towel to clean up the mess.  I was fine with the spill and clean up, my concern was with where all the liquid came from?!  I guess my Pork Lau Lau must have come out a bath, because that was dripping wet.  I ended up  pouring all this additional liquid off my plate into another plate before my rice and mac salad got too soggy from all this 'juice' sitting on my dish.  I unraveled my lau lau in search of my pork and took my first bite.  For being soggy, the meat was rather tough and the whole dish had no taste.  I ended up pouring tons of shoyu all over the dish.  There was no fatty bits either to give it any flavor.  Very disappointing on the pork lau lau part.  The kalua pig faired a bit better, but not by much.  It started out well, but as I got deeper into it, there was a lot of tough pieces that I ended up spitting out.  Overall, my dish was pretty disappointing.  I wouldn't go back here for any pork lau lau at all.  I was about halfway through my order before the BF's order finally arrived.  (This is never a good thing.)  His was better, in his opinion.  He had a decent experience with his order at least.  The Chicken Teriyaki had a sweeter sauce than what I'm used to, but that's probably why this dish does well here.   The mac salad was better than some of the other places I've been to, so that was a good thing.    There's the Aloha Bar next door and there's karaoke on Friday nights.  You'll see the servers bringing orders in next door if you're dining in.    They do offer delivery, it's a $10 minimum and if you get their flyer, you'll find a 15% coupon on there. I asked if they had any business cards, which they were out of.  When the cashier asked the manager/owner if he had any, he asked "Why?"  (Uh, 'cuz I'm going to yelp this place, that's why!)  When it comes down to it, Aloha Kitchen will continue to do well.  They are open later than some of the other Hawaiian establishments around town (5 am on Fridays and Saturdays I believe!) and they have a surplus of young customers coming in to chow down.  They have two other locations, one on E. Charleston and the other on S. Maryland Parkway.  I just know that if I return, I won't be getting any pork lau lau, that's for sure.

D26SdzrJJSRKJYsHGeh99g.text: Since multiple concurrent projects and Life In General have kept me up a lot more than my normal Xtr33m Vampiric Evil schedule necessitates, Aloha Kitchen has been my lifesaver when the Triscuits and Dack Janiels in my desk threaten to detach my fingernail grip on sanity. I've discovered that one can play "Adobo Omelet" drinking games, i.e. if you consume a bay leaf, take a shot! The styrofoam box it comes in is also ludicrously heavy that I can't help but giggle uncontrollably in hentai-schoolgirl bursts when I swear I can't take another bite, oh no the smell itself is making me nauseous, how the hell can someone eat this much in one sitting......then pop the fridge open after 2 hours and praise God that it's still there! Make sure to keep the rice cooker on standby when you get the Loco Moco; their particular blend is beaucoup SAUCY!  And will necessitate additional rice to quell the sometimes-salty sensations. Local Plate last night got a lot of seaweed musubi wrap in my teeth; perfect for the post-second-date makeout session.   Student specials (sub-$5), Tapsilog in the morning, and consistent Chicken Katsu give me many reasons to list the Kitchen among the daily expenditures. Now if only I could complain about "it's too umame, could you cut back on the umame?" with a straight face, then I know I've won at life.

2V7vaircE0JECy0ZncA1Lg.text: Pros: Introduced me to the wonders of Spam Musubi. It's just generally a good place to eat. Not much more to say.  Cons: .........there's not much more to say. :/  Still love it though. My favorite Hawaiian restaurant in all of Vegas.

dlMpf0Qr6du9xIowHoBa0A.text: 4 words.  Adobo.  Fried.  Rice.  Omelet.  A legendary dish.  For those who don't know adobo, it's a Filipino dish that's main ingredients are soy sauce, vinegar, and onions, complimented by chicken or pork.  Not spicy, but really flavorful.  They have other Hawaiian dishes like loco moco, mac salad, kalbi, etc., too.  Bring your appetite.  This thing is about the size of a Chipotle burrito.  It is soooo delicious a friend came along after breakfast at the Bellagio buffet and still managed to finish it.

RuIdKhlynHK0dFPkV1D1XQ.text: I was in Vegas last month and I was introduced to Aloha Kitchen.  By the time I left to go back to San Diego, I had eaten there twice and both times i ordered their adobo omelette.  I can honestly say that was the best omelette I've ever had.

RVOjRdkDv1HDk3VumzoD2Q.text: We eat at Aloha Kitchen all the time, being from Hawaii its nice to get local foods.  There food is Very good and the portion size is amazing. This year we decided to Cater from here.  We were offered a tasting so we could try a variety of things that we may never have tried.  Everything was amazing, In fact it was so awesome that we are going to have them cater our New Years Party. We highly recommend this restaurant. Good Food and Wonderful service.  Aloha spirit from the moment you walk in.

SWjetM4_aY99QEyvrkz5-Q.text: i usually come here when it's a trip to vegas with the friends. and we always seem to take up the corner spot with the booth seats cuz there's so many of us.  reason for just 3 stars: their lau lau (chicken, fish and/or pork wrapped in taro leaves and then banana leaves and steamed, you don't eat the banana leaves) is not the best it can be. i've tried that dish two or three times, and have to say that it's alright. not the best. my first time having it here, i was a little dissappointed, but decided to try it again b.c i just love the dish so much (when it's done right), i thought it deserved a second chance. the second time around, same thing. the meat inside was just a block of fat and a bit of meat. i need me some variety, fish, chicken and/or pork meat.  lesson learned, stick to what you know is good: the adobo omelette!!! rice, chicken adobo all wrapped up in an egg that cooked almost like a crepe. add some sriracha on top, and you're set. and it's huge, so you can share with another person or not, depending on your appetite. last time there, three of us shared an adobo omellete and the kalbi ribs plate, perfect amount! and their mac salad is pretty good too.  reading others' reviews, it sounds like their manapua (pork bun) is good, so i'll have to try that the next time my friends and i are there.

lMhjYknLag1XxNVpNhJx2Q.text: Adobo Fried Rice Omelette is awesommmmmeee

tMiDrcFztLqhQWEBCmeIyg.text: I don't understand why every branch of the company seems to be rude and you get a feeling that you as a paying customer should thank them for being in business. I har experienced that at other "island places" (hawaiiian, Guam etc). What's up with the attitude!!!!

q0d_714GhCDU-I9_aWX05A.text: A good local place for when I don't want to drive to far for Hawaiian food. They serve a decent Loco Moco with a thick brown gravy that needs a little more flavor but other wise its filling and the Spam Musubi is good, add the hot mustard, Tabasco. Its all good!

_JZvsRLS0Ys-FxztufoJwA.text: I'm a fan of their adobo fried rice omelet.  Pretty damn good.  But i was drunk so I can only give it so many stars.  For sure coming back to it when I go back to Vegas.

OS9o8YRegl8bQunSXQkZIQ.text: Whether we were looking for a place to eat after school, or coming from a night of underage hooligans, Aloha always welcomed us with open leis. The adobo fried rice omelet with chicken is fantastic, but my personal favorite is the five dollar student special for the chicken teriyaki bowl (AND drink). You brought me in with the price, you kept me with the taste. I love a good chicken teriyaki bowl and Aloha has it. Everything is always hot and the chicken has a good flavor, and I personally think the hot sauce on the table adds just the right amount of flavor for anyone. Don't worry Aloha, I will be back.

igJFXxOaQn9TJGNYJm_bCw.text: Since Vegas has a huge Hawaiian population, there are a lot of Hawaiian restaurants out here.  I've eaten a lot of Hawaiian food out here..but I didnt really like the food too much @ this particular restaurant. I didnt go to this location, I went to the one off of Maryland Pkway, near UNLV.

hkmaZ-GrY_zNUpinUckOnw.text: I wanted to support the Hawaiian places here but I don't think I can.  Sorry bruddahs.  Went in for late lunch.  I ordered the teri-beef.  It was dry and overcooked with some teri-sauce drizzled over it.  It didn't even look appetizing but I was starving so I ate it.  So 2 1/2 stars for the food.  My gf ordered the lau-lau.  It was so-so.  Probably frozen and imported in from CA or HI.  Oh, and to top it off, they shut off the AC on an extremely hot day.  It was almost unbearable to be inside.  Hello?  This is Vegas.

btmuG5KOrg_p1efItQqNSw.text: Been going here since I've moved to Vegas. Their food almost feels like you are in Hawaii. I highly recommend the short ribs and their ox tail soup. Cooked to perfection almost wanting more after you're done eating. If you want your money worth it this is your to go to place for good comfort Hawaiian food!!

hlPIG9w5qxNV5gS8rqT68g.text: Local Kine Grindz! When you are in the mood for some food that sticks to your ribs and transports you back to 808, this is the spot. A can't miss while your in vegas!

rGvQRhLyerElUK3mPSHBLg.text: Yummy food I love their Toron and loco moco! I love their macaroni salad as well. This place is so good. I love the combination of Hawaiian food and Filipino food as well. Toron is a banana fritter wrapped in egg roll wrap and deep fried with jackfruit and banana brown sugar inside so yummy!

-__Px2diljRZV7WL48JbBQ.text: This is a must when coming to Vegas. Every time I'm in Vegas I have to come here and get their adobo omelette. One of the best dishes!!! I also enjoy their lumpia, reminds me of how my grandmother makes it. The people here are also very welcoming and are so nice!! Make sure to stop by.

hzrNgaLbxWowRy4c7bbHLg.text: I have been loyal to Aloha Kitchen since I moved to Vegas. This particular location has a bar and restaurant, which makes for a fun atmosphere for dining and entertainment experiences. The DJ is an oriental kid with big ears is full of energy and keeps the party going.

LIrfQOoAZjA60iNVN1Sr8Q.text: Always great food and service! The Loco Moco is my favorite.

BDgCSZdeBx1tbk-aWdQ-Yg.text: Perhaps the attached bar should have lead me to believe being intoxicated was the key to a great meal.....  The 2 stars are for the kalua pork as it was delicious and plentiful.   I noticed the mixed reviews but still thought it could be worth the stop.  I'll break it down.   Ordered the hawaiian plate with an order of spam musubi.   Musubi was like no musubi I've ever had. A thick chewy wrap of seaweed around a thin piece of spam and rice. Had some sort of sweet sauce in their as well.  Not a good spin on musubi.   Mac salad...now this was almost good, but wasn't  ..really the Mac salad makes the meal in my opinion.   Lau Lau ...where to begin..well I'm no expert, I don't believe a giant pile of leaves and green mush (see pic) over a tiny bit of the inside stuff is the way to do it.   Perhaps they make something worth eating, this wasn't   To top it off when my meal came I asked for Siracha and it never came. .....  Should I return it will be for a drink in the bar...perhaps they make a great Mai Tai

WpAm283Jb3h6yzt3J5-shw.text: One of my favorite places to come when I'm in Vegas and probably the only truly good place around town to grab Hawaiian/Filipino-fusion food. Place is always clean and the food always made fresh to order. Try the adobo fried rice!

0TytugMI_Kzh7Qq7wxD5SQ.text: Been a customer here for years! I love this place, food is great, friendly staff, clean establishment. try their Kalbi combo you won't ve disappointed.

Z51CuR81GchnkYBuUWaoEQ.text: I've been spoiled and tainted by Hawaii. I LOVE my Hawaiian food and this place was pretty good for the mainland. I have to say though, that I have yet to find a Hawaiian joint that taste like over there. I blame my family in Hawaii for their wonderful cooking and for bringing me to the best places ever when I visit.   The spam musubi was okay, not great and not bad, just okay. I ordered the adobo fried rice omelette. It was huge! I ate maybe half of it and I have a big appetite. It was good, however the meat was a little dry.   Service was great and I definitely would come back to try the other entrees.

Ij1B35lSu6tBPvZo_HRPxA.text: Was a terrible place. Was waiting in line for like ten minutes while the people at the counter had a conversation with the customer at the register.  They could have taken my order and I could have been out in the same amount of time. There was literally two customers in the store and I was the other customer. All we wanted was some katsu matsubi. What horrible costumer service. They took the order for the people and then handed their order to them before taking our order. How do you stay in business.

_UNfRL6uEYFbJf_c3CBYUg.text: Food was amazing. :) I really enjoyed their katsu, it was nice and crispy. The kalbi was amazing too.

OKBKcIIvODWX0486wsiYFw.text: I've been coming to Aloha Kitchen for years, and personally this is my favorite Hawaiian spot. Over the years, they raised their prices and portion sizes, but they have still kept things relatively consistent. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal or experience here. I really like their combo plates, and I usually get the Local Plate or Aloha Plate. The bar area is nice, and they have karaoke and gaming. I highly recommend this place

rFLsjpe_3S0yXiHaDKtE0Q.text: Always a great place for delicious Hawaiian comfort food! One of my favorite go too's. Food is always consistent in quality, taste and amount! Fast and friendly local Hawaiian service always sharing the spirit of Aloha! Five star rating well deserved!

4dWQTvmLFtc3QOKZ2aVlPA.text: Great Service food is fresh to order and The Lumpia OMG great I love it the workers are professional

wyGLigvg0yZchm44TSIrpw.text: I love some of the dishes at Aloha Kitchen and decided to try the Banana Pancakes with Macadamia Nut Sauce and the Fried Rice Lovers Omelette. Ok the pancakes would've been delicious if two of the three weren't burnt. This was an order pickup so I didn't know until I got home and began eating them, very disappointed. The macadamia nut sauce is truly the star though. They actually ran out of macadamia nuts so that was already missing from the dish, didn't make a fuss about it. But these are pancakes and you know when they are burnt so they tucked the burnt ones under the one that wasn't. Would it had really been that hard to make two more, they don't take long to make and it wasn't that crowded. The Fried Rice Lovers Omelette was plentiful but super dry and bland, will never order it again. Extremely disappointed in my visit today!!!

zXrbc3zL18mZdanw6_LmxQ.text: Super crispy chicken wings portion that rocks !  I decided to order loco moco too and this was a great surprise. It just melts in the mouth. For a late night bite, this is a great place as the service is fast, the food is hot with topping of affordable prices. No matter of the late hour the staff members are friendly and are paying attention to every customer. Really impresses with this place.

VSdfp61dLNzWQWIZmNm8QQ.text: This place is the place to go to eat some good Hawiian food.. When your done head next door to mingle, drink, and sing some karaoke in the Aloha Bar with a fun colorful bartender. He's wonderful. Its a great experience. One of My favorites.

_X3wt2BScVeSRE8nBb0ubQ.text: There was a bit of a line waiting to order and it seemed to move very slowly. They would not accommodate a food allergy by exchanging the meat in one of their dishes. Any other place could do it! The sesame soy salad was very good! Their macadamia banana pancakes are nothing short of delicious! The staff was obviously inexperienced. Where they lacked in service they made up for in it the kitchen. Good food!

vrAtBd4Nhmx9_BRD00ZJxA.text: this place is awesome and amazing 10/10 isaiah is very cool and friendly 10/10 drinks is great and stuff

05OUrPhDi1k8Ex_OqiWTTw.text: Aloha Kitchen is somewhere you have to go to when in Vegas. The Adobo Fried Rice Omelette... Bomb diggity! Can't go wrong with that one!

oPpEKZsuw6LmfMxtpOIxjg.text: I love this place. BBQ CHICKEN ON POINT! I love the service here itms awesome. Cyndel is the best.10/10 will come back.

6qJMHL65RAp94l2SMXr3NA.text: Super awesome food. Decent dining area reminds me of LnL type. They actually had manapua, didn't get to try it. We ordered Kailua pig n cabbage, Kalbi, chicken katsu, and Teri chicken. Oh and the French fries! The oil was fresh and fries were crunchy.  They have Hawaiian sun drinks and fountain drinks. Overall better than aloha specialties in Main Street and closer to The Orleans if you staying there. If in Vegas again and I want my local Hawaii food...I'd go here. Didn't go in the bar. Hope this establishment remains clean and nice.

1e3Ilndf3VElSNb0mi5X5g.text: A few months ago, my husband and I wanted to eat lunch here, but it was just way too crowded. All the tables were occupied and the long line went out the door. We left and decided to come back another time.   I was in the area today and stopped by around 10:45 in the morning. There were 5 people ahead of my in line, but it wasn't crazy busy like the last time. I ordered the Local Plate to go. It came with teriyaki chicken, teriyaki beef and 2 spam musubis. The chicken had a lot of fat on it, there was barely any meat at all. The beef was tender and flavorful. I also like how they are not stingy with their spam musubis. Thick slices of spam and they did not over do it with the rice. Other places will put a very thin slice of spam on a huge block of rice, which is always disappointing. The portions of chicken and beef were small, but the 2 spam musubis definitely made up for that!  The cashier wasn't too friendly, but she wasn't rude either. I thought for sure that I would have to wait a while for my food, but it actually came out pretty quickly. Next time, I want to try the kalua pork and lau lau plate. Hopefully, it will be better than the one at L&L.

65BW7Trwd1NiYokzzXVcpw.text: I was jonesing for some kalbi and where do I go? Aloha Kitchen, as always. It's close to me, reasonably priced and always quick and friendly service.   Same goodness as always. A little overcooked, but growing up in a home where char marks are common and sometimes preferred. I still loved it. I'd really love to try the adobo omelette since my friend Stacy A. raves about it here, but I can't seem to pull myself away from the kalbi.  Big fan. Yum.

wsCPEKmbs7ziwilnlPN5iQ.text: The food is not bad, love the musubi and the local plate. maybe the sauce is a little sweet for me, but still okay. only thing I'm giving this place a 3/5 is because it took them almost 35 minutes to get my food ready.

efpyWRTamooDb0E2h-Dr9Q.text: I eat here 3-5 times per week Abraham, Isiah and precious Princess are the best!!

j5CPY0omthG2Olz1RZctmQ.text: The food is sooo delicious here and the prices are so low.   Been going here for over 10 years.  They have the best chicken teriyaki bowl, and adobo fried rice! They also open early and close late!

BRv3-LycOue74ofgTegjlw.text: BIL (Brother-in-law) turned 21 and wanted to karaoke. Wanted general not private room and found this gem. Such great fun and special memories.   Would absolutely recommend this place for anyone looking to have a good night.

xqwFsFtWHi9ryG-VkYH2bw.text: I been a customer for about 7+ years now and the food/service is great but lately specifically last night they are closing 30 min before the hours of operation posted in the front. I hope someone looks into this issue because it has become more common forcing us to go to other restaurants we really don't crave at that time. I will be back because I love the place but not if this continues... Thanx

Now all that needs to happen now is for them to open up locations in SoCal (;

uTh2RKWkaJ8_1mxrTVxEkQ.text: First time here. Ordered the Adobo omelet. So good. The portion was big enough to feed 3 people. The taps I log is also bomb. I had a fast in corn beef too, it was amazing. We wanted to hang out in the bar but is wasn't open yet so there will be a next time. We took an uber since we where visiting but there is plenty of parking. Lots of people inside eating. It's located in a strip mall so if you want to walk around after some heavy food you can do it. Ordering was easy and they don't have water available at the beverage station they actually bring the water and condiments to your table number. The workers are very friendly and the restrooms where ordinary. We will be back

cEfDOg7yihGdWmdxEqJGug.text: No need to drive downtown for oxtail soup.  Aloha Kitchen's is pretty good.  Plus the soup flavor makes me eat my carrots :P.  Great how this spot is open late.  Menu has delish selections and they carry Hawaiian Sun.  Parking lot at night has good lighting and its easy to find parking.  I noticed there's a wine bar a few doors down.  But Aloha Kitchen also has a bar.  All the more fun... there's karaoke.  Overall it's a cool place to hangout and support the daring ones who belt out their voices in front of strangers.  We heard some great voices too; like competition material ;)  Service always has the aloha spirit each time we've been here.  They work late and they're still super nice.  Our food was even brought over to the bar section.  Note that in the bar area there is a two drink minimum to kick it there.    Comfy food, cool hangout, offers casual dining section and karaoke bar, serves liquor, and super friendly service. Who said you can't find the island in the desert?

It's very cozy.   My overall experience is great! This place doesn't disappoint when you want quick late night Hawaiian food with friends. YAAASSS BRADDAAHHH.

Plus they have a dance floor and a separate bar for you party animals.

euzjKDJT38arA6FWamSMVg.text: One of our favorite spots to go to. Service is amazing and staff is really kind. I only get the Kali rib plate because it's too delicious. If you really like char on your meat, get the ribs well done! You won't be disappointed!

PDBdSL1ZaBSWfGlDgot-uw.text: I'm from Hawaii and decided to try Aloha kitchen while on vacation.  We ordered the adobo fried rice and the saimin.  They were both amazing!  The saimin was my favorite.  Even better than some places in Hawaii.  I would definitely recommend aloha kitchen.  I might even make another stop there before leaving

UiIAyUe7wHoGe77bNbYL-g.text: Love the teriyaki combo plate! When I think Hawaiian food I think of this place! This branch! The best in town!   You walk in go the counter and order. You can get a fountain drink or opt for Hawaiian Sun. I'm all about Hawaiian Sun passion fruit. Ok so I always get the combo plate teriyaki. It comes with chicken, beef and pork smothered in teriyaki yummy sauce with two scoots of rice and one scoop of the best macaroni salad!!! It's a huge plate but if you are like me it's one of those plates that you keep eating because it tastes soooo freaking good!!!   You order and sit down they bring the food out to you on real plates with real silverware and some napkins. I love that they are open until 4am! Maybe because they have a karaoke bar next door.  I love this place I'll be back!!!!

ZU0M9v9A6hTnFtdRZmem1g.text: This was my first visit. After viewing the menu board I noticed SO MANY local favorites and didnt know where to start so I ordered the pork adobo plate with mac salad. I thought it was decent because my preference is to have it a little drier/crispier rather than a lot of sauce - though it was tasty. The BBQ plate my friend ordered looked pretty good too!  I would recommend this place because Im sure there are some delicious winners on the menu - I just didnt hit it on my first visit. Again, lots of local choices on the menu, very impressed!   Finally, this must be a good place because there was a small wedding dinner reception in the main dining area while we were there! Awesome and congrats!

qcO6zB8JwK7eSK6J1_3Fmw.text: My review is for the restaurant side only.  The bar side stinks.  The chicken teriyaki and loco moco are outstanding.

VVg3WjqaIefUaPrA1JLc3w.text: I've been coming to this place for as long as I can remember. Service has always been excellent, coming from the many faces I see come and go behind that counter, with the employees pretty much knowing my order as soon as I walk in. They also would deliver promptly whenever I would order for delivery. I've tried nearly everything on the menu, but the dish I ALWAYS order is the Local Plate. Which could very well be their signature dish since it's one of the most common items ordered from the menu.   Everything from the macaroni salad, to the spam musubi is top notch...whenever it's cooked properly. You see, Over the past 8 or so years I've been coming here, the food has mostly been superb. But it's not very consistent. There have been quiet a few times where the Rice is either soggy or hard. Or the beef is too dry. It's a shame since whenever they do it right, it's FANTASTIC. But the few times they get it wrong, it's downright horrid. I can understand that not every single meal can be cooked perfectly, but the slip ups happen a bit too often.   They do a good job of keeping the place clean too. It's visually appealing as well. There hasn't been a time where I was disgusted with the interior or even exterior of the restaurant. They also have a karaoke bar connected to the dining area, which is separated by its own set of doors.  This place will always be one of my favorite restaurants. Especially since the service is always excellent and the place is clean and eye catching. Overall, it's a great place to eat with good vibes all around. Just hope you catch the chef on a good day.

W7n7tsItrbm9ONAkJ9VaXQ.text: Best Kalbi I've ever had! Mac salad was to my liking as well, as in, not drenched in mayo. Nice staff and not too long of a wait time for take-out.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Best Kalbi

6eU6KKvSwoXhHgb8wpXLGg.text: Always a win. Prefer the maryland location tbh. Go rebels student special fried chicken wit gravy on the side.

mzdaj9zBI33kCFrX4w9IuA.text: Man this place great choice for Hawaiian food in Las Vegas! Living in Hawaii and visiting family in Vegas, what better place to eat and talk story like Aloha Kitchen. Market Street Cafe would be another place that the locals go and eat, but Aloha Kitchen & Bar is so ono!  They place closes pretty late so you can get your late night grinds on if your up past 12am.  What I got was Local plate which includes: Combination of Teriyaki Chicken, Beef and 2 Spam Musubi. It included more rice also. I think they can cut back on the rice that isn't in the Musubi and give an extra scoop of mac salad.  The teri beef and chicken was cooked awesome. It wasn't over cooked and tough. The chicken was easy to cut and so was the teriyaki beef. The teriyaki sauce catered to the masses and more of a mainland pallet but I thought it was very delish!  THe Musibi could have been wrapped a little tighter because it was falling apart when i took a bite out of it.  Pricing was on point too. nothing crazy like paying on the strip, but for the amount of food you get, and the price you pay, its a deal!  Everyone praises the adobo fried rice but I didn't try it this time. I'll most defiantly try ti next time in in town and craving some local hawaiian food.  Over all, love this place and will be visiting it more when im back in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Local plate.

AM8lREkB0vM8l2UWvt50jQ.text: Great food and service. Love that they are open late! They have large portions and great prices. The service is always on point and they also have karaoke bar area that is separate from the dining area.

The lounge was about half full when we arrived but as the night continued on it definitely turned into an epic party house with a great vibe.  From karaoke singing, dancing, and comedy from the lounge hosts, KJ Mack & Barman Chris, this is definitely a place to come have fun.  :)

Another 7 minutes after that they brought out our three kids meals. Another 5 minutes they brought another one of our entrees (which was not correct) and our Ahi Poke appetizer.   Seriously, appetizer 23ish minutes and after other food??  After sitting for another 15 minutes, they brought out our final entree. Long after everybody else was finished eating. But i ordered a side of rice for $2.50 last night and this is all i got LOL if i knew that would be all I'd get I would've just ordered another chicken bowl for a couple bucks more. Other than that I would def recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $2.50 for 2 small scoops of rice. Just order another chicken bowl for a couple bucks more

n7P-zcPxiF5U-cdLMEbGMg.text: This place is fun and affordable and delish! Had the combo bowl and they have the option of original or spicy! It was super good. Wpuld try it again. Staff is really nice.

yx8jHNZydngzrVJGG0htCw.text: Yum yum tastes like home come and get yours today.  Aloha!  Best deal going is the Kalbi Combo with kalbi, katsu and chicken teriyaki for $10.49.  There is also a karaoke bar.

V8R5LKNCCnSuPS2tuI0lyA.text: My husband and I come here when we crave Hawaiian food. Great food and service. I always get my favorite kalbi combo. I love the chicken katsu and kalbo ribs. They're delicious!

MIzaH_qxd2LeMfnF6tRhvQ.text: This place is magnificent. Staff is always cheerful and offers 5 star service. Never leave unsatisfied and time management is always on point.

TLmPCcGoGxvecTIsSeDCAg.text: We ordered the Poke for an app Oxtail Ramen & Loco Moco.  Loco Moco is one of those dishes that totally brings me back to Hawaii.  Staff is friendly.  Food is tasty. Come on by for some good comfort food.

UxHhFZWHwGN2_ghwCPdBDw.text: I love this place but am only giving it four stars because the only thing I've ever eaten from here is the spam musubi. Spam musubi isn't hard to make at all but there's something about the way this place makes it that just keeps me coming back.   My only suggestion is make sure you get and keep your receipt because though they may have been standing RIGHT THERE as you ordered your food, they will NOT give you your food unless you can prove you ordered it LOL. That was annoying.

XS79wXBmU2yHgvCaxsja_w.text: I drive all the way from Summerlin to this location, (I even pass the other Hawaiian food place) just to get some of their extremely delicious Kalbi Ribs. I refer to them as my meat candy. They are so perfectly marinated in their homemade Kalbi sauce that has a home cooked taste to it. They even remember me by name when I call in my orders without even asking for it.

f_BnhM6P9n1Hr3K3gPdtHQ.text: Love this place. Great food, great bar, and a even greater staff. The locals plate and some karaoke is a must.

NSlRIQgV984zaku2kH0BiQ.text: We love this aloha kitchen. It's our favorite, they always make our favorite dishes without any errors. The workers are so nice and welcoming, always willing to help! #ilovelumpia

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3oIbpg6brc9gSgPIsrPauw.text: Came here because I raved about the food from other location near unlv... what a disappointment, brought some guest and was told kitchen was behind "about 20 minutes".  I ordered before my guest and they got their food way before me, not only was my food late but several other customers got their food before me. The guest I brought got their food and ate their food before I even got mine.  My friends adobo fried rice omelette was made spicy and never got sides.  I finally walked up to cashier and started pointing out that other parties got their food.  They still insisted mine was next.  Then I asked about the mac salad and spam musubis they still owed us.  How hard is it to scoop mac salad?  Funny thing is they had several mac salads on counter, none were mine.  Finally after 40+ minutes my food came, ox tail ramen and spam musubis... ramen noodles were hard, couldnt eat, had 4 pieces of ox tail only 1 had a good amount of meat.  Since I was last person to get my food, my guest were done eating... so I ate the ox tail, 1 musubi and didn't take the rest of ramen home.  One of the cashiers did try to give us old toron to apologise but that wasn't even good.  Never going back to this location.  If you want to try aloha kitchen, try the other locations before this one...

ROL4E4TOl8ftc0xW18bMhQ.text: Good food. And service. Free food. Fast service. Near to our place. Affordable and so delicious. Very friendly crews

mnxZCEiLYbJVs7lz1CkWsw.text: The staff is really friendly and the food comes out quick. I usually order my food to go, but the inside of the restaurant looks clean.  I usually get the BBQ mix plate with short ribs, chicken teriyaki, and chicken katsu. Pretty good, flavor is good and I like their mac salad. It's definitely a good late night spot.

A1rH3cyY9EPpWA4nGWMz0A.text: Great food, fun atmosphere! If you love Hawaiian food you will love this place. I have been coming here since 2012.

hGiKQr-v9bu47zrX-Nln1A.text: Customer service was very unprofessional. Maybe the word is unfriendly. Sad for a place where we are supposed to have fun. Ughhhh not a place to.drink.

bEC7tSm5uCfOsBhT18ZlQg.text: My favorite lunch spot, fair prices, friendly and attentive staff. When I'm driving around while at work and get a craving for teriyaki chicken this is my spot. Continue the great food and hospitality. Thank you :)

cpsSRYL8peuUat3tUriLbw.text: eleven of us went to this bar at 6 p.m. we were the only patrons in the place we were waiting to sing karaoke which started at 8 p.m. after gaming for 25 minutes I finally asked the bartender if I could have a drink the chief of filled my request. A friend of mine ordered Shock Top and they were out of it another friend ordered a non-alcoholic beer and they had none. After being there in an hour a new bartender came on shift and when my friend ordered her second drink he charged her a dollar more than the first drink. So once again I've only had the one drink the whole hour I was there because there was no service so I asked the new bartender if I could have a drink he didn't even give me eye contact or make any gesture that he hear d me however he did deliver my drink but once again I had to ask for it.                                                                     Now for the Karaoke, the reason we chose to go to that place. we were told that karoke starys at 8 p.m., when the gentlemen showed up that runs the karaoke we asked him if he was the dj and his response was"yea but Im not even on the clock yet. 8 oclock"  he was very unenthusiastic. Once he allowed my friend to sing one song he sat down at a table and ate with a female. He was very unattentive to us. At one point my friend had to enterupt him while he engrossed in a conversation with the female that appeared to be his girlfriend. After he rolled his eyes and had poor body language we decide to leave the place and take our business elsewhere. A place where we felt welcomed and didnt feel like we were a nuisance.  Needless to say we will not be patronizing that business I'm posting it again.

-5mkYW9KlhSmkIqbtXP2gg.text: I wish I could give more stars, but my stomach can't agree with that executive decision. This is my usual late night go-to spot for my lunch break, when I forget my lunch that is. I really only like this place because it is open late (open til 3 AM) and the workers are generally pretty nice. This place does get pretty slammed, so placing an order over the phone can be pretty difficult. I usually order the Local Plate, but lately the quality has just gone down for me. The chicken katsu is hit or miss, along with the teriyaki chicken. This spot was a hidden gem for me when I first moved to Vegas 5 years ago, and it wasn't til I worked across the street I was able to recognize the walls of this place. I'll be back, hopefully things are a bit different next time.

DeHenyWf2-KeNdZtCJyC_g.text: Ok so deliver may be slow but Aloha kitchen will keep you full for hours and wanting to come back the next day!

bMgNOLdcuFf5MNgbN-vtzQ.text: I love a classic spam musubi and lumpia and they are good at them. However, the other more complex dishes they serve, I am not as big a fan of.  They staff is VERY friendly! Love 'em.  The karaoke bar is a good time, although, never very busy. Most people who go there to sing karaoke are very good singers which makes it less fun and more intimidating for the people with sh*tty voices like me! haha

HO5iAifriK8_p4eJSpdBHg.text: I've been to many Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas and I can honestly say Aloha Kitchen is my favorite. Aloha Kitchen is located in a small strip mall on the Westside of Las Vegas. It's easy to miss if you aren't carefully looking for it.  PRO: Good food and good people! I suggest Trying:  Oxtail soup, Adobo Fried Rice Omelet, Loco Moco, Macadamia Pancakes, or the Local Plate.  Those are my favorite dishes... Food are freshly made and cooked!   CON: I came to Aloha Kitchen & Bar when it was super busy. Although the staff were trying there best to take orders and push out the food in a timely manner. I requested water and waited for about 30 minutes. I just got frustrated and purchase a cup for myself.

d6MrG0lgVyYQgPV2xgjyag.text: I am not a fan of this place but my family seems to like the ox tail soup, spam masubi and adobo fried rice.  Also ordered the corn beef hash.  All edible not spectacular in my opinion.   I book marked a few breakfast/brunch place to try next time when I am in Vegas.

NiGFuEjvnXw2M4sDoi4DTQ.text: Bombbbb Hawaiian foooood. I would definitely come back for their chicken katsu. Their spam musubi was pretty good too. Lots of space to eat and chill.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X1yQf-L-0IXuw_d3m51RfQ.text: Aloha Kitchen is located in a strip mall on the Westside.  I came here primarily for their oxtail soup.  Yup.  Here I go again searching for oxtail soup.  Celery , carrots, ginger , and onions were swimming in this hearty oxtail soup as the meat literally fell off the bone as you work around it.  It was savory good and wayyyyyyy better than Market Street Cafe!  Like ten times better!   Aside from what brought me here, their Portuguese sausage and spam plate was also decent. We also grabbed some spam musubi to go just in case we get hangry on the road!   I'm so happy i yelped this place.  Now I know where to go to get my oxtail soup fix when in Vegas without having to inhale all that cigarette smoke going into a casino!!!  #tyyelpyoudidit!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup. YuM!

yGiv_tqVHzerTmkAKZcKDQ.text: Just grabbed a couple of plates before heading back out if town and i was very disappointed both plates.   My manapua was rock hard on one side (warned up too much) and besides the portions being terribly small,  the food was not very flavorful,  let alone tasteful.   I'm not sure if this was because it's a Sunday or what,  but sad to say,  i won't be eating here anytime soon.

TpvHeR0D20i9wnhy8310uA.text: Awesome spot! The food was so good and the portions was big. We got the Kalua Pig, Adobo Fried Rice, Katsu Chicken and Shanghai Lumpia. Highly recommend all that. We will definitely come again when we are in town.

cm11fmM1BV2SimUi8OqmZQ.text: This is the place to go for reasonably priced Hawaiian food when in Vegas.  Now this isn't any place fancy, no fusion happening here, just good Hawaiian food with people that are there for the same reason, to grab!  There is another side to the restaurant, the bar area.  Haven't been to that side but I've always wanted to walk in to enjoy drink and the music...  It's a small place of the strip, but there are always Polynesian, Hawaiian, Somoa, etc. there and my hubby feels like he's home again.  They're never empty and there times they are absolutely full, no seats available.  Either way, he looks like he belongs there.  Food was to go this night, but the service was great and as always the ladies there make you feel like you're family as they talk and joke with you.    Come and try the macadamia pancakes or the Loco Moco.  The katsu here is pretty good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buy wanted a combo plate as well

Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu

IvkwEmhlKXDdYHI3bOHDZQ.text: We love this place! Every Wednesday night after my Basketball game, my family and I always come here for dinner! I've been to many Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas and I can honestly say Aloha Kitchen is my favorite and has the best Kalbi Ribs in town!!!! I normally order their Portuguese Sausage breakfast meal cause I love breakfast and they have the best in town with that meal as well! My wife and son love their Miso soup and their Spam Musubi is on point! Regardless what you order, you have to get a side of Kalbi Ribs! I can make poetry about those Ribs lol...

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D-61ozu5BbCfBl2OoLpL0Q.text: First time eating Hawaiian food in Vegas and was not disappointed. And this is coming from a local, so you know it's legit! The quality of food is best than most.   Banana pancakes with vanilla cream are what dreams are made of!!! Literally I could have got a stack of 20 and used it as a pillow!  If your in the area, this a must do on your list! Will be back for sure!

PHwxSyfJlKlSJO3pOi7m0w.text: Yo! Like I used to be ALL 4 Aloha Kitchen. But BOY am I BEYOND disappointed with it. Like I ALWAYS get the Beef Teriyaki Bowl & 2night was an EPIC FAIL! I FELT LIKE I was eating DOG FOOD BRO! Like on some real Shxt. Don't believe me? Check out the pictures I posted! I'm disgusted & super disappointed. I legit feel like they got a can of dog food..slapped some teriyaki sauce on it...threw it on top of some rice & called it a day. Smh. It was so gross & had such a disgusting consistency. The beef sucked so much man. It was so bad that I threw it away 2 the trash, where it belonged & INSTANTLY hopped on here 2 let yall in on this thing they call "beef". Can yall bring the OLD BEEF back PLEASE!? Like the thick chunks...NOT this shredded hot mess yall call food. Smh. Hella disappointed!  I won't be coming back to this place anytime soon. & it's not the 1st time they switch up the beef...they did the same thing last year...for a hot minute & for that whole time I didn't go to Aloha, but as soon as I found out they brought back the REAL beef, I went back...but now..looks like I'm Ghosting Aloha yet again!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So NASTY!!!! Ya&#39;ll call this &#34;beef&#34;?!
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This looks like straight up DOG FOOD! Not only does it look gross, trust &amp; believe it tastes as NASTY &amp; DISGUSTING as it looks! ‍

xB4pT60QLMtEqePK7kLEqQ.text: I feel like we've been here before but at the same time it seemed new to me. Lots of parking outside. The place has clearly been around for a while. There's a karaoke bar connected to it branded the same as well. We visited after 830pm and it was a quiet Friday night. The staff was really nice, calling us baby, honey, sweetheart. I'm guilty of doing the same thing.  I had the bbq chicken, my big son had chicken katsu, the small one had friend saimin, and the hubby had the garlic chicken with gravy, we shared fries and a musubi kids meal. We had some turon and poke...I'm a sucker for register add one and the turon was just staring at me as I ordered.  We chose dine-in option and were given a number for our table and sat. It's a order then seat yourself type of place. I noticed that they don't keep certain condiments not eh tables, but behind the counter instead. So if you need tobacco or sriracha, ask them! They have it for ya!  Our orders came our fairly quickly and my bbq chicken was excellent. Poke wasn't that awesome, fried saimin was okay too, but the fries for some reason were soooo good! Fries on point! I can't speak for anything else, as I murdered my bbq chicken plate and turon, so I was too full to sample anything else. Didn't visit the restroom during this occasion. I'd definitely visit again if we were ever in the immediate area. We were jumping at the trampoline place across the street before we came in this evening.

lVZ-MA3cKoe49mrDLLY1Lg.text: Usually pretty good. Ordered the local plate last weekend and the teriyaki beef was extra oily. The must've had an off night, so I wont gold it against them. The teriyaki chicken and musubis that it came with was perfect as always.

_qXe9sQBHq_I5O-0-UfdcQ.text: Food is always delicious and portions are great for the price.  Customer service is always on point.

GWrF_5SJoWPO0l9NvmKcsA.text: Absolutely Love this place! The BBQ Chicken is to die for. This is my go to spot for Authentic Island Style Plate lunch anytime I'm in Las Vegas! And the Live Music is a definitely plus and it's open super late!

7IqpOBEbk4Me3MHqOP5U5w.text: 2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge 86/100  Not bad, but definitely not my go to place for Hawai'ian food. Trust me, I'm from Hawai'i and there are much better places around town.   It's weird but some of my friends who are originally from California seem to like this place. :-P  If I do come here, I don't get Hawai'ian style food. Last time I was here I got a cheeseburger. I wouldn't go out of my way for this but it was good, huge cheeseburger.   This one has a karaoke bar, the other ones don't. So it has it's appeal if you're into that.

X21nYKW3qp3vbXj1VRp0DA.text: Man this spot has been my favorite Hawaiian spot in town since high school and college. Their pricing is just perfect for you to try even on a low income budget.  There teriyaki sauce is the best bar none.  The only thing left for me to try there is their Luau pork.  I'm waiting for the winter to come. I don't like eating soups in the summer time. They make me sweat.  Loyal fan for life. I wish they would open one by centennial hills. Lulu BBQ just isn't the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious.

CFbKY9Ql_sEyVtOMoXqJUQ.text: Great food great people great service. They greet you soon as you step in the door. They always make my food right the first time and I always leave there happy and full. Need I say more!!!!

rT7luTMsM-L9zGBlmXazaA.text: i tried the adobo fried rice omelette. it was a little over portioned and i mean bigger than the normal big but the ingredients was good, i just wish it had a little more seasoning and more of an adobo flavor and not just soy sauce. it's not too expensive here but i wouldn't eat here as a regular lunch spot just because of the drive and so much food i was in a comaaaaa lol

kpZ4N2lQ_m_2dZ303pJbjg.text: Staffs are nice! Good foods.  They ask for ID when you pay with card and they have atm if you forgot your id.

VAPuuFzmqDl_v2t31fmapQ.text: Awesome Place! Work in the same parking lot where they're located. First time here. Automatically noticed how clean the place it and the workers are super friendly and well groomed. Food came out fast and its is awesome 11/10 totally coming back here again and again :)

opyiwPOkQ2ZjDeEMd_bg7A.text: I've been coming here faithfully for years now.  They're open really late which fits my schedule nicely.    There's a bar where they do karaoke and when that door opens you can easily have that music blasting inside the restaurant.  Horrible singers too, psssh I could be worse.  The staff is nice and friendly but the cashier or helper in the back has to be responsible also to clean up the tables so they sometimes miss a spot or two just so they can get back to the register.    But the benefactor that bumps this up to 4 stars over an average three is the flexible hours for some of us drunks tha need Hawaiian prepared food after midnight!

KgZ-6mOb8F07eswz7aGo3A.text: This is my first time visiting an Aloha Kitchen. My coworkers and I ordered several plates to go. There was a line when we arrived, but it went fast. I wanted to try the Local Plate. The macaroni had to be tossed because I found a small white rock in it. I contacted the manager Marla and I explained the issue to her. I was given her cell phone number, so I can text her several copies of the pictures. Marla mentioned that she'll show the pictures to the kitchen. Per the assistant manager, the issue will be taken care of. Thank you all for taking care of the issue quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I started chewing the macaroni salad and  I found this rock in the salad, so it had to be tossed.

2fyDXQichLW0u0kkXnCkog.text: The best Filipino/hawaiian food in Vegas.  Spicy fried rice omelette and lumpia are the best bets.

O8IOyVLU8zWzfUKnmTDhoA.text: Good food, lousy service. We used to frequent aloha, but lately the service is just so bad I can't bring myself to spend money there. The younger cashiers lack aloha and the older lady was flat out rude the last time we were there. She spent 15 minutes arguing with me that I ordered something I didn't. Thankfully I had my receipt to show her what I ordered. Too many Hawaiian food places in Vegas to put up with subpar service.

NMnkTsJVED6tUoK8P-BPOA.text: One of the best Hawaiian foods in town. I definitely recommend trying this spot out. The staff is very friendly and I introduced a lot of people to this spot and everyone always had good remarks. The local plate is very full filling and great

edL-jn2UC_tv6FyxrrSkhA.text: This location is much nicer than the one on the east side. Decent fining room. Food is always good.

wAJKlmxxCZ9f-JS7zVuIrg.text: Always great!! Wonderful service as well. The karaoke bar attached is fun for groups.

BmD1TMWvScxgMmszjONgiA.text: The food is fresh. The service is quick. The real star of the show though is the bar next door.  If you love belting out tunes and sipping drinks, this cool karaoke bar is the place for you. The DJ, not only hosts karaoke but keeps the party going with current dance hits and a few classics.   I definitely had a blast here. I will go back.

7waMqCyCEm1fEr2RhPw6xg.text: The teriyaki chicken is smothered with too much teriyaki sauce and its soupy. next time I ordered I had the sauce on the side but the chicken itself taste burnt and rubbery. I also had their kalbi but its bony not enough meat for me to really enjoy, the flavor though is good. My husband like the garlic chicken but it taste burnt to me. The rice is too mushy but their serving is good. The only thing I enjoy here is their spam musubi. They have great customer service but I wouldnt come often unless I dont have a choice

ELwAjwNkyWAZiNtfJ2ENwQ.text: Service is awesome, served with Aloha and prices are legit. Definitely coming back here again when visiting Las Vegas. Food portions are huge & ono. Comfortable large area to service our 20 plus ohana members from Oahu, Seattle & Alaska. ALOHA!!!

vt0DPmoU5BwI0-wYED4ByA.text: The food is so good and the staff are friendly. Definitely would return. The adobo fried rice and lumpia had great flavor. Enjoyed every bite and the portions are perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice and a side order of lumpia.

RiS7sDRQxvm0R4ERPuvI3w.text: Went here yesterday afternoon. 2nd time in the location. Ordered the same food. Loco Moco. And it's not good like the last time I had. The gravy is good but the patty is not. It taste kinda bad,sour. While the first one, the patty taste good. And the service is not that friendly unlike last time. Maybe the food and service is better at night than afternoon.

9CdrU1Q0RK_IfLM1Qv-LWQ.text: Great place, great food for a reasonable price. The staff is friendly and very helpful. I come here on my lunch break at least a couple of times a week.

nN4b92VdXPNv4EcuNQxKsw.text: Good place and good crews  i like their menu. They give us free food. And fast service as always.

Hbh-nHtqk6T84nXbZ57gJw.text: Absolutely love everything on the menu!  The staff are ok....not rude but no top notch either.  Reason for minus 1 star, my order took forever and the joint ain't even half full.

OzSWbYsoAnUUvC0hH24DQg.text: Really good place !!!! Highly recommended  5 - stars for portion and taste We got banana pancakes and also adobo fried rice was on point .

BvnNELWZh4FCQnP7RJ82pA.text: I used to always hit up this spot late night because of their hours. It was decent enough to come back each time, but if there were other spots open later, I would definitely go to other spots. I almost always order their local plate, which is beef and chicken teriyaki and 2 spam musubis, and I substitute the rice for veggies because I don't like all those carbs, and I also substitute the macaroni salad for kim chi. I have tried plenty of this other dishes as well, but my favorite thing about their menu is the kim chi, which I'm sure says a lot. It's just an average meal, hence the 3 stars.   However, the last time we did end up going here, my boyfriend had food poisoning from their curry. And now he won't ever return here, which, I guess isn't too much of a loss..

5rYMfX2irAadsJlbSbL3rA.text: My friends and I ordered a lot of things from this place and shared our food family style.  We ordered the adobo fried rice omelette, macaroni salad, chicken BBQ, spam musubi, chicken katsu, kalua pig and katsu combo, and the loco moco.  Some of these were good, others okay (and needed more flavoring).  If you never had Hawaiian food before, I would definitely give it a try at least once.

r5l6Po6PaGhW-Ooai9PQug.text: I ordered the mix plate and it had beef, chicken and fish. First bite was really good and maybe because I was hungry. After that I found the food quite sweet. It's like teriyaki sauce everywhere.   The rice was awesome. It had some kind of oil that made it nice and sticky and shiny. The Mac was yucky. Fish was battered in egg and i don't really like that. I personally don't like pan fried eggs. Chicken was good at least it's normal tasting. The beef was sweet with too much sauce.  Juice was interesting Hawaiian sun. I got the guava nectar.  Not bad but not like wow. I might come back will see.

gNvivE5YPgfrgOjcr-Je6Q.text: In the last 5-6 times that I have ordered to go, they have managed to mess up my order in some way. The last 5 times they have shorted me Mac salad. On the 6th time which was a 2 days ago I ordered there kaluha pig no cabbage. When I got home the sauce had completely leaked out of the container and all over the other food. I called them to complain about it. Instead of apologizing the girl behind the counter blamed me asking "did you drop it or something"! This was the worst service ever! I would not eat here again if the food was free. I wasn't asking for a refund or anything. I just wanted them to be more cognizant of what was going on.   I wouldn't recommend anybody to eat hear if you care about the way you are treated! By far one of the worst experiences ever.

eUx4znszTBt57VEKx6Tisw.text: Happy I found this place. I finally found oxtail noodle soup which is difficult to find here in Vegas. I was so surprise to get a generous portion of noddles and large pieces of oxtail. Definitely a winner and I will be returning

_n3H-6rfNCZ_j-ZmyPuokw.text: Need a late night Hawaiian Joint? This is your spot!  Cyndel is my girl! Someone give her a raise!

0gqLUIeLF9P1ZYVfsy110Q.text: Love the food here and service! Every time I go I find something new I like on the menu to the point I could eat here a few times a week and have something different each time that I really enjoyed. From their oxtail ramen to their pork sliders, it's all so good! I have even tried the other locations and this one for some reason just beats it out, especially their macaroni salad! The lady at the register is always such a doll and the definition of good customer service! Love this place 5 stars all day for here!

7L_AIB5KaRk6P-ziX1U7Tg.text: Aloha Hawaiian Kitchen is the bomb. The yummy bomb. Not the terrorist kind. Their food is exploding with flavor and you'll be exploding later. I recommend this restaurant for anyone wanting to experience a culinary orgasm. Your man isn't treating you right?!? Aloha Kitchen will hit all the spots..... guaranteed. The bar does smell like a combination of musty redneck crack and will definitely make you cry. That's not a joke. Enter at your own risk. I'm writing this review for the free Lumpia!!!

YUy4jMqGUDCk5M8W63kohQ.text: The food is so good and Priced Right. There's something on the menu for everybody. It's good for all ages. The food is outrageously good

pgOJ4muUl5O0BUfqcjIisg.text: Craving for local food as I yelped this place and tastes like the food back home in Hawaii. Ate breakfast here and my kids and Hubby was satisfied and content after .

zhswkQpdMnnsivInDEFeLQ.text: Aloha kitchen has never let me down when it comes to the service I've received and the food that comes with it.  There are so many interesting options to try and while some of them I didn't enjoy as much as other, I still didn't feel like I wasted my money.    The staff at this location are always pleasant and, if there is going to be a wait, they let you know up front rather than making sit there waiting for your food.    Lastly, for the amount of food you tend to get with your order, the price they are asking for is more than worth.

nbkGEUuGNJVKgo7N0RmnJA.text: Local Hawaiian food. New menue. I like the Ox Tail soup and Ox Tail in Ramin. I eat the Ox Tail and the wife eats the noodles. The wife loves the Kalua and cabbage. The Ninth Isle Ukelele Club also practices on Tuesdays, 6:00 (except August), at the attached bar.

hqCfLPs83lgpwbPNd2jfFw.text: Consistently great service and food always!  Highly recommended.  Even the burger is surprisingly good.  The best part is it's in my neighborhood and is opened late!

FYCHMcTgTkOVPwc7Iy8rOA.text: Very upset , Kalbi ribs are burnt and don't have a lot of meat on them . The Katsui meat was very thin and over cooked . Might as well eat beef jerky at this point . VaDnogose8V9nrON0rH0jA.text: This is the worst Hawaiian BBQ place in Las Vegas. Literally any other choice if Hawaiian BBQ you could pick would be better. I can't believe I just paid 10 dollars and waited close to 15 minutes for a teeny tiny piece of chicken katsu on a mound of bland rice and a little bowl of curry chicken. Seriously?? You could pick birdbox style on a freaking map blindfolded and find a better choice than this. The portions of meat were about half as much as most Hawaiian BBQ places I've been to... And the little curry bowl had a giant chunk of carrot and also a giant chunk of potato taking half the volume of the container.. Are you seriously that cheap? The cashier also tried to convince me to spend about 5 dollars more than anything on the menu just to get a combination of Loco moco and chicken katsu, available at, you guessed it, literally any other Hawaiian BBQ restaurant as a standard combo. Also, the chicken was definitely crappy dark meat. Thanks for the regrets.
