There are local hawaiian food places scattered around vegas MUCH MUCH MUCH better than this place, because you can tell that the owners and workers are actually FROM Hawaii and know what the hell they're doing.

eXRTbQcgFzO1aMXrsCUahg.text: We went here for lunch since it was recommended by a friend who frequents Las Vegas. The place is small and not a good place for a large party. Service was HORRIBLE! The waitress didnt greet us when we walked it then after waiting 10 minutes after we sat down, she came up to us and asked us if we were ready to order.... SERIOUSLY?! We didnt even have a menu yet. GEEZ. The food was okay. my husband and I had the Kalua pig and Katsu combo and we regret it. The Kalua pig was way to salty and dry. My stepmom had the adobo and the pork was really dry too. I will not return here again, I'd rather got to L&L.

0_DtxpeVPnqMss60ixba0Q.text: this is an update, I've finally had the chance to try the food!  so as the yelpers have said, I did decide to try the adobo fried rice. It's very good! I had some good chunks of meat in there. My friends just had beef teriyaki and shared a piece with me- it's very delicious as well! My brother had loco moco and loved it! They bring your meal to you via table number. I liked having hip hop music play, it's a nice atmosphere. I really do want to make this place a favorite spot!

fLABsYwlhVS0MmS4t9-JrQ.text: good adobo omelette. i never actually crave the food though with the prices.

VGlz9kulihe1eYnqgreWzg.text: So i gotta say im always on a mission to find great local food which in my case local food being from hawaii. And ive heard alot of good things about this place i was not disappointed! The food was def. priced well and the portion size was perfect. The quality of the food was def good as well! The reviews that others have wrote are so so but from hearing other locals in person telling me about this place it made my decision to actually give it a try. If anyone from hawaii is craving good local food this spot is def worth the stop! Price is reasonable and so are the portion sizes!

itAHt6fZ7BvNZ0brJaUqjw.text: Whenever my friends and I visit Vegas, we have to come to Aloha Kitchen. The adobo omelette is sooo good and so large it's ridiculous. How I wish there was an Aloha Kitchen in San Diego so I could eat an adobo omelette everyday.

6R_3iCZScNFsLSJkr7YALw.text: I came here with a friend at 1am after we tried going to 777 at Main Street Station which was closed for the night.  So, this was next on the list of places to get loco moco after a night of drinking.  The place is tucked away in a shopping center and is conveniently located next to a karaoke bar in case you're in the mood for some singing to go with your food.  I would have to say that the loco moco here was good but not impressive.  My friend ordered egg with spam which looked pretty good and he confirmed that it was.  Maybe next time, I'll try eggs with spam.

mvfBzVi3Bl14fxCgxe6a2Q.text: food is good, i like their siamin soup...i wish their kalbi wasn't so fatty though.   i think their prices are a little too much for the quality of their food though and one thing i hate is when they give me so little napkins, i mean i get it, some people are so dunb they waste a fckn shitload of napkins and i do hate that...but if i order kalbi and will be using my hands, i expect to have at least a few napkins!!!  overall, my and my friends used to go here alot, its a clean place and the decor is cool.

ZPlKSUwB3kEufrxcF4TbrA.text: Open super late on weekends. I love this restaurant! Anything I've ever ordered has tasted great and was big enough to share with someone else.  Lots of seating (even when all the drunkies are there super late) plus, its funny to hear the drunkies singing next door in the karaoke bar.

9LMphuwNbl0pjnnX49prdA.text: Aloha Kitchen on Decatur is a godsend if you are visiting Vegas and craving some good, cheap Hawaiian or Filipino food and can make the 5-10 minute drive off the strip (this is also a good time to make a snack/water/drink/booze run at a local grocery). This review is all about one item which has become legendary amongst my circle of friends. The Adobo Fried Rice Omelet. It's a pretty simple concept: shredded chicken adobo and fried rice (that looks as if it was fired in the adobo sauce itself) are wrapped in a thin layer of scrambled egg. The result is a burrito-sized omelet of adobo goodness! The fried rice is always nice and moist and the chicken is just the same. The flavors of the adobo sauce are immediately evident, the savory soy sauce, tangy vinegar and the garlic are present in every bite, with the egg adding an additional texture to contrast the rice and chicken. Oh, and this thing is BIG. I don't think I've ever eaten a whole omelet in one sitting. I usually save half for later or share with a friend. I imagine I could defeat the beast if I focused on it, but I'm usually too hungover or too concerned about the buffet that is to follow later in the day to ever attempt the feat. If you like adobo, you need to try the adobo fried rice omelet! For those unfamiliar with Filipino-style adobo: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ad... I've also sampled the lumpia (think Filipino-style eggrolls) and the turon (dessert lumpia with banana and jackfruit) and liked them both, but our motto in Vegas has become "eyes on the prize!" All we get now is the omelet.

y08-q9E8VzQq3IpAPbT-ZA.text: Came here with family during a week trip to Vegas.  I just went there last week and I'm normally up for whole in the wall places so long as their food is good.  But this place I didn't really find anything worth remembering.  I ordered the loco moco.  It didn't have much taste and I tried to give away my food to the rest of the family.  A few of us ordered the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet which I tasted and thought was not really worth coming back to.  Unfortunately I will not be back.  I think the only saving grace is the price is somewhat reasonable. I do really like the Hawaiian restaurant they have at the Cal much better.

ir5-vZL3_bB7sOZ_e3haTg.text: Adobo rice was just ok. No haupia and cash only gives this place three stars. Spam musubi was decent tho.

AnBQbJgpwUA9JsaGnp9cWQ.text: Kalua pork, lumpia, spam musubi, tapsilog, katsu, saimin soup, loco moco,  chicken adobo fried rice omelette--available late at night after the club!!! Yup, I did say "chicken adobo fried rice omelette"! Need I say more? This place is the spot to satisfy your Hawaiian lunch plate w/ Filipino and Japanese flare craving at any time of the day! They have three convenient location in Las Vegas. Onoliciously masarap!!!

at5RtM47130WVGAP9y_HYQ.text: Pretty decent Hawaiian eats, not too expensive and large portions. No problem parking. (It's in a strip mall at the southwest corner of Sahara and Decatur - had I known about it sooner when my younger brother used to live in the apartment complex next door I woulda hopped the fence in a minute!)

v8Dxsdck7cQFPDFccJ7Nfw.text: If you are looking to sing karaoke, have a few drinks, eat some loco moco afterwards...you've come to the right place! The DJ was awesome and the service was great! I have to say my favorite dish here is the loco moco and the spam musubi, you can't go wrong with that. Wednesday night is ladies night and ladies get 1 free drink per hour!

bKI4wBqoqgBI18tDBkcE-A.text: I was not trying to eat here, but ended up at this place by accident.  Since Google is not a great indicator when places go belly up and my original destination was the now defunct Red Robins in the same parking area this was a " what the hell, I'm hungry" kind of place.  Loved it!!!  They had a little bit of everything.  I went for the teriyaki plate and some lumpia.  I could have done without the skin on the chicken but loved the lumpia.  It was so mild, and I didn't get a bit of heartburn.  If they had an Aloha Kitchen anywhere near where I lived I would have a new favorite.

0F0_b8ZzkoCkUon9p7gxkQ.text: How I wish there was one in NY! Damn their food is good =) has a warm home feeling, adobo omelet is the business while my girl friend will tell you to get the pulled pork! You can't lose!!! =)

_VN6vSCaUJzQ4Vt1cZCkGw.text: I had one of the worst experiences I've ever had at a restaurant tonight at aloha kitchen. Multiple members of the staff were extremely rude, and argumentative. I has born and raised in Hawaii, and for a place to call themselves "aloha kitchen" it would be nice if you were serve your food with aloha instead of attitude. Horrible service!!! Not coming back, and I would suggest that everyone else find a different spot as well.

bURFS9SJLrT8M-T6UJj3uQ.text: How can I give you good reviews, Aloha Kitchen, if you no let me in?!   They don't open at 8 even though yelp and their doors state that. They open and close whenever they want. Here at 815 and they told me they'll probably open in an hour. She told me this WHILE posting a sign that said "closing at 2pm."   From the check in tips, looks like an ongoing problem.  Boo.

JvbI4U7oHwFXaIzKKW-xgg.text: So I've never even seen this place before until I was invited to celebrate a birthday at happy hour with friends last night.  Whenever I'm going to a new place or restaurant I depend on my fellow yelpers to direct my path.  Will it suck or not?  I must say I truly enjoyed the happy hour at Aloha Kitchen & Bar.  First of all the drinks are nice and strong and cheap (even past happy hour).  The atmosphere is comfy cozy - just what I like.  At that nice early hour of the evening we had our pick of seating.  There are comfy couches as well.  You have to go and get your drink for the most part - but who cares?  The bar tender sometimes doubled as the karaoke technician - again who cares?  When I was ready for my Patron shot - he was there to pour it.  That's all that mattered.  Everyone here was very accommodating to our mildly-wild group.  There are plenty of karaoke books and selection - even rap if you wanna get jiggy with it - and the dance floor is spacious as well.  I like the outside smoking area that is gated in a bit but you still can sit there with your drink and your smoke and not miss a beat to the party.  Now the food!  Yum!!  That's right.  Yum!!! I had the Adobe Fried Rice Omelet, my daughter had the Teriyaki combo.  They were both phenomenal.  That Adobe Fried Rice is compact and delicious and full of goodness.  Check out the pics on Yelp!  It is the perfect meal after an evening of drinking!  Protein, carbs, meats - what's not to love?  I got it to go at the end of the evening and my intent was to save it for lunch at work the next day.  That poor yummy specimen barely made it to the next light!    This is a nice chill place, very nice prices and fun atmosphere on both sides.  There is a door that separates the restaurant from the bar side.  And remember the bar is non-smoking so you have to go outside in the sitting area to do that.  You will have a good time!

iW4N6ngztRdBY-nqzacaew.text: Seriously?! I haven't done a review for this place yet? Huh, I guess not. Well its one of the better spots for Hawaiian BBQ. If getting lunch there, I'd suggest placing a take out order unless you're gonna eat there because lunch is a crazy time. Food is way better than any L&L's I've eaten at and since I can't make it down to Henderson for Ross J's or into Spring Valley for Island Flavors than this will have to do. Uncle Russ at Island Style can do only so much since he shares half the menu with Korean dishes and that spot is always popping as well. So yes I keep coming back for the quick and decent Hawaiian food most hawaiian BBQ spots can't pull off. I've tried pretty much everything and haven't really found a fault in their menu. They even serve some Filipino deserts which are good lunch time treats for me. Prices are more than reasonable, nothing over 10. I would suggest they offer a delivery service. Definitely cash in on more sales that way.

0lKMJQB_rBzJ0KIgGQLiIQ.text: The food's good, but their customer service wasn't up to par. When I walked in, this guy at the front didn't even greet me nor look up. Idk what he was doing, but with his head down, he said, "I'll be right with you." Then the woman at the front who took my order had a bit of an attitude and made snarky remarks whenever I had a question about the menu. Idk their names, but the guy was Hispanic and a little short. And the woman had a Hawaiian accent and wore glasses. I'll probably only be back for the food, and not their customer service.

HGzMow4oyOx0fsRalJOnRw.text: It has been a minute since I last came by.  It looks like there have been some aesthetic upgrades since many last visit.  The menu is now displayed on several flat screen TV'S.  The seating is nicely furnished and the staff is friendly and welcoming as always.  Not sure if they still hold karaoke events nightly here, but, it is definitely a popular spot for some plate lunch grinds.    As you may or may not be aware of...there is a high amount of Islanders in Las Vegas.  This translates into a high amount of Hawaiian style eateries.  In my humble opinion, Aloha Kitchen does not "wow" me much with their menu.  They are mediocre at best with their staples.  However, where Aloha Kitchen makes up for this, is with menu items that can't be found everywhere.    For instance, just the name of adobo friend rice instantly turns you into a rubber necker doing double takes.  It's difficult to choose anything else unless you tried it for the first time.  Not bad, but not special, although, no other place serves this to my knowledge.  I hope the avid Aloha kitchen heads don't take offense to my review, but simply put, I have had better.  Ross J's don't necessarily tickle my pickle and and L&L's doesn't quite float my boat in this respect either.  Hands down...I have to roll with Big Island Flavor with a close tie by Island Style, Rice Tracks & Ohana's.  If Hawaiian Hale still existed, they would be near the top indeed.  It's all about preference, and I tend to judge a lot on particular aspects such as mac salad and so forth.  You can bet if I get the itch for the homeland grinds, AK was still be considered.  Aloha Yelp Fam!

p3B5OPLICqOPQYMnp5Bu8g.text: Their kalua pig, chicken katsu, mixed veggies, and spam masubi is awesome!!! Your total can be pricey but it's worth it.

Swv3aH6YBff7vS8o0p1bEQ.text: This place was somehow strange to me. You order at the counter, sit down at one of their nice dining tables and then they hand off your food to you. Meanwhile, there's a fast-food beverage dispenser for your sodas, waters, and tea in the corner. The LCD displays for the menu is cool.  It's like, "hey Anh, we like you and all but we're like a Roberto's that you get stuff yourself, but hey we'll deliver your food right to your table. Don't expect us to see you again to check on you." It's funny to me. It's a clean fast food restaurant, but with a "pick up your food and GTFO or here, please sit down in these nice chairs." Think Teriyaki Madness but it's small-business owned.    We ordered for two Loco mocos. What better way to cure a hangover by 3PM right?  Loco moco missed the mark. Nothing to write home about. Like if I was in Vegas and you lived in San Diego as my facebook friend, I wouldn't be all, "DUDE. You have to try out this loco moco." Super plain. Not very well-seasoned. As soon as my knife sliced into it, the yolk was hard (barely runny at all). I want to see that over-easy egg's guts all over my rice. I felt cheated! Hamburger patty was too tough, which made it chewy than it should be. Not quite flavorful.   I left feeling dissatisfied. Not hungry, just sad. Maybe I just wanted the rich heart-attack-inducing feel of a loco moco. The mac salad it came with was alright.  I like how clean this place is. Really nice tables and chairs. I like the separate water dispenser from the soda machine. A nice take-out place sort of feel. Prices were about right for what it was.  I don't really see what all the hype is about, but I think it deserves another chance.

8F2WE9aPyyLIAyq9IRCx0w.text: Glad I found this spot. Loved the adobo and adobo fried rice omelet. Haven't had a chance to try the other stuff but everything that I saw really reminded me of back home aka Hawaii. Next time I'll try the Hawaiian plate! Definitely coming back next time I'm in LasVegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelet!

oU5RhxQHAfxzxJHj7McSKQ.text: Go for the adobo omelette! It's a huge portion so make sure your stomach's ready for it. Tapsilog is also a must but gotta get it early coz they always sell out of it. Everything I've had off their menu has been good and the service is always great. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BOMB adobo omelette!!!

9rHWKDoJozhto45wTo4R5Q.text: The melting pot of hawaii, in vegas! I love the different choices they have, Kim chee, saimin, musubi, adobo, lau lau. So many island favorites to choose from. I get the adobo fried rice omelette. Really good. Food was hot. Fresh and huge! Yumm!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelette.

_tYqV-VtpUtRkfHneTQFjA.text: Going into this place always makes me think of the Hawaiian take-out joints back home. I haven't been back in a while, but I ordered some BBQ chicken to go today.   Not that the place was tastefully decorated to begin with, however when I walked in there today, it looked even more run down than I remembered it. It looked like they had taken down things from their walls, many items on their menu were covered up with white paper, which I'm sorry, I think is very ghetto. Scotch taping a piece of white paper on the soda labels to show which one they are out of?! Generic white styrofoam cups? I don't know. Just looked like lots of little things, probably to cut costs.  The cashier was nice, my order came out timely, but I walked out of there thinking, "Am I going to come back here?"   I thought that until I opened my order. BBQ chicken I remember I loved, tender, juicy, even the rice was still hot. My son, as we speak, is inhaling the leftovers. Their portions were always generous.  That's probably why I'm giving them 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ chicken plate. All Rice, no Mac :)

QNg7bnGLrr8qn5USiv_IVA.text: Today I walked in and ordered for my wife and I. We waited 40 mins to get our order and the woman at the register said the reason why my order was taking so long was because 1 one of the items on our plates took longer to cook than the others. Finally when our food was ready that 1 item that took so long to cook was Cold ! The whole plate was cold! I was expecting steaming hot deliciousness instead I got pure disappointment! I just asked for a refund because I'm not waiting another 40 mins, for another plate, instead I'll go to L&L Hawaiian barbecue...

T3721jdD8aAve-GsGD3Ikw.text: One of my favorite places to go for food. Service is always good, and the Chasu Pork Fried Rice Lover's Omelette, which is super worth for 7.69! Cyndel behind the counter always remembers my name, even though weeks pass. Definitely recommend whenever possible!

bkwqLGavK6887q69hBGImQ.text: SO MUCH FUN!! The bartender is so kind and has an awesome 'stache, and the DJ is friendly, funny, and awesome!! This was my first time doing a karaoke song (almost by myself) and everyone was so cool and kind (staff and customers). Cripes, there are some people here who can siiiiiing!!!

KFhKrVO06JiJaBlGgNFg3w.text: I haven't ate at any Hawaiian/Filipino fusion places here yet and this has to be a first! They had a selection of foods that I was unsure of what to get, whether it was that I was craving filipino food or hawaiian food. So I went for the combination mix plate, which came with a piece of teriyaki chicken, steak, and mahimahi fish. I saw other people order the Adobo omelette and I would probably come back again to order that. It was huge and looked amazing.

H77dwpt6F2a2UQVQceYN8w.text: Now this place is good for good food for a decent buck. I usually get the teriyaki chicken bowl and for 3.99 it's actually pretty good. But I tried their chicken adobo this morning and it was the worst chicken adobo I have ever had. There was no sauce at all. The plate was drenched in oil. The adobo was so goddamn old and the meat was fucking disgusting.   Now listen, I'm not bashing Aloha Kitchen, I still think that they have a decent selection of food for a fair price. Go to this place, and try anything else, I'm sure you will enjoy it! But whatever you do, stay away from the adobo.

uA7EU_9IL5rIe-fb_dwXCg.text: Gotta love Aloha Kitchen!! Today's customer service experience wasn't as good as I normally get any other time but that doesn't take away from the fantastic food!! I am a huge fan of the chicken katsu with extra teriyaki sauce but today I wanted to do the local plate which comes with teriyaki chicken, beef and two spam masubi's! Yum!! They are for the most part fast on the food and getting it out to you when you choose to dine in but today was extremely slow because there must have been a terrible discrepancy  in the customer before me had ordered! Which then cause our order to be put to the back! Short ribs are a really good choice as well! I will definitely be back so they can redeem themselves because today was less than average regardless of what's going on the customer service HAS to stay on point!

Ty1GL7GyoBi9NK7w-Ec6CQ.text: Two years later, the same concerns. I tried to order yesterday, as I was CRAVING some chicken katsu. I called, was asked if I could hold for a moment. Sure, I can wait.  I can year as the cashier takes a customer's order, then another, then another, then ANOTHER. Then, picks up the phone and hangs it up.   If they didn't want to take my order, they could have easily just said, "We don't want your money," or hung up on me straight away.  Looks like I will be going to the other locations to satisfy my cravings, I'm too tired of being hung up on, being on hold long enough to drive to the location, wait in line, then give my order, or get back to work and having them forget to put in the sauce for my Chicken Katsu.  No more disappointments from Aloha Kitchen on Decatur. You all should get some customer service training, or just keep doing what you're doing & hope your customers can forgive the inability to do what restaurants are supposed to do.

QtOcceBCsGkN8Mu8hCAU5Q.text: I am extremely annoyed. I work overnight in the emergency room from 8 pm-6 am. I called Aloha Kitchen to place an order for carry out at 7:15. The girl who took my order had me spell my name out and took down my phone number. I placed my order with the intention of picking it up on my way in to work. She confirmed my order, told me the price, and confirmed that I was to pick it up at the Sahara/Decatur location. I got to the restaurant at 7:43. The guy at the register was busy taking another phone order, so I waited a few minutes. When he got off the phone I told him I was there to pick up my order that I had called in. He told me he didn't have any orders under my name. He even asked me if there was a different name that I might have used... What the hell!?!? I was now going to be late for work WITHOUT any food to eat for 10 hours. When I got to my car, I even called the same phone number I had called when I placed the order, and the guy at the register answered... pretty f*-d up. Get your sh*t together.

FmIg4H71JWfnMUdq9T3DTg.text: This is a nice little place with some good food.  I'm not a huge fan of Hawaiian food, mostly because I hate pineapple with a passion, but a friend of ours wanted to go sing karaoke, so we tried it out.  This place is a restaurant with a karaoke bar next door.  At the bar, the drinks are about $5 - $6, but I have to say they're pretty weak.  I got the feeling that you don't really go to the bar to drink, you go more to watch the karaoke singers.  I myself am too chicken to get up there and sing, but more power to the people who do!  One of the people I came with said, "There are three types of karaoke singers: ones who are really good, ones who think they're good but are really bad, and ones who know they're bad and don't give an *ish* because they're having fun."  I definitely saw all three types that night.  Oh, and a guy who looked like Michael Jackson and Prince combined...he sang "Music of the Night"...both the Christine and Raul parts...it was amazing.  You can order food and they will bring it to you in the bar, too, which is pretty cool.  I had the garlic chicken which totally lived up to it's name and thank God had no pineapple anywhere near it, and was sooooo tender I just shredded it off with a fork.  My husband ordered the adobo fried rice and loved it.  I may be a Hawaiian food convert after coming to this place (just so long as there is no VILE FRUIT in it) and would like to experience the karaoke again.  This place is just like the 3 stars says: A-OK.

MCRunngdSLXHwW1MfLYDkg.text: Service is crap!!  I ordered teriyaki chicken and they charged me .27 cents for teriyaki sauce.  I mean really??  With the nickel and dime crap.  This alone will never make me spend my money here again.  First and last time customer!

ocA87UP-vcOw2Iq_hDkrMw.text: I came here with my friend after trying to figure out what to eat after a good night out on new years eve.  Plus I haven't eaten hawaiian food in a real long time so I figure why not since friend already ate here before and loved it.    I like the decor.  It reminds me of Teri Cafe in San Diego.  There is plenty of parking since it's in a shopping center, which is a plus in my book.  I was surprised to see some filipino dishes on the menu but too bad we didn't get any.  This time we ordered the breakfast plate - 1 spam because I love spam and gotta have my spam and the other one was Portuguese sausage.  I'm not too big on the portuguese sausage so I thought it was alright.  But the spam plate was yummy.  It also reminded me of the mickey d's food in hawaii so that brought back some memories.  Prices are pretty decent too since coming from LA, they're a little bit cheaper than what we serve.  I would definitely go back if I'm in the area next time and craving some hawaiian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spam breakfast plate #2
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese sausage breakfast plate

CxOAephcazRkB-lhJ15KxA.text: Awesome food for sure. One point off because the bartender was super surly and we were the only ones in there. Plus side, the very friendly waitress brought out our food to us inside the bar. Manapuas are delicious and saimin and Mac salad were Ono.

xGLvKmIDuqPkx-IIhU857A.text: Best Hawaiian food in town. Love the hamburger steak and the loco moco with the sunny side up eggs on top! Excellent service!

XSHL9kIzsW5-SI3MllgRvw.text: This place is great also. Same Chain!! Adobo Fried Rice Omelette is Great!! I love there garlic chicken BUT the only problem is they put TO MUCH GARLIC POWDER! At times you can see it. (gross)  The difference is this place is open later!! wooo hoooo..  Never been to the bar area tho..

BH1CSo-SEpcEsr7at4sGyw.text: *Saturday March 29, 2014....Aina Roots Birthday Bash with Live Performances by Bengali x Las Vegas Reggae AllStars Ft.Ryan & Iz frm HaleAmanO x Aina Roots...No Cover Charge....Doors 9pm...21+

pytC9h6G2P8SLbM2QpQEaQ.text: I've been coming to Aloha Kitchen every month or so for the past 8 years. However, my past two experiences with the service at this specific location have been less than mediocre at best. Today, I came in to pick up some manapua for my daughter as she has been feeling ill. When I got home they were so undercooked that they had caved in on themselves and the meat was oozing raw dough. When I called to see if they could replace it, I was placed on hold and then hung up on. I called two more times with the same result. It really is a shame. This place used to be so good.

s_oJLBXstX_GyTKWKMBznQ.text: I used to love this place back in 04 days.. Now It's just.. I don't know what exactly happened.. The portion of the food seemed smaller (maybe the recession?). The food is still good ofcourse it's just amount of food that we got and the service. It wasn't the same as before. Me and my bf came in around 1am, because I just had gotten off work and I wanted to get some food before i went home.. When went in the restaurant we felt the vibe that we were not welcome.. and when the person served our food.. the guy started cleaning all the tables and making us and other people seem like intruders in the restaurant.. so me and my bf had to chow down everything in like 10 mins. The guy decide to lock the doors and it wasn't even 2 yet... I just don't understand the hours here..   If you want business.. then treat customers with priority.. Don't make them feel as if they need to hurry the eff up so you can get your asses home even if the store hours says that you should still be open anyway.. I mean i would come back but for the service.. I would rather try a different location or just stay with L&L..  better service and with good quality food.

-lmhF93cgxyTuQghSJbKDw.text: Aloha Kitchen is a nice little restaurant. I love the concept of it. The food is alright for what it's worth and for being in the mainland. The karaoke bar is cute. And the staff is always friendly.

E_TbFf4KNpiyNffIBGGIDg.text: The Aloha Kitchen we went to was on South Decatur Boulevard. They have another location on South Maryland Parkway that caters to the locals and UNLV students alike and I hear they have another one on Lamb Boulevard. Rumor also has it that these three locations are somehow affiliated with the Aloha Specialties store that we all know and love, located in the Cal in downtown, but that has been unconfirmed. Decorated with an almost over-the-top, stereotypical Hawaiiana theme (grass roofing, bamboo poles, brightly painted seating), the restaurant at least gave a certain sense of warmth and Hawaii feel. But nevah mine all of that. Let's get to the food! I wasn't all too hungry myself, since I had landed not more than a few hours prior, so I ended up just going for the burger and fries combo. I wasn't expecting much because I'm not much of a burger eater to begin with. Well, to my surprise, the cooks at Aloha Kitchen did good with this one. Really good. In fact, I would even go out on the limb and say that this was one of the best burgers I've ever had in my life. And believe me, I'm getting up there... this life is not a short one anymore. There was just something about this burger that made it ohhhh so tasty. The saltiness, the butteriness, the sesame-seed bunliness... YUM! If you go to Aloha Kitchen, you just gotta try this one. Read my complete column (with photos) here: world-wide-ed.com/2006/0...

r-FnySXDdYTexgwwDt_Caw.text: My go to place after school. The service is quick and the food is great. Also open late.

DfiQTSJS_kwvDzLlQg4dXw.text: Want the best Hawaiian islander Food????? GO TO THIS PLACE. I seriously love this place, Kalbi Combo is my dish. It's filling & so good. But i can munch on some spam musubi if I'm in a hurry. Customer service is great. Food is delicious. The best restaurant hands down.

tV7oG4aFyFHF-uldAsnpkw.text: Aloha Kitchen is my go to for Hawaiian food even though it is a far drive for me it is totally worth the drive, the food is awesome, customer service is even better, the restaurant is always clean, the seating is good. This place deserves 5 stars!!

SX94zIpN5B1HAvmLLqePvQ.text: This place has been around for years.... And I have been going for that many years!  BEST HAWAIIAN FOOD I've tasted here in Vegas.  Staff is SUPER FRIENDLY!!! As are All Hawaiians! Lol. But Loco Moco is AMAZING! Spam Eggs and Rice breakfast is yummy! Get lumpia.... Adobo fried rice omelette is amazing.... TRULY anything and everything you get you will love!!!

mzWXg6cNmA0lq1VplKYdcQ.text: One of my favorite places to eat. The adobo is just like grandma used to make. My mouth is watering just writing this.

4ZjKZCeeD0-eR9CKtACJtA.text: Aloha would always have earned a 4 for me in the past. But today, we ordered our usual corned beef hash dishes. The cornee beef serving was tiny. I guess they are trying to save money on their food now...

rl2YzzXr96b0hEr5GJLaVw.text: We are visiting from L.A. for my son's basketball tournament, and after spending a few hours at our hotel, we were looking for places to eat. We decided to go to Aloha Kitchen on Decatur blvd. At this restaurant,  there was great service along with some great food!  Today we got a delicious spam musubi,  kalbi (ribs) combo with chicken katsu, and the Local plate.  All was very tasty.  The spam musubi was awesome, good quality spam, warm rice, and fresh seaweed.  One of the best Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas!

UK-cF2s7Py7vu5SJej9obg.text: Always eat here with friends. Amazing atmosphere, really cool service. Will never stop coming here. Lol whether it's really late at night, they still there to make you some food. Lol

eCtfeIL84DTZ-_PspLmYTg.text: This is probably one of my favorite places. I come here often enough where the lady at the kitchen counter knows me by face. Well today me and my boy came in to have a few drinks and Ben has been so great! Been playing local HAWAII music at our request which is GREAT!! Made me feel like I was back home in Hawaii even if he's Haole. He's a pretty cool Haole guy, I like him. He's dope and has a great personality! We only came for two drinks and we're definitely more than 2 drinks deep. The prices aren't bad but the conversations and atmosphere is what kept us past those two drinks. Ben and Edda is great company!! I love coming on weekdays because the environment is cool and chill. And every time I eat here the food is great. My experience here has never been horrible. Come and try it

9vZV1YtjtbrWYdvndZb39w.text: Best Karaoke Parties for any occasion, 7 nites a wk, Bar area fully new renovated with two lovely waitress nd same ugly Bartender  Restaurant menu I highly recommend OXTAIL SOUP, LAULAU, POLY MIX PLATE, don't order the Kalbi plate very small tiny pieces of beef meat, no bueno smh"

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bnNcLmllWpZvyAr5tyBDTw.text: Musubis. Delicious. Plate lunches. Too pricey and smaller than I am used to from a Hawaiian plate lunch place. That part is a total bummer.   BUT...close to work !!!

EyO2TeOAcGEIJQq1tPFv_A.text: Update 2/13/19 I ordered a fried rice omelet and I'm now going pass a 20 minute wait! Not sure why it's taking so long to make an omelette but I go up to the counter to see if they forgot about my order and the cook is speaking a different language and I guess tells the counter person that it'll be a few more minutes. 25 minutes for an omelette? If only there was another location closer to me so I could avoid eating at this particular location.

ZpSiuykmgRXyGVt1ntVGjQ.text: I went for the second time to eat their oxtail ramen. You can get ramen and oxtail fix at the same time. I went at 10:30pm the second time. The place was rocking with locals, couple Uber drivers (saw the stickers off the cars), and guys who got off work late at night. It just wasn't as good as the first time when I went at 5pm. Maybe they ran out of oxtail because all I got was 1 big one and 1 bony one along with shreds of oxtail. It's not even close to the first time or the ones at California Hotel. This time I mainly tasted seasoning packet that you get from a package of $.20 ramen from the supermarket. The soup was not hearty, tasty, or flavorful from the ingredients, just artificial flavoring.  If you don't have enough oxtail left then just tell me so I can get kalua pork or something instead of giving me a big bowl of noodles and mostly bone pieces. I will probably not go back for a long time as it's a 20 min drive to eat there anyway.  I went through half my undergraduate education eating their chicken bowl but loyalty only goes so far.

TPN5fOHPzwjByZvQF8A_Zg.text: Terrible food taste poor !! Ordered the teriyaki combo and it's tasted like dog food yuck  maybe I ordered the wrong thing but save yourself please

2mogm5ALZL2-hlNh_pIyUw.text: Great late night eat when I'm working overnights. Open tom3-4 am depending on the day covers just about any shift one could hope to work.  Has he Aloha plate. Was pretty good, chicken well cooked, beef a little stingy but not bad. A generous portion rice, and pretty good Mac salad. Bring the food to your table for you. A solid 4 star.

av_jG-_GHb99d1UXArNfKw.text: The food was so good, I had the Kalbi Combo. Hubby had the Loco Moco which he loved.  Service was really good, food came out hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Combo Plate.

PUHgBZRY_fg4smHt8pHfSQ.text: I've been coming here for years. It's so chill.   The Local Plate is a must-have here and it includes beef, chicken, rice, mac salad and 2 spam musubi. This review is specifically for the restaurant since I've never been to the bar.   Service is usually quick and friendly. I could also say the same for the Charleston location.   One of the employees here, Cyndel is a sweetheart and so adorable! She's one of the genuinely nicest people I've met in Vegas. When I walk in, homegirl already knows what I want.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1YMEd3DfoRBPC_TqM1n1TA.text: You can never go wrong if you want Hawaiian food. Reasonable priced, delicious food with some local kine jams so you can feel the island vibes!!!

4nYvhycZtCIEseARV0rvFg.text: It's hard to find local food for a Hawaiian palate, but Aloha Kitchen has come the closest so far ok my search in LV. Always get the laulau and kalua pig, reminds me of my families parties pig, 'ono.

B883A4DiRGc-md1jzjZbog.text: We always stop by here when we are in town. The food is very good, lots of variety, good prices, friendly workers & they open late(great for a midnight snack after gambling all night). One thing they have that I have not seen in Hawaii is a spam musubi plate(x2 spam musubi/teri chicken/teri beef/mac salad).

IVsXMYBYCN6MM4JCcfViSw.text: Good value. I always order from here through Uber eats for lunch at work. My go to's: oxtail soup, corn beef hash breakfast and beef tapa breakfast. Not the best Mac salad but the Kimchi is pretty decent as far as sides go. Hopefully they'll add actual Filipino corned beef to the menu. :)

Yq3GAXtXpW9PoPeeU_jQig.text: We come here so much that Cyndel practically knows ours, well actually my order when I set foot in the door.  We've tried almost everything, since we come all hours they are open. I get the banana mac-nut pancakes every visit!! My husband and sons go to of course is the adobo omelette, they won't eat it anywhere else. This is our go to place, for the food and the cool folks!!!! Thinking I need to go now, lol.

yyuVVknz_94iH0McYMe9tg.text: So we came here after dinner to sing a little bit Of Karaoke before going home. This place is mall but quaint. The bartender was really nice and very nice. Didn't miss a step when it came or ordering drinks. The KJ was funny and very upbeat. The crowd was lively in here.  They cheered everyone who sang, which was amazing. We actually had a nice time here and definitely heading back next Saturday. So if you're looking to have a good time, with great people, this is definitely the spot.

sMZwgedGNVTQcJix7PWIDA.text: We've been there once last week and definitely won't be back. After waiting for our food for half an hour, while tolerating the bad service, the food was far from being fresh and when we said it's cold it didn't seem like anyone cared.

exgQ--uIjR4DmgcMXKtO5g.text: It's Saturday night, the night before the Big Game. Our dear friend visiting from HI is in town for her birthday.  Her other friends are also visiting from HI and want to meet up.  This other group of friends are singers and they want to go to local bar for Karaoke.  So thirteen of us pile up in three cars and make our way to this Karaoke bar.  "Oh oh!" I think to myself.  "Why are there so many motorcycles?" We park our cars and make our way to the bar. As I walk past the motorcycles, they're big bikes but they're Yamahas and Hondas and not Harleys.  So I can calm down.  We get in and meet the rest of our party from HI.  They said the time they've been here, was on a week night. They just found out that Saturday nights is biker night! OMG!  So we're trying to figure out what we're going to do. So one of the girls texts her girlfriend and says Aloha Kitchen has Karaoke on Saturday night. This workout great as one of our party members was from Oregon and she wanted Hawaiian-style food anyway.   Because we got to Aloha Kitchen a little late, all the booths for big parties were already taken. But the night of fun had already begun without us.  And I totally forgot that Aloha Kitchen's kitchen is open 24-hours. So we did it up HI style; ordered a couple of plates of fried noodles, manapuas, spam musubis, french fries, drinks and a couple of songs to sing.  4-stars for the Karaoke bar and 3.5-stars for the restaurant.

WVzbLMHsXHeIUwj_7kCe9g.text: This is my favorite place when I'm craving chicken teriyaki and a side of French fries    Ps forgot to take a picture it was too good job

kV05KgPKZ075hLeIRU_Yvw.text: Worst food ever. Chicken was way overcooked. Katsu sauce has been sitting around for days. Rice was watered down. Never again

8p6gd452_CcccIiDBhlc1Q.text: Omg....love these pancakes they sell here a mist have for everything I go to Vegas and get right before I come home. Love love love

YjU_R-kOmitvPow1n7bkdg.text: Heard about this place on buzzfeed and was very excited for some good Hawaiian food. Was not disappointed!!! SO GOOD! Best Hawaiian food since I was in Hawaii.   If you are visiting and have a rental car it is a mere 15/20 muns from the strip.  I got the kalua pork and cabbage and my husband got the fried rice lovers omelette with sausage.  Will be coming back here before we leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best kalua pork and cabbage since i was in Hawaii!!

Ze7Cc9btPIIjca7uaIGt8g.text: I ordered a Teriyaki Beef plate. I lost my appetite when I received my order. The meat was chopped in pieces, dry and tough. They poured teriyaki sauce over the meat to hide the dryness in the meat. When I asked to speak to the manager, no one came to our table. The worker, played the middle man, as I address my concerns. The manager was no where to be found to apologize for the food and listen to my concern or suggestions. The worker recommend to the change the meat and he was very considerate. Very disappointed with service and the food.

dWltG8457ellEMYIvXnEOA.text: Have been going to Aloha Kitchen it seems like forever...I remember the remodel at the sahara and Decatur location as well as checking out the bar next door.  It was fun because of the karaoke that was going on at the time.  My typical go to for a quick and inexpensive meal is the student special which is basically just chicken teriyaki over rice and a small fountain soda.  I like to get the vegetable egg rolls to go with the student special.  The food is always consistent and cooking times varies depending on how busy they are.  Service is great they bring the food to you when it's ready so you don't have to stand around waiting.  If you're super hungry then make sure to try the mix plate and get your grub on!  Good selection of Hawaiian food and good quality consistent food makes me coming back time and time again.

GzIqv0ICRZmfM1HLBsL4ag.text: Amazing food for the price, very fresh and very good service. Try the adobo fried rice omelette and you won't be disappointed. Also the spam masubi is very reasonably priced. Very good selection of Hawaiian Sun drinks as well. I can't attest to the karaoke bar side of the place, but it's generally very busy so I have to think it's pretty great as well.

TFA9-azgNF8dIxT8ljzF7Q.text: Excellent Service. Staff are awesome been going here since they opened. Was in high school then and always great being here great food

oEkk56801syI5qN-D9Jq6A.text: I love this place! Their food is really good. My personal favorite is the Local Plate (teriyaki beef, chicken and 2 spam musubi.

-5R5htTdeMEbioJd4jZRxQ.text: First time at this location... I've been going to the Maryland Pkwy location near UNLV for many years. I like this one. Not cause there's a bar but It's actually not that far from the strip. Still not a short a drive as the other one but it almost seems like there are more options at this location on Decatur.  My friends & I were starving for some local food one late Saturday night. We were coming from Bellagio and it was near closing time for the other location so we made a beeline for Decatur because it's open much later. This restaurant is located in an outdoor shopping plaza. There was plenty of parking.  I ordered the lau lau and a side of spam musubi. Having come back from visiting Hawai'i a few months ago, I was really craving some authentic local grindz. Craving fulfilled... The pork lau-lau was good. It had good flavor. I just wish there was more of it than the serving had. I guess I really was hungry cause I scarfed the musubi and lau-lau in no time. Haha. My friends all liked what they ordered... I usually go for a bento box or local plate. Next time for sure.  Service was friendly just like the other location. Pay and order at the counter. You get a number and they bring you your food, drinks and utensils. I look forward to going back to this location whenever I'm in town to not only check out the other menu items but to see the bar area... I know this is where Anuhea performed when she was in town. That's awesome..
