Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. musubi

0G_OazEN8bfHPqrD0vsmKQ.text: I always love this place. This is definitely my go-to spot during my monthly Vegas trips. Staff is friendly. The food is ono and fairly priced. Good sized portions. Definitely a bang for your buck.

iJT7zxwgJhfNFPgeWTgWzw.text: Awesome food awesome service! I have the chickens teriyaki and it is always consistent and delicious. Very good price and big portions.

YMFJHBLl7OBj6Rbm8GAcXg.text: Great food and great customer service. Come and enjoy their bomb local plate and lumpia.

WpnnDtnm086VplZX1wfn9w.text: We love our Hawaiian food. We had several Aloha kitchens to choose from and we choose this one off the strip. It was so good we went back before we left back home. We didn't take a pic of the food the first time but we did the second time. Was sooooo Ono we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lil bit of everything soooo Ono good grindz!!!
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelette

tzjtt_Osbsh8kguJMBcwCQ.text: yummy late night food, always friendly staff feels like aloha

fu1qzgqKJJTP5hosq30Fig.text: When I come to Vegas, I always have a meal at Aloha Specialties at the Cal.  The last time around, I came with a few friends that wanted to go to their regular Hawaiian spot. Aloha Kitchen is a fast food restaurant with Hawaiian and Filipino dishes.  One of my fav dishes is the garlic chicken which is what I ordered at Aloha Kitchen. Came with 3 slabs of chicken with skin on, 2 scoops of rice, and mac salad.  The garlic chicken was just okay. Kind of bland, skin not as crispy as I'd like it to be. Also, I barely was given a scoop of mac salad.   My friend ordered halo halo which looked disappointing for $5. On the other hand, the adobo omelet looked delicious.  I'll stick to Aloha Specialties the next time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic chicken... Not bad..

gEt9I0ivMRLeUV7Jr18wFQ.text: Quick simple bite. Not sure what the hypes about the food isn't that great. Comparable to a crappy Chinese takeout place food wise. Ordered for 5 colleagues and myself. Everyone hated there food. Top three was moco plate, chicken katsu, and adobo. Won't be returning.

STq4jdUVQ9GDheaIBKiSOA.text: the best place in town for an island vibe and great Hawaii style food.  everything on the menu is good and the staff is very friendly.

By3NK9Ss2ue3W3LUmBBI1w.text: Please don't order teriyaki beef from this restaurant, especially if you are from Hawaii.  Such a shame that they use the name "Aloha" and people think they will be served thin sliced teriyaki beef similar to what is served at all plate lunch locations in Hawaii.  They chop up prolly the lowest grade of beef, tuff as rubber and pour teriyaki sauce on it.

x-lZ2xpa3Rm7VZEMt1_zDw.text: Came at a great time (around 4pm), not too long of a line, & service was really fast! Got the adobo omelet, it really is a must-try! Love the environment & great customer service all-around! Visiting from out of town and I'm glad that this was the first stop my friends and I made for a food stop!

wG54kEJ7O_FscanspTD75w.text: Delish local style grinds! Fast friendly service  .... Convient drive, not too far from strip.

Gh7sozWHVgXl7IUcGvyU9g.text: Love the food here. Try the combination bowl or the local plate. Cyndel has amazing costumer service.

8oboS7iK-wxusiQP5UEY-A.text: We always stop by the other location when passing through Vegas to get the adobo omelette. The kids love the katsu and this time I tried the Ox tail soup as well. Foods good, fast, and inexpensive compared to everything else in the area. Service is always friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail soup.
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JpNCV0fvPTpFFtWt8HGbqA.text: Four words:  ADOBO FRIED RICE OMELET!  That alone is the DELICIOUS hallmark of this wonderful hole-in-the-wall Filipino-Hawaiian restaurant inside the UNLV campus.  The huge-size for a $7 value is worth it.  As an east coast tourist who came here on a word-of-mouth referral from my cousin who's been to Vegas a zillion times, I just had to come here and believe it.  I hope you can believe it when you come here.  Also the spam musubi, a slice of grilled spam with a bed rice and sauce around a big maki wrap, is a win!

3ubxycjIN-r6F2xf8_8LzA.text: THIS IS A MUST STOP WHENEVER I'm IN VEGAS.  4 words: ADOBO FRIED RICE OMELETTE.   Sure I can easily make this at home. But something about the dish that just isnt the same if I was to make it at home. It's actually good here!   Everything else is pretty good too. I've had their tapsilog, saimin, longsilog. All good but again 4 words: ADOBO FRIED RICE OMELETTE. Geeeeet it!

wY64zxXiEwZU1hCmD044UQ.text: I used to go here all the time when I was 18 and I have many fond memories...so please believe it saddens me to write this review.  Upon arriving I was impressed with the remodel (haven't been here in years). I mean lets be honest this place was an eye sore a couple years ago! New furniture did wonders though! So I go order my food and service was great. Quick & fast no complaints. Food though was bland! I mean the chicken teriyaki was very pale unlike years ago! Not to mention the teriyaki sauce didn't taste the same and had a thin consistency. The Mac salad also had no flavor and it just seemed off. I guess I will just have memories and nothing else...

GzeU8ZVN5smksnAwjwkjpQ.text: A mixed bag. The food is good. I had the kalua pork and cabbage. It was  a little salty but ok. The spam musabi was awesome. You will not leave there hungry. The karaoke bar had a great host! He would play popular dance songs I in between the singing to keep everyone involved. My biggest disappointment was the bar. Get beer, because they water down the drinks.

2l4t4P0HFKtZXk0ZWOoHNA.text: Aloha kitchen is my favorite place to go for Hawaiin food and a great time! Highly recommend!

14aQNLdrm_ziom0iVuKM2A.text: Food is great and it's pretty inexpensive. They also have really good hours. Perfect for late night cravings

g-4NvYRC0Rgwv2LHscVLjA.text: Favorite  spot to eat when I'm in town.  Adobo fried omelette is what I always order, but there are many other items that are delicious.  And the prices are just right.

yLVlrXBP8P3yP3ZMuRJTYA.text: Always enjoy going to this place. I don't think it's overpriced or anything, but I can only take Aloha Kitchen in monthly doses. My favorites are the chicken katsu and kalbi.

BfRgjqNjJqycY_L7JNw7Iw.text: I did not eat any food, so this review is only about the service, location, and bar menu.  The drinks were hardly alcoholic, which made their $6 price seem higher than it was.  The bartender also seemed to favor large groups of regular karaoke patrons, and left me waiting at the bar for quite a while on two occasions.  The karaoke DJ also seemed to favor the larger groups of regulars.  I was here for a work party with a large group, but many of our song submissions were delayed in favor of other people's requests.  The "regulars" also seemed to favor ballads, which sort of killed the mood, but I understand the house can't control that too much.

QU3wolLOUxlIGPZjbS9HmQ.text: Everyone raves about the adobo fried rice, so that's what i tried. it wasn't busy when i got here and the food was a bit too oily for my taste and it wasn't as good as imagined it to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelette

2URhvQXGdYuqw2PFmsNCSg.text: Well what can i say ... today's visit was the last straw!  How does a restaurant RUN OUT OF TOILET PAPER??!!!  Yes, run out of toilet paper in the only working bathroom, the other bathroom has an out of order sign on the door!  I ask the girl for toilet paper & she hands me a paper towel roll.  So i say, "this isn't toilet paper" to which she responds, "yeah, we're out of toilet paper".  I was actually at a loss for words!  What?  You can't have someone run down to the store for toilet paper?!  This place has been steadily going down.

Cu51-d2EKLONmHN0sjgfXw.text: We threw a retirement party here for a good friend. It was an AMAZING night. The bartenders (Nate and Evan) and deejay, Mackly KILLED it!!! So friendly, personable and fun. I can't speak highly enough about Mackly, the deejay/karaoke host. I felt like we should have paid him (although he did accept tips, which we did.) He was on the mic all night, hosting dance contests and frequently congratulating our retiree friend...making him feel special. Extensive karaoke list. Cute little, lounging area with a good amount of places to sit. And our party-goers could go next door for some yummy Aloha Kitchen food. I highly recommend hosting a party here.

DN2yp74KdDwemFmh6dnA5w.text: You might ask why four stars.. well cus I could say I've had better, as in taste. But AK will always be in my heart. Mostly cus Me and my friends come here A LOT! And this was the first islander spot I got to try when I first moved to Vegas.. Oh the memories.   If you always wanted to try something else besides the typical chicken katsu. I suggest trying the Lau-Lau plate. I'd say the prices are pretty reasonable for a quick fix of islander food.   The parking is plenty. And it's huge for having a family side and a party side. I'm talking about their restaurant and their karaoke bar. So, it's an all-around good chill spot for whatever you wanna do.

8v128kVWgJmftIDpf-uQ0A.text: Long story short, after a short discussion with an employee, who kept coming back and forth to my table while I was waiting for my food, she informed me that her manager said I was asked to leave because I couldn't provide proof or paperwork stating that the dog I had with me was, in fact, an actual service dog. Clearly the manager of this restaurant doesn't know that a service animal and their handler are protected against the Federal Law and that a person with a service dog may voluntarily present any proof but is NOT required to do so and you may not insist on proof or ask a person to leave because they could not, or would not, present any paperwork. In the end, they noticed, as I pointed out, the card on the dog's vest stating that law and she left. 2 stars because the food was good and the other cashier was friendly, but overall, very irritated that a manager doesn't know the laws and even I myself, who was once a manager elsewhere, knew that..

1D5TyUVBApBMvaVTFoZxaw.text: Decided to try this place for some late Sunday evening eats with a friend. Bonus: Open late daily. I would probably prefer Island Style but they close at 8pm and not open on Sundays. Place looked clean enough and prices reasonable. I had combo of Chicken Katsu & Chicken curry. My friend had the bbq combo(Katsu, teri chicken & kalbi). Both our katsu's were a bit overdone because the outside was pretty dark brown and tasted accordingly. The 2 scoops of rice looked more like 3. The mac salad was decent. I had a taste of my friend's teri chicken and I could tell it wasn't marinated bbq/teri chicken I'm used to having back in Hawaii growing up. It was just grilled chicken that had a lightly colored sweet sauce on top. The katsu did come with the thick, sweet tangy traditional japanese katsu sauce. I would come back to perhaps to try other items here. The first visit though was just ok.

yVcww2yHBtJ0Hoiph7jyqQ.text: Came her 2x during a 5 day visit in LV. I would have come a 3rd time but was running late for my flight home. Customer service is good when they greet you hello and goodbye. When your on a budget and got to feed a family of 7; hit up aloha kitchen for some good eats at a fair price. The worst expensive item is the hawaiian sun; $1.50ea. Only bad thing I saw during my visits is the short Latin guy was counting money at the other register with gloves. Once finished he helped out filling orders of food while using the same gloves! Ewwww! Btw... Don't mind the lost/missing sign in the front of the building. Their open lol

UlGXECjwfT4CDVQKlSI2bg.text: Pork adobo fried rice is a MUST. If you ever believe any of my reviews, believe this! The pork adobo fried rice is the shit!  Ratings for the rest of the food I tried:  - Lumpia: standard. I could make these better by frying the frozen ones from the store - Manapua: This appears to be the same brand from Hawaii that is frozen and you just microwave it. Not that it's not good, it is... - Kalua pig with cabbage: Tasty, but a little too salty for me (and I LURVE salty stuff). -Mac salad: I can make this better myself, which defeats the purpose of me ordering it.  Overall, I'd probably come back here for the fried rice. It was SO good. Service was good too....both ladies working the counter were super nice. So I'm giving it 3.5 stars.  3.5 fried stars!

F_ndVlqW4aEhftNaECzVqg.text: We had our Christmas party there last night, what a great time.  Good food, good drinks and the dj was so much fun...Thank you to Aloha Kitchen what a wonderful time

MIjdvTZpuw15GksP3w230w.text: Wow. I'm so sadden to have to say I will never return here again. I am eating with friends at a booth and a roach creeps up on us while we were seated at the booth. My husband advised the employee and he said he just fumigated so that's why we had a visitor. There was no need for that visitor to come while I was at the table and ruin my experience. So sad they did not do anything about this. I won't be back!

J73m5AY7p-kg9X6q7JXw8w.text: - Been coming here since 2010 because the place is a good value. - Large portion sizes, good food, reasonable prices, open 7 days a week late in to the night (whereas Island Style closes early and isn't even open on Sundays yelp.com/biz/island-styl...). - Staff is friendly and there's a self-serve soda dispenser so free refills when I'm eating there.

x9hgSror-gg-ssrcdyYqvw.text: It's a beautiful day, the weather finally cooled down with a slight breeze in the air..the clouds rolled in giving that just right temperature.. and I couldn't think of a better place to go eat! Aloha Kitchen ~ this place was perfect! I had the Loco Moco Plate with an extra egg...done  "Over Easy! " It's a must! oh and a lil soy sauce~to give it that extra mmm!   The hamburger patty over rice with gravy and the eggs on top! MMMMMmmm! It was fulfilling! It  topped off the day..with the weather outside~how comforting! ...just went hand in hand!   Like having hot coco on a cold winter day.....

WmsQsKE9tTRGxrsehkf20w.text: I love their korean bbq chicken, but can only give it 3 stars because of the constant gristle I discover.

DxjQTTssj_GpX4MKkiSfeA.text: If you know me, I'm a huge fan of cheap eats and local dives. I'm also all about tasting and sniffing out foods that I can't get ahold of back home. Home being here in Cali. So when my friends suggested to my girlfriend and our "Vegas Travel Crew" to stop by Aloha Kitchen and try the Adobo Omelet, we decided to come down and see what the buzz was all about. Sadly, I and my fellow associates were quite displeased with what we sank our teeth into.   I don't know if it was the idea of an Adobo Omelet that excited us or the hype that our friends were making but all of us were really eager to try it but we ended up very disappointed with it. There was nothing really special about it. It was just rice inside an omelet. In fact, the rice itself was bland and dry. There was nothing about that dish that resembled Adobo other than the brown color of the rice, which I repeat, was bland and dry. To put it bluntly, that Omelet sucked balls. It was kind of hard to face our friends and give them a fake smile and say, "Oh that shit was bomb! We're definitely going back to have another one when we come back again."   In all honesty, we would have been better off just ordering the Chicken Katsu or Loco Moco. But that would kind of defeat the purpose of going there in the first place because if I wanted L&L, I would have just gone there before we came to Vegas or waited until I got back. I can at least say I tried it so that has to count for something.  I'll give Aloha Kitchen a little mercy and say at least the hours are great and perfect for after clubbing dining. Unlike the people who I thought were my friends, I will look out for those of you who are planning on visiting Aloha Kitchen and recommend having anything other than the Adobo Omelet... unless you're high. In that case, please share and then order the Adobo Omelet because that's the only way you would get me to ever eat that thing again.

TzCKu-9-2oCLPsJlLLAtOA.text: OK Hawaiian fix. Crappy music. Semi nice people working there. Used to be a lit better.

YAQwE_1bcgb0p_P1MuGc7Q.text: not much of a fan of filipino food. but this mixture was too good! its a hole in the wall restaurant. my bf & i ordered the adobo fried rice omelet & a macaroni salad came out to be less than $10. macaroni salad was really small & not that tasty for $2. but the adobo fried rice omelet was good! add some sriracha. yums.

3gy0fh3bwC0H76JBlKdewg.text: My favorite Hawaiian BBQ place. All I have to say is kalbi ribs and mac salad was a party in my mouth.  I'm a repeat customer now.

m_7OOlkl2-Wl-9Tia50mdQ.text: Warning...this place no longer serves decent food let alone island style eats.  The bento box consisted of the usual rice, piece of spam, what was suppose to be a piece of chicken but cover by a fatty skin, little cubes of meat that looked like leftover cuts from other meals, all cover by a horrid sauce.  SAUCE on everything in a BENTO box!!!  $8.50 for that?? The teriyaki sandwich was really just a burnt cheeseburger with nothing on it. Not even real beef. And with fries? No choice for normal mac salad. Rip off for $5.95 Only thing okay was the poki, because how can you mess up raw fish?  I talked with manager & she said that is the way its been for a year.  I remember when they had good food. Course no one working there is actually from Hawaii anymore so they don't know better. But owners should.  L&L better and that isn't always that great. I'd give this place a zero rating if I could.

VLBd9K5JMNxNLdHDgvU9vA.text: Been living in Hawaii for the past 13 years and just moved to Vegas. The "garlic chicken" was just fried chicken breast with garlic powder poured on it. Went to use the bathroom and so far was the dirtiest bathroom I've been in since I moved here. Guess I'm gonna try and find a real Hawaiian place out here. I do no recommend.

0LMqeuGjxyfCDPrjQfB9DA.text: On February 24, 2015, i had a horrible experience at this place. An employee of this restaurant mistreated a costumer. This costumer was an old woman. This happened around 7pm. I don't know the name of the employee but it looks like she is the manager. She is tall and I think she's Hawaiian. The employee was also saying bad words in front of costumers. I've been a costumer of this restaurant for more than 5 years and yes the service has always been terrible but is the first time that I see something like this happen. This was my last time eating at that restaurant!!

xHwN5H6qGkJh_4UGYDuNDg.text: Best night of karaoke ever. Crowd was great with many good singers. Mac, chocolate Thunder, is a super DJ - gets people up dancing, sings and super fun guy. Chris, the bartender, besides making great drinks, is an entertainer himself. You will not lead disappointed!!!!!

XT0KTpIGuMXzU9zD0mTlFg.text: Very good, so good you might just forget your stuck in Vegas and not the islands that this restaurant reminds you of. I always get the Teriyaki combo which has pork, chicken, and beef, and of course a big scoop of macaroni salad and two scoops of rice. A friend of mine which introduced me to the restaurant is from Honolulu and just loves the food also.  When I first moved to Vegas me and a friend were looking for some karaoke and just stumbled on the bar portion. Which they are connected but if you weren't hungry you would not step into the restaurant side. Anyway the atmosphere of just laid back fun is great, the karaoke is great fun and free, with a one drink minimum of course.

N1bNFsDUPMItYhmGRhs0OA.text: I make my pilgrimage to AK whenever I'm in Sin City and when I can't, I still think about it. I love the down home feeling I get when I'm there. Most of the stuff on the menu I can probably make at home  (and I can save myself the future medical bills) but oh heck, why not indulge in some thick, cholesterol laden gravy?!   My BMF, Malino has been a Las Vegas local for the past 6 years and I'm sure he's had enough of AK but as long as he knows that a trip to AK will make me smile and his BMF position stays in tact, he will gladly take me there.

YSLuBhrz6tuXgaLKIVbReQ.text: When in Vegas gotta stop by this spot for adobo fried rice, open really late.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby in a blanket!

j-W_yCvFzBjxNyJVSogxMw.text: Yea after eating here and all this excitement from delivery...Wahhh we don't deliver to Trop and Decatur. WELL DAMN YOU WOMAN..... So everyone else pretty much said what's on the menu. It's Hawaiian food from your Spam Musubi to your Kahlua pork...But one thing stops my heart. Calling all Filipinos....  ADOBO FRIED RICE OMELETTE... WTF!!!!???? Ohhh yea Garlicky pork and chicken adobo goodness. fried in rice and stuffed in a huge omelette egg. Oh yea baby....Slather me up in butter and smear mayonnaise on my left toe. Just makes the sun shinier - the grass greener....and somalian kids having a whopper jr. Yea that's what greatness is. Did I mention I hate eating common shit? Ok sure it's a lil salty. But expect it from the soy sauce and vineger of the Adobo....you know what balances it... White rice....Mmmm White Rice....

xNx948TQ85goQSw-g0pjVA.text: Food here is really good. You should get the pork fried rice omelet! That thing is huge and delicious!

-DabwrNftdrTpozCAVFIcg.text: Upon my first visit here, I was a little worried. Hawaiian style local restaurants are usually hit or miss..they give you a ton of food and you have to take the plunge and either feel crappy afterwards or go into the loveliest food coma known to man. This one was the latter. The food was delicious and the service was decently quick, I just don't understand why they put the soda machine on the other side of the line...so annoying. Fat spam musubi too. It's alriggghttttt, I'd go here again if I was craving island food in Vegas.

248CjAPNoJRzu6JqZJ5B7g.text: The food is good, but definitely not great.  If you want good food, a lot of it, for a very reasonable price...go here.  The service and the decor are okay.  You order at the counter and the food it delivered.  It got there quickly.  Overall, it was good, but definitely not memorable.

xInXa0Ca7UzYTA85woV7mA.text: The food is not the issue here at all.  However, in the Bar/Karaoke area there is a security guard named Ron (Ronnie).  He is by far the rudest, most unprofessional person I have come in contact with in years, and he covers in the absence of mgt.  Because of him, we will not be returning.  We have held several gatherings this year alone and until he is sent back to school to further his education in manners, customer service and management skills we will not be returning.  We have always had a great time there and have been coming for over 6 years, but this guy has made it unbearable.  I hope management sees this and makes some adjustment, because we wont be returning till there has been a change with him.

AX9fVzlEmLSL9vM6s7EKuA.text: boohoo cry cry.  I wanted .. I expected... well dunno but I didn't get it here.  We got the pork adobo because of Ed V.'s review, and the Hula plate because it sounded good.  Both were NOT good.  They ran out of the pork adobo, so they said try the new chicken adobo we have.  It was too salty and basically just tasted like chicken boiled in shoyu, dry, salty.  The rice was no good, the mac salad was warm, the Hula plate was all fried seafood bleh.  bleh.

HJqI_eWy5CaTQJ9_c8Sfrw.text: Late night munchies after you hit the clubs? This is the place to be! Along with the good food, there is also an annex type kareoke bar you can enjoy after the food! Please do not come in intoxicated and annoying though, because you will get kicked out!! No soliciting please!

nOGdNQ1zrp-vEY1LadGUmg.text: Aloha Kitchen stalks my dreams...  I wake with a rumbling belly and a craving for macaroni salad and rice.  My head fills with thoughts of kalua pig, adobo fried rice, spam masubi and loco moco heart attack platters....  I am addicted.  I will visit again on all future LV trips.  Best Hawaiin food I have enjoyed since Da Kines closed down in San Diego.  The fact you can get some classic Filipino fare is icing on the cake.  Bomb food, cheap prices.  Please open an Aloha Kitchen in LA!

gxKqFqLVmuekMO--ZVfttg.text: Sometimes I just crave local hawaiian plates and this is one of my favorite spots. My spam musubi pit stop. I love the fried saimin too!

E_ilNVDVDtFcvZ1VjiBU5g.text: Aloha/Kumusta ka! This is a Hawaiian and Filipino restaurant in one.  The Food: I've only been here once and I ordered the Adobo Omelette (Pork). And it was very, very good. The portion size was good for 2; or one huge hawaiian. I also, had the Spam Musubi. Also good but nothing out of the ordinary.  The place: Medium-size restaurant. Had plenty of people during lunch time (at least when I was there). The place was clean for eating.  Parking: Restaurant located at a shopping mall so there's plenty of parking spots.  The bad: I didn't see any dessert on their menu.  Overall: Go and try the Adobo Omelette; you'll be stuffed and satisfied. Not sure how authentic the food are, but it's good and that's all that really matters.

VEH_reAKCt3KdxLc730zlw.text: Love this place... So many great choices to choose from.  I love both their tapsilog and their adobo omelets.  (Watch out for the bay leaves, though, if you order the adobo omelet.)  This place is open late and is a great place to stop by after the clubs.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New hours

oWJmyLtpAPH8o5sQ-JQRaA.text: What's the best thing to eat after having a crazy NYE in Vegas? This place. Seriously, the adobo fried rice hit the spot considering I had a mini hang over and was still in my clothes from the night before.   It was a little hard to find, but once we found the place, we were golden. We came around 11 am and there were only a few people in there. It was probably because everyone was still sleeping! Haha.   The staff is friendly and the decor is perfect for a Hawaiian place. And the food, the food is BOMB. I ordered the adobo friend rice omelet and my friend ordered the spam and eggs. We all loved what we ordered! The adobo fried rice omelet was so so good. The rice was a little crunchy like fried rice is supposed to be and the adobo had a little crunch to it too. Just like my Lola makes it. Except it was wrapped in an omelet! Instead of the egg being in the rice like normal adobo fried rice, it was wrapped in it. Genius! Haha.  Anyway, I would definitely come back to this place and order the omelet again. It was that good!

wVTBPDeYv1MMIVlGgVGYAg.text: Tried it, hated it. I opened my food to check it, and there was hardly any sauce on it. I asked for a little side cup of the teriyaki sauce and was told that it would be 27 cents. I said it will cost you more to run my card for the charge than you are charging me, and this meat is dry to begin with. The "lady" told me, well it's 27 cents. I said that's fine, I will just go to your competitor next time. She said, "fine goodbye." I hoped that when I got home this would be delicious at least. It wasn't. The fish was gross, the chicken was dry, the shredded mystery meat was gamey. I would rather eat a nasty drive thru burger than this garbage again.

Cqta_FG4aVAHQpUTchPobQ.text: What a bad service! They screwed up on delivery one day. I called them on missing food item. They promised me a credit for that particular item and will honor it the next time I order. Well, when I ordered the next time for delivery, I mentioned the credit I have and wanted to use it towards my order.  They still insisted I need to order minimum of $10 for delivery.  What ever happened to my credit? I guess I got screwed out of my money. All you people out there ordering for delivery, make sure everything is in your bag before paying the money.  Don't use credit card for payment.  Because if they screw up of your order, it is too late.  They got your money and will end up like me. And I hope you speak Pilipino, because the delivery person doesn't speak a word of English only Pilipino. Therefore, good luck communicating with delivery person if they screw up on your order.  Best thing to do is to order somewhere else.  Not Aloha Kitchen. Also, they should change their name since they have no Aloha Spirit.

fqVBA0TV1G8RCyYXuEtxVw.text: Always here on Sundays and every time great food and nice to chill while listening to karaoke. Great people.

tIn6U0h6l0YexPGsCd6PJQ.text: The flavor alone makes this place worthy of five stars. I've tried different dishes and each time I've been amazed at how tasty the food is. I had the Kalua pig and Katsu combo. Katsu was soooo good (first time eating it there). Kalua pig was good as usual.   Spam musubi never disappoints.  First time ordering kimchi too. The difference in taste/texture complemented the food in such a weird way but it was yummy. Definitely adding kimchi to my order again.    First time ordering the miso soup too. I was a little hesitant with it cuz some places just use the powder and you can taste the blandness, but the flavor in this one was soooooo good. If I hantavirus ordered so much I would have downed the whole thing in a heartbeat!  The fact that they're open almost 24hrs makes it more than just a reliable after-club hotspot, but more a requirement when going to Las Vegas.

YXQayg7DMmOEiSYgWdTUcQ.text: Love this place! Great food and service. Affordable menu items. We highly recommend the place.

vxfTawJFT7sXF_BR9oh5Zw.text: I Love this place! I come here everytime I come back from Cali. The service here is always good. Food is Always good! Adobo fried rice omelettes ftw! I also love their Tapsilog, but they run out of that super fast! If you enjoy tapa as much as I do.. come early for this. I think they run out between 10:30am-11:30am.

7yJRNihSWhBeZV23MKWHBw.text: Aloha Kitchen and Bar is more like a three and a half stars.   I ordered chicken curry and I thought the chicken curry was going to be like Indian or Thai style, but I was wrong.  It was Hawaiian style and I have never heard of Hawaiian chicken curry.  It was different and they do not add coconut milk.  The dish was large--two scoops of rice, a scoop of macaroni salad, and a large serving of chicken curry.  The large serving was worth eight dollars, but I did not finish it.    The karaoke bar was cool and entertaining.  However, I must caution you the music is loud, but I guess that is to be expected.  You get use to the noise once you are inside for a couple of hours.    There is a lot of karaoke music to choose from.  The binder is about four inches thick and the music ranges from Hawaiian, Tagalog, Spanish, rap, rock, country, pop, and r&b.  Basically, whatever song you choose, it might be in the binder.  The binder is alphabetized by song.  Vegas has a lot of hidden singers.  They are really talented.  They should try out for American Idol or America Has Talent.   In between songs, they play danceable music like line dancing (the Electric Slide) or hip-hop.   However, I must add sometimes the microphone does not work.    I did not sing because I was shy, but I guess if I were drunk, I wouldn't mind singing a song.

RnTk9T0vznzjQkypPBHwnw.text: Definitely divey but whatever.  Its cheap, fast, good and open late.  No place for me to get gyu-don after 4am so this place works just fine.

SkRe32NIx4A7NjGnhlX55w.text: i enjoyed their chicken teriyaki bowl and went back for it again. The chicken was cooked fresh which is why the wait takes a little while for your food. It's also a good portion for $3.50ish. I was disappointed with the manaupas because the bread was hard and did not taste fresh at all. I thought because I came late that's why so i tried again at 12 pm thinking they made it fresh in the beginning of the day, but I was wrong so I wouldn't recommend those.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. manapua

Nzt70Qfmq6L9pS8xpUoGPQ.text: Best local Hawaiian spot in Vegas, even better then the California..... this place though has a lot of filipno infused dishes so if you are not into that sort of thing and prefer more japanese / hawaiian then the Cal is for you.  Best thing about Aloha Kitchen is it is open super late and has a bar/lounge next door with alcohol. Food is good and the prices are better and the portions are generous. Adobo/Katsu combo is my favortie with portuguese sausage masubi. The Hawaiian Iced Tea is made super sweet though and the sun juices are a little pricier then the ABC store; but thats about the only gripes i have with the place.  As mentioned, the bar next door usually plays local top 40 and sometimes island jams and reggae, the drinks are mixed well and priced just right. They even got slots and video poker!   if your looking for a grub spot away from the strip, i would definitely go here, you will not regret it!

fclVguwKe5MJ7qmHBAMN_g.text: Haven't been here in a while because my last experience was bad. Unfortunately not much has changed. The rice (a staple of the 808 plate lunch) was dry and tasted old. The Teri chix was not marinated- instead just some sticky Teri sauce was globbed over it. And the portions got smaller. Definitely not a go back to place. Sigh-guess I'll have to make the drive to Isle Sushi on Eastern.

Ocb15u5Hk2RFrDFRKsp-tw.text: Coming to Las Vegas, word of mouth for Polynesian partiers, this place was highly recommended. Arriving at midnight, the bartender was terrible and showed frustration, unable to keep up with clientele. Pricey for a bar off the strip, and the atmosphere of "gangland" was definitely in the air. Foods from next door, was ok. However the customer service was terrible. The show of fatigue and frustration was evident via the employees, which made it very uncomfortable. All in all, what everyone hyped up about this place is so off, better with a cooler in the parking and ordering food to go.

wmuls45I0f6BcSFYxO2NlA.text: one of the best food resto around the valley.. make sure to visit here and get the barbQ chicken.

KVupdIkDDHrQqJF2RPhxIg.text: Howzit Boo? That's how i said hello to them, but they thought i was crazy. I guess they don't know their pidgeon skills. I would think working at this place they would know how to speak a bit of pidgeon. The food definitely broke da maut, but maybe because i was drunk at 4 in the morning.   Ordered the Portuguese Sausage with egg over rice. Added tons of ketchup on there and had a great drunken meal! Got my Hawaiian Sun Lilikoi drink.. felt like i was at rainbow drive in all over again... NOT! hhaha far from it, but it's close enough since were about 2000 miles away!   Mahalo Brah! Aloha

YdNPwuEKQa52E8uSVovOGQ.text: Pretty good with the usual "local" food from the islands, but usually only during the day. Probably one of the better ones here in Las Vegas, during this time period.   However, I went there a few times late evenings, and it seems like the quality suffers bit.

j3sAjrQBnVg0EOiylpkmrg.text: Ate here twice during vacation! The Loco Moco is one of the best! The Spam Musubi was perfect and at a good price! Definetly coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco to go! Tasted great! Sauce is killer!

XZmsDdUO4oM8sxZaOy0qRQ.text: Was craving for a late Hawaiian meal with my coworkers and ventured  across town to find aloha kitchen. I had ordered the loco moco and I must say, it's not the best thing I ever had. The hamburger steak was so dry and lack any kind of flavor, the gravy was ok.  Would I come back? Sure, the prices were decent and might be worth trying again if I get one of those late night Hawaiian food cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kl-9rTMVUZocLAPaAtUaSQ.text: Good Hawaiian/Filipino place. The local plate is our fave with the spam musubi. Adobo omelette is the other one

U8ZQSdHrMU0LgvHxyE63dw.text: The Portugese sausage fried rice omelette was delicious! I can't say enough good things about it so I won't say anything else at all and just let you yelpers try it for yourselves.  The lumpia was just so so.  Spam musubi is normal. Better than L&L but not by much.  When i was here I saw a homeless lady with her 3 kids walk in to use the bathroom and drink water that is provided out in the open for apparently anyone.  A little disturbing but it was 115 degrees outside and I don't want to see anybody die from the heat so I was like whatever.  If the owner or employees want to allow this that's there choice.

CKVjgVz4pHNkz6pT-lVIEg.text: Great because its hawaiian food open late but terrible consistency. Theres times where my rice is just so watery, feels like it may be a couple ounces away from being a porridge, if your eating a rice dish sometimes rice can make or break your entree. There is times when the chicken comes out looking and feeling like a raw defrosted chicken even when ordered skinless its so flimsy like its only been cooked for a few seconds. Another bad thing about this place is how they run your food. If theres more than one person sitting at a table i dont think one person should get their food 5-10 min before the others. Its just wrong going to eat with someone and basically they eat without you or you without them.. Or they wait and by the time yours or their food comes yours is already cold. Other than that when the food is cooked right its very delicious. They have very good potential of being one of the best hawaiian places in town but consistency kills.

nsmQeJPogo440lVmJM7usA.text: I hate to do this -- but here goes . . . . I was totally craving local food (aka Mom's cooking) and thought I'd get my fix at Aloha Kitchen.  I'm from Maui, so . . . there's nothing quite like Mom's, but I thought this might come close.   Our group had the chicken katsu, teriyaki chicken and teri beef plates with the rice and mac salad.  I can't say any of the above was worth a repeat visit.   The katsu - I make better katsu myself and with that being said, I think L&L's katsu is better and . . . that's still L&L, not Mom's.  This was very garlicy, small strips of thin chicken with more crunch than chicken.  The sauce was ok, not best ever, but ok. Honestly could not finish it, I threw 1/2 of it away and I never do that. It was THAT bad.  And for the record, I had the bubbly stomach (gas) effect all afternoon.  Gross.  I think I have a problem with their teriyaki sauce.  The chicken was average and teri beef was chewy.  Sauce was ok, but like a 2-star says . . . "Meh. I've experienced better".    I was most disappointed with the hard, dry rice - it's not hard to cook rice!!  Even my 8 year old makes better rice - cmon now!!  And then came the mac salad which again, L&L does better.  It wasn't awful, but it wasn't great either.  And it certainly wasn't Mom's.    Would I go back?  Nope.  It's close to my work and I'd love to say I would.  But nope.  Place was pretty crowded though and I've been told to "order breakfast next time", but I wasn't feeling breakfast at 12:00 Noon.

btJjaVoi8QjcRkelwQLMJw.text: This place is SO AWESOME. After a late night, this is my next morning go to place (of course i've already had pho at the 24 hour place at 3am already so that's not an option).   I ordered the spam musubi and adobo. The adobo is so tender and perfect. Even in california, I have trouble finding good filipino food , so you could probably get a sense of my excitement when I had this. The spam musubi is like any normal spam musubi. It might have a bit more rice than usual, but I just use it to eat the adobo. The food here is very inexpensive and is very good. I love this place! Such a gem inside this plaza.

L1Ajzql9wIYy6TthDdmxfA.text: Great and exciting hip place to meet to have some little bite or dine in, nice ambiance , friendly atmosphere.. I have been going at this place for years and great place to hold company parties and other occassions.

XYHSUBGNtIby5oma9hf9bw.text: I just need something heavy and comforting to sop up some drinks I had and some adobo omelette sounded good.  The BF and I shared:  Adobo Omelette- pretty good and quite large and filling. It hit the spot I was looking for.  Local Plate: chicken and beef teriyaki, 2 spam musubis- the meats and all are fine, mac salad is fine, but I don't like the thick teriyaki they use. Unfortunately, they pour the sauce on top of the meats and put some in the musubi so it wasn't that great of a plate for me. If I knew then I would have asked it without and maybe it would be better.   This was my 2nd time here. It's been a while since the last visit was less than stellar (they forgot some of the elements on my plate, added a meat we didnt order on another plate) and I remember thinking it was just okay tasting.   I think it's alright for late night eats, but there are other better Hawaiian plate places for daytime.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Random cute stools in a corner
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo Omelette, Local plate, mac salad

b8PrANwB1j2BVFxiRDo1KA.text: Filipino food AND Hawaiian plate lunch?! me thinks yes!!!  The Adobo Fried Rice Omelet is super ono/super sarap. Adobo Fried Rice wrapped in an omelet...fyi it's pretty ginormous & big enough to share. Otherwise one can conquer it if they're super hungry. The different plate lunches are really yummy too. Chicken Katsu plate served up w/ rice & mac salad.   Don't forget to order a spam musubi too & get a can of Hawaiian Sun to wash it all down!  Aloha Kitchen isn't too far off the strip so if you're looking for some local cheap eats, big portions & good food then this is definitely worth trying!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. adobo fried rice omelet &amp; hawaiian sun

o18jUWWLOlaOeIuN6thEGQ.text: Ate here twice with my group because the food was so good and cheap! You can tell a place is good when the local people eat here. I had the Korean ribs one night, fried rice the next with egg and both were delicious. I would recommend this place if you are looking for good, local eatery.

0JmqPM3Qfyat4TQMiLWd3g.text: Food is always really tasty and fresh, and I love how late it's open. I normally order the garlic chicken with gravy or the BBQ chicken. Really convenient and food comes out quickly!

9t-5_KHT3ohEpEFHbteZ5w.text: Used to go here once a month or so. Then I was a victim of racism and I'll never go there again. The incident happen during the daytime (was busy, but not that busy). I ordered 2 entrees and waited for our food to come out. 20 min. later, I asked where's my food? They told me it was coming. I saw  6 Asians come in WAY AFTER I ordered and they got food in 4 minutes. No exaggeration. Once I saw that, I canceled my order and demanded a refund. Don't go there if you aren't Asian!

s_x8pAEQnTfHuHpHE7nObw.text: I come here every now and then as its not that close to where I live now. They have quite a selection and there's always something new to try. Food is great but my last visit service was disappointing that's why it's 4 stars.

h6Wz2X7hlrLvqoA6sv8bVw.text: The food used to be great..it changed. The kalbi ribs are too sweet and the meat got thinner. The macadamia pancake is too sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macadamia nut pancake
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kaibi ribs

VvDFcGxf3y7XIQqLIOuWYw.text: Allways loved this place. This location is nice and looks like it was newly renovated. Very clean. Kalbi ribs are juicy and sweet.  Spam musubi are fav(:

uXU_vJaEkJFtpm139juiZw.text: Gross. This place makes the worst teriyaki I have ever had. I've given this place 3 chances. They smother it with a sugary thick sauce and then give you little rice. The service is not that great when it comes to the older lady at the front. I have tried the other place on Maryland and it is a little bit better. I think the spam musubi is overpriced as well as all of the food. At least for the taste. Please review your food Aloha Kitchen...I'm headed for the franchised Hawaiian restaurants.

3hkhQVmr_Mw_KBVYEuQwVw.text: It's been over 2 years since I last ate this kind of food. I was so excited to finally eat at this place after being in Vegas for 7 days. I ordered the teriyaki meal, special combo and an order of lumpias. The food smelled so good, it reminded me of A & A's in Samoa. When I tore into the plates, I was so disappointed. The teriyaki had a very weak flavor almost bland. I could have done without the chicken and Kim chee which was jarred from any grocery store. Such a huge let down after craving this food for so long.

iycxljsoAWGMSZ4ztUrRYQ.text: Can anyone tell me the most bussy times ? Like what day and what time would be good to go ?

U1NvuqfeUSZHj81jnZQmJQ.text: This is one of my favorite places around the end of the month when I'm close to broke. Good food and very affordable. Since the first time I came here I felt like home, it reminded me of my mother's cooking. No, shes not Hawaiian, but her secret  ingredient waaas?....SPAM! And one thousand possibilities. But I have tried other favorites like  Mahi mahi katsu combo, also the teriyaki chicken and they're as good as...well, spam. This place is always busy so the word is out.  If you're looking for some good affordable home tasting Hawaiian food. Aloha kitchen is the place!                           You don' say ham, say spam!

Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mahi plate

riDLW90bAJDusW8Vt8O_nQ.text: Love this place and their awesome chill staff! The one and only Aloha Kit. Place I been going to since 2010 and haven't gotten one bad experience yet, knock on wood. Haha Plus they stay open late till 3am which is the best when there is really nothing open around that time

HNKe5hVZ7Cd-6pNEr8mPFA.text: One of my favorite places! Kalbi combo the best!! Customer services always great and food always yummy!

a68kXKrQ13NE7V57g52FCQ.text: Aloha kitchen is a staple I don't know why I've never reviewed. I've been coming here since I moved to the valley in 2011, but only to the one on Sahara.  The staff is friendly and always walking around to make sure the customers are doing well.  If we come in the morning we get the topsilog (Filipino breakfast dish) with over medium eggs, loco moco which is a HI staple. Their saimin is always a good go to if you looking for something light but filling. Now they offer oxtail soup year round with 2 heaping scoops of rice its SOOOOOO ono. The combination plate is the way to go if your not sure on what you want to eat it has a little bit of everything you cant go wrong and it comes with mac salad.   Defiantly try their adobo omelet you wont be disappointed their are a few restaurants in town that offer it on their menu but there's something about Aloha's that just does it better, my fam from SD always requests me to pick one up when they are in town, and if they drove themselves they take one to go its that good.   word of advice: If your coming during lunch OR your short on time do yourself a favor and call your order in a head of time.

toUUt1rdWrhzA5pT9l73rg.text: Our go to place for local grinds.. Very friendly atmosphere. Large portions and hella good.  The husband and kids favorite is the Kalbi ribs plate.   My fave is adobo fried rice and the fried saimin. Tasty

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi ribs plate and the adobo fried rice omelet

kArhh6K1dzpNSNkbv2PktA.text: Love this place. Family friendly and friendly staff. Delicious adobo omelet  I love bringing my family when they come into town. It never is a fail. We leave full and happy.

r43ZCeQB01e5l_WJJL5VhA.text: Great choice of Hawaiian style foods, excellent and friendly customer service. There is also a karaoke in a closed off area of the restaurant. I will DEFINITELY keep coming here.

cLza0DfQTWSN7yyQ_Uup7w.text: You guys are great first time .. serv was a great... prices was very affordable they should raise there prices cause the food is amazing ... thank you for a amazing experience

iN6T-yE0-fDRDx_ov4CNeA.text: Really friendly staff! Great ambiance, please open one in California. I'm willing to eat here 7 times a day. My girlfriend loves the banana pancakes.. more than me.

nYWQekTWmYKR2zwU96C37w.text: Best SPAM musubi in town ! And for $5 i always get the chicken teriyaki bowl !!! I go to the barbershop next door so this place makes the time go by fast while waiting for my husband and son to get their haircut.

TkZpdKHR1to2POLHHg_ElQ.text: I've been here many times before for karaoke and it's been a blast every time. I think my favorite part about this place is not only the people and service but the fact the kitchen is open late too. Mahalo for an awesome visit every time.

Yc4Tb1P1YgPIYH0k26VmHg.text: Food is good, service is good. But policy, sucks. This is the first place that I've been to that requires a matching identification for a debit transaction. So that means if you have a significant other that is sick at home and you use her card to go out and buy food, I don't recommend thus place. I would highly recommend aloha specialty located in the California Hotel and casino. The food is just as good and they do both debit and credit transactions.

KmgTjb2KbK-zDUkwmY8hJA.text: Love this place! One of my coworkers suggested this for lunch one afternoon and I'm so glad I went! I ordered the chicken curry and it was so delicious. We ate in and the food came super fast and it was hot and delicious. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry

Einqwy22TjoQEDk88dJjYA.text: Friendly staff, very yummy! My pal recommended it to me! I got chicken curry Katsu and a fried banana thingy it's delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uaH2N8bMXHvh_ka7pYEvcQ.text: This Hawaiian is the best!!! Always great service and friendly workers! Good is great, the local plate is my favorite on the menu! If you like local kine grinds, then you gotta come here!

n9TeRWGYMfZIbo7AFCwK7g.text: This place have the best Hawaiian Kalbi. Good Ono grindz. They are open late and my girls loves coming here for dinner. The oxtail soup is good

BlajWNnrkFHC7fU-PgvJqA.text: Great place nearby me. Have been to a few other of their locations the menu is obviously the same just the people that cook it makes a world of difference. Food comes out in a timely manner.

bg_shCvdE6pJeF0wlA0Y_w.text: Food is great. We come here about every Wednesday night and see aunty Cyndel and Sean at the bar! My roomie loves to sing karaoke too .

kpr-C9hhwaw4b6prDN93kA.text: This isn't local food.   Garlic chicken was BBQ Chicken with garlic powder and then they drowned it in gravy!   I wouldn't order again.    In fact, $12 for a plate of (so-called) garlic chicken and veggies.   Forget it.   No Aloha at all.

VPtg_NmMCnRKLe6ndY8tlg.text: Love this place. The corn beef hash is fire. If you haven't Eaten here I highly suggest you try it!!

l3pPwO1GHDus84ScUlqjOQ.text: The food is amazing here :) I always have a great time time at the karaoke bar area.  My top 3 dishes you must try  -Adobo Omelette -Local Plate -Kula Pig and Cabbage    Proud sponsor of pLaYhOuSe basketball

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is always a MUST when the boys are in Las Vegas :)
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Local plate is on point :)
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner wit Eldrin, Lyman &amp; Chris.

sFxBpKBtg8Iac5BZA5Yiyg.text: Food was great and large portions. Parking lot is horrible though. Located in a not so great area in Vegas...off strip.  Got my car window smashed into and they stole a sports bag in less than 30 mins! Luckily we were all ok and the only thing in the sports bag that was worth any value was a jersey.

dp31yDQUVDUNuFTYhMKbcg.text: this is the place to be for free karaoke late night ono dining and wen ur craving for local food

wRGGj6HbCtC32u4fDFqIDQ.text: Just left this restaurant. The food was disgusting and barely edible. We both ordered the chicken bowl in which the chicken was mainly fat and skin. Vegetables were cabbage and one piece of celery. as you can see we left most of it there. Save your time and money and go elsewhere

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken bowl
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken bowl and kimchi

_Hod2bWOHDxiyqRTxcD_Ig.text: Not sure why I didn't review this place years ago. An old friend from Hawaii who lives in Vegas introduced me and my bestie, who also grew up in Hawaii to this little gem. Every time I'm in Vegas I come here.   The kalbi is my fave and a lot of he menu is Filipino dishes made right. My bestie gets her spam musubi (which I don't eat anymore, but she says it legit tastes Hawaii style).   It's difficult to get Hawaiian Sun drinks on the East Coast especially my fave, passion orange flavor. When I'm in Vegas I get several cans from Aloha and put them in my hotel fridge! I also have to admit I've packed some and brought it back to FL once. I grew up drinking that stuff on the daily.  This may not be fine dining, but it reminds me of the plate lunches back home in Hawaii and a trip to Vegas isn't the same unless I stop in.

05amZ-SAleOWrPhB6pxeyA.text: When I ordered, it was about 10pm and i was hungry. We ate pizza earlier at 3pm but that was too early for a dinner for me because I felt like I had just eaten brunch at that point. So we decided to order from Yelp via Grubhub. It gave a timeline of when it would be ready but it was actually faster than it said it would be.   We had it delivered for our Airbnb and they came up to the door. I already had something to try from here because the other morning, we had their pork adobo omelette. It was good so we decided to get local food.   I went with the longganisa and rice while my boyfriend decided to get the teriyaki chicken, teriyaki beef and two musubis. We also got Shanghai lumpia. It was just like food back home. I loved it. It satisfied my tummy. It was convenient and yummy. I would order from there again or go there to eat when in Vegas!

JnWO3YKkDmSQysEg9RU68w.text: Not sure if they changed owners or whatever happened but this place. We used to go there often because they are open late although their food was always average. But in the past few months the food is barely edible, while the service has gotten worse and worse. We had to wait 30 minutes for a beef bowl, and the taste was horrible, tasted like leftovers from a few days ago. Lately every time we go there the waiting times are becoming longer and the servers ignore customers. They also overcharged us a few times; at first we were naive to believe it was a mistake and asked them to correct it. We obviously realized it's a pattern by now.  As for their bar, I wouldn't recommend either, it smells horrible and the servers seem to hide behind the bar or not even be there at all. Not sure why, you'd expect them to want to serve and get tipped... Oh well. We won't be back...

HPTCM_A4D5MDaOTPYM2zMQ.text: Ok so my grand daughter's mom who lives in Las Vegas found this spot.  She just goes for the Teri chicken which is fabulous.  I am a foodie and as a world traveler aka military brat I had the privilege of being exposed to all kind of dishes from different countries.  Aloha Kitchen will get you to Korea, Hawaii and the Philippines.  Made to order, friendly staff and quick service.  I love there Kimchi...all delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to the dinner...they also have a bar and karaoke.
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sample menu

WMNRxs790jGkdwHxYBIWsQ.text: A place to hit up after a drunken night out or if you're in the mood for some karaoke. I personally have not done the latter so can't say much for what goes on in there.  Food is okay, you can get a lot of Filipino Hawaiian staples like Loco Moco, Spam Musubi, Kalbi, Lumpia. Ordered the Tapsilog a couple of times, flavors were definitely on point but the beef itself was tough so it was disappointing. There isn't an option to do garlic rice either which is vital for a Tapsilog in my opinion. They have plenty to offer on the menu so I'm sure you can find something that will appease your palate. The place needs serious updating though. But when you're drunk and hungry it's the least of your worries I'm sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana macnut pancakes
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tapsilog

PRMT5RG4ApNfpYM7hGbYrQ.text: Sitting here for about 10 minutes now waiting for our delicious food and decided to instantly write a review! The environment is so mellow and relaxing.. I LOVE how they have really good artists always playing!   This place is both filipino & Hawaiian food.. I've been going here way more than i should of but def. no regrets there. IM ALWAYS craving Hawaiian food or poke. My boyfriend and I always order the same plate just because its literally so good we don't even want to order anything else. So many different plates to choose from so we both really need to step out of our comfort zone lol! Amazing quality and price for the food. I would choose a plate any day then dine in a fancy establishment.   Service was really good and knowledgeable! :) always chill people in the store which is a plus.. I love it. I can come here to study as well because that's how mellow the atmosphere is. Totally can't decide between Aloha kitchen and L&L anymore just because I wish at Aloha kitchen they let you have a mixed plate like half chicken katsu and half loco moco where they can mix plates in half. But unfortunately they dont.. But service and environment def. goes to Aloha kitchen. But food options and portions goes to L&L. Both have amazing quality though!   Local Plate: 10/10 around  2 Spam musibi, teriyaki chicken, beef and a scoop of rice with macaroni salad   Kalibi rib combo: 8/10 around  Teriyaki chicken, Kalibi Ribs, Chicken Katsu and a scoop of rice with macaroni salad  *Didnt like how sometimes my order portion comes out small and other time big and they sometimes skimp on kalibi ribs too  But overall, ALWAYS coming back for more! Can't get enough of this place. I wish there was a drive thru lol so i can get it like fast food

GutTSXTQjlwq-ZSCadq5zQ.text: I've been coming to Aloha Kitchen since high school! An ex of mine introduced it to me, & I've been in love with this place since. I always ordered their Local Plate which includes a scoop of rice, chicken & beef teriyaki, two spam musubi, & macaroni salad. It's around $8-9 without a drink. I thought it was a pretty good deal which is why it's my go to order each & every time.   However, I recently placed a take out order from here & got my usual. When I arrived home, I opened the box and was really disappointed at what I saw. There used to be a big portion of chicken and beef teriyaki, but now it only looks like it's just the leftover, unwanted part of the meal. You know when you eat your meal & whatever is leftover, you give it to the family dog? Well, that's exactly what the beef teriyaki looked like. It was such a small portion, I was disappointed. It wasn't like how it used to be where the portions were a good size for the price you pay.   I do have to add that the people who work here are very sweet and welcoming. That's probably one of the reasons why I come back. The food is delicious & the people are great. However, the serving sizes? Disappointing.

kRyiUGogvVHaWqMwN0ri4A.text: Avoid this spot. Got katsu and chicken teriyaki  1) burnt chicken katsu breading and dry chicken inside  2) the chicken was not prepared fresh on the spot, tasted like the chicken was prepped and cooked in the morning and they just threw it back on the grill to warm it up just so it tasted hot.  3) Chicken had no flavor and also the macaroni.  Do not recommend.

M2-FCW9pAYn_n_xFj-DcUQ.text: Such a bad experience. We definitely wouldn't be back.  The size of the portions was disappointing and we all felt like the food wasn't fresh and maybe even was recooked.  On top of that, the service was a disgrace.  Also, I don't understand why they wouldn't take credit card under 20$; they're pricey anyway.  Definitely not recommended.

6ZAgIvLAtICrRKnrdL4A3A.text: We ordered from here through uber eats. For the price, you get a lot of food. We got an order of lumpia, and two combo meals. One combo had teriyaki beef, teriyaki chicken and grilled fish. The other combo had teriyaki chicken, chicken Katsu and bone-in short ribs. The beef was a little tough and stringy. The chicken was tender since they used thigh meat. I didn't like the teriyaki sauce though - it was way too sickly sweet and I wished I had soy sauce for the meat instead. They also give a lot of rice, which is what we needed after a late night out. The mac salad was okay. I don't think I'd get food from here again, but it was alright.

AziFo_I1oyo6k_iQyvp-Mw.text: I have always enjoyed Aloha Kitchen at every location. This location  happens to be across the street from where I live. The restaurant was full on Saturday evening. There's another room with a stage inside. I always get either the Ramen or Kalbi Ribs. I was tempted to get the Oxtail Soup but decided to stick with the Kalbi Ribs and my friend got the Teriyaki Chicken and a couple of Spam Musubi. The kimchi was a lil softer than expected but overall food was good

WG7peMc7CeDJqNzbusIkhQ.text: If you're in the vicinity and you're itching for a plate lunch, this place will scratch the itch a bit.  IMHO, there are way better Island-kine food establishments in Vegas.  I stop in here because it's close to work, centrally located, and like I said, Aloha Kitchen helps scratch at that craving.  Last visit, I tried the beef curry stew, which I think was a special ... it was like a huge chunk of potato, couple pieces of carrot, and some stringy beef, with the requisite large scoops of rice and mac salad.  Not impressed.  Should have stuck with the tried-n-True adobo fried rice omelette.  Service is usually friendly and the wait is not too long.  A big plus is that the interior decor has been spiffed up considerably, the colors are inviting, and it seems much fresher inside.

xjdqdNKHJDu7no3e6KgHzw.text: Got the chicken katsu, teriyaki beef, and macaroni salad.  It tasted ok it was fresh.. Then I Spent the night throwing up and had diarrhea !!!! Won't be coming back :(

qeI1qbKGDQL8423LsYQ7Cg.text: The chicken teriyaki was very fatty and mostly dark meat. The sauce seemed to have a lot of cornstarch or other thickening agent. It's open late, has low prices, and has relatively fast service.

AVHXC6GD17J2c_rICowhqA.text: Karaoke was a blast, drinks are not too bad, staff is super friendly and attentive... we were not very thrilled about the mix plate that we ordered.

diBETmxUDYg2HC25w0xOKA.text: So unprofessional. Lady that I've never seen there before was talking about her personal business like she was at home. She was venting about something to the others. Her face was ticked off. Keep your personal issues at home and serve your customers!

42vP8PxSu7WWFE7qwwUpWQ.text: So "Aloha" means both hello and goodbye -- now how can I work that into my review?  Here goes:  To begin with it, I've never seen a combination bar and Hawaiian fast food place.  Aloha (Hello) Kitchen reminds me of a typical Hawaiian fast food place: well lit with a lot of cheesy decor. Besides having the basic plates, they also carried some unique stuff. I tried the Adobo Fried Rice and the wife tried the Saimin soup.  The food wasn't really anything to yelp about, but since it is a chain kinda place, you shouldn't expectation too much. I'd be willing to go back just because they serve poke (one of the items I don't find at a fast food place) on Friday and Saturday. So until then, Aloha (Goodbye) Kitchen.  Aloha (Hello) Bar is right next door to the Kitchen but is a 180 from the Kitchen: dark with a dive feel to it.  But it still gave off the laid back Island life vibe. Bartender was cool and even spoke to me in dakine.  Thanks. She stopped though when my face went blank and didn't respond.  Sorry. The music had the kinda beats I could groove to for a couple hours, and the crowd was chill. After a some drinks and a couple games of pool, I was saying Aloha (Goodbye) Bar.  Good thing since they just fired up the karaoke machine.  Overall, I'll be saying Aloha (Hello) sooner to the Bar than the Kitchen.  A special aloha to all the Vegas Yelpers from Hawaii. There are a bunch.

GN9HqXIW1YMPCz3lvaatSQ.text: I've never had any kind of islander food but this was amazing. Fast and very tasty. Most defiantly coming back.

HGmmory8PF9LkxBxoXatWg.text: Haven't eaten here in a few months. Happy I chose it for lunch today. It was delish. Thank you Aloha for a great lunch.

CYRuMd-Uf5b-5gsx8WRg_g.text: Came here with friends. Filipino fusion food. Had the rice with corn beef hash. They ran out of Tapa. =/ Food was delicious after drinking all night before. First meal of my vegas trip.

zR6_qowH1Qb42_YVmr_hgA.text: Great place to eat! The staff is great! You need to try the adobo fried rice omelet! Highly recommended!

HtedPHeU58_nMy64bR73mw.text: I always get the bbq chicken. Service always serve with Aloha. We also got spam Mitsubi, banana pancake and Kalbi combo. Yum!

HQaG61cUZuz4iPw11PuLQg.text: We came here for brunch. My first time here, and I ordered spam, eggs, and rice. It was delicious! However it took about 30 minutes for my order to come. If the wait wasn't so long, I would have given this place four stars.

SACRdFKmesFrODvws8wKOQ.text: I love this place there students specials never disappoint me and always fit in my budget but really I'm writing this review cause it was my turn to go for lunch. So of course it rained today and the place was packed. My office order was 2 bags and 3 drinks so since I only have two arms I asked for a cup holder they were out so instead of seeing me struggle they came from around the cashiers desk and helped me carry the 3 drinks out so very nice. She even complemented my car so sweet!! Love this place.

Tkx5H2Z14fm1K2zeOpR2Nw.text: One of Vegas' little gems... a fusion of Hawaiian/Filipino food. They have all of the things you would normally find at Hawaiian fast food places like L&L but the one thing I highly recommend that I haven't seen anywhere else is the adobo omelette: pork adobo fried rice all wrapped around fried egg. So delicious and huge... drool.

8Pk2sr14WMLkI3CW3DFMaQ.text: Had a party bus take us straight to this place from our hotel, yep, that's right,..a party bus. Awesome people working there! Had great food and they had a Filipino street food service when we got there! Great place to grab some comfort food!

vW7Ra-Qh5FCboQiMSDqyuQ.text: This place has may have the best food to offer but the service is not that great.They need training in giving good service to get better reviews.

tPD4VZKVtrWWUMP7k2-gYw.text: My Roomie Nicki G. was out & about for lunch on Valentines day, looking for a new Hawaiian BBQ place, since the one closest to us had changed their menu to all Chinese.   Needless to say, I had looked to the Yelpeeps for some answers & started searching & reading countless reviews. So, I mentioned this place to her & showed her the menu. It all looked pretty good & some of the reviews seemed very promising. Unfortunately, that is as far as it went. She brought back a Kalbi combo for me, which included Chicken Katsu & Teri Chicken.   I was super hungry & I was looking forward to digging in. However, I have to say I wasn't very impressed with the portions, especially the mac salad, which was in like really small cup. Not to mention the fact that is kind of had an odd taste to it, kind of like the way a Dentist's office smells. To me, this plate seemed like a mini plate & not like a regular. The 2 scoops of rice equaled about the size of 1 scoop you would find in a regular.   As far as taste goes, it was mediocre at best. Not very flavorful as far as the marinade went. The Kalbi was a little on the small side, as well as the Katsu & Teri Chicken. I didn't end up eating all of the Katsu, it just didn't seem like it was prepared very well. I don't know, maybe got spoiled living in Hawaii & just have high expectations.   Overall, based on this experience, I don't think I would return or even recommend this place. If anyone cares to compare, take a look at my L&L review & look at those pics of my plate lunch in comparison the pics I am posting for this review.   Just a side note: To me, mac salad is kind of like salsa. It is a very simple thing to make & even make it taste pretty good. However, a lot of places find some way to mess it up. I have been to many a good Mexican restaurant, but somehow the salsa is always bad. I don't know though, what can do? :P

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not even from a different view :P
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not too impressive

l2kH05xRaRj2RRZbOiPMNg.text: Oh boy oh boy.... Where do I begin..  I saw their advertisement for about 2 weeks for their xmas day buffet for $15.  The list of food sounded great and included many typical hawaiian items.  I arrived there around 7.  It was fairly quiet/empty and figured most people came there earlier. There were probably only 20 people in there when I arrived.   1st off the service was great. The employees were very nice and I definitely expected that being in a hawiian restaurant.  The place was also very clean and that too was not an issue.    The food is the main issue here.  When I walked upto the buffet, the sushi table had 3 basic rolls on there and was ok at best.  The lumpia was probably the most decent thing I ate.  I was in total shock when I saw the spam musubi.  They had it all nice looking, all cut in half in nice big pieces (this would've been perfect but NOOOO they screwed it up.) They had some sort of sauce on ALL of it. The problem is you CAN'T put sauce on a rice item like this that is sitting there.  I had one bite and it completely fell apart in my hand because the sauce had made the whole thing mushy.    The katsu was overcooked and dried out.  The halfway decent stir fry veggies were sorta ok but they were sitting under a heat lamp and getting mushy and all in all lacked flavor.  The curry was very bland. I tried a little of a few other dishes and again everything was bland and blah.  I was completely disappointed in the macaroni salad. WOW it had nooooo flavor to it. It was just simply mayonaisse.    The desserts were store bought donuts, some chocolate chip cookies, and some funky brownies.  and btw I saw other people sitting around me making faces too about the food.   There's a few problems here. #1 let's compare apples to apples... Aloha kitchen vs L&L Hawaiian. This buffet gave me a really good idea of what their food is like if I ordered it off their regular menu (vs buffet style) I have been to L&L many many times and wow they are definitely a LOT better then Aloha.  I have tried several things on their menu and everything has been flavorful, yummy, not over cooked and their macaroni salad is great too.   1 out of 10.. Aloha you're a 1.  L&L a 10. There was nothing good about the food at Aloha and I was VERY disappointed.  Now comparison #2.  Although now I'm comparing apples to oranges but still.    Aloha vs buffet @ asia which is just minutes up the street.  Aloha, you can not charge $15 for what you put on that buffet with that kind of quality.  Buffet @ Asia is WAY better then you in quality and selection for the same price.  Just sushi alone puts you to shame (and they don't have any fantastic sushi either but it's way better then yours)  and with Sushi Mon being 10 min up the street as well, they blow both places out of the water.    It's very tough to run a good restaurant, but if L&L can have almost all the same menu items and they do it right with quality, and taste and the same price, then so can you. Aloha kitchen.... You're a discrace to good hawaiian food.    I will continue my business at L&L

ObaSHwgqr--HmXeU5gsCfw.text: haven't seen a Hawaiian BBQ place that has adobo on their menu too! I wasn't too hungry but had a craving for shanghai lumpia $2.99 which hit the spot and ordered spam musubi $1.99 don't really know anywhere else to get lumpia without being invited to some family party, this will do until then, **4 stars for now because is there anyway you can possibly mess up shanghai lumpia or spam musubi? May change once I try the adobo fried rice omelette  **update: ordered the adobo fried rice omelette, didn't know what to expect, but imagine a thin omelette burrito stuffed with a fried rice/ adobo mixture.  The portion was huge but a little on the dry side, I had to add soy sauce/siracha to juice it up.  Otherwise, okay, not what I expected, it's basically fried rice and adobo with scrambled eggs.

aULcYFrOSXA5AgAuhi_q1A.text: Based on a recommendation, I was eager to try Aloha Kitchen.  I have to say I was not very impressed with the food.  I ordered the mix plate combination which came with beef, teriyaki chicken, and mahi (in egg batter).  The mac salad, the rice, and the beef were fine but I found the teriyaki sauce overwhelming and the mahi not very fresh.  They do give you a ton of food for a reasonable price.  Maybe I caught them on a bad day.  I also didn't care for the clean-up involving a ladder and lots of dust during lunch hour over the soda machine and the cups.

yhNI5aWrU71dwJO85ew7zA.text: Open until 3am, so it's a top choice for late night Hawaiian Filipino fusion. Just make sure to get there before 2:30am, that's when the kitchen closes.   We ordered the Loco moco $6.29, which was classically prepared: hamburger patty topped with a thick gravy and a fried egg all over rice. The hamburger meat was dry and the gravy was lacking much flavor. My boyfriend loves loco moco, but he wasn't happy with this version. I've came to the conclusion that I'm just not a fan of loco moco in general. I suppose I've just never had one that blew my tastebuds away. It's typically pretty bland with no real explosion or layers of flavor. I also can't get past the weird cornstarch gravy consistency. 2/5  The chicken katsu plate $7.69, came with a generous portion of fried chicken with 2 scoops of rice, one scoop of macaroni salad and a side of katsu sauce. The chicken was super crispy and fried to a dark golden brown (no it didn't taste burned), it was actually pretty moist inside. I've had better katsu sauce, but it wasn't bad - it was simple and does the job. Other than that, I didn't have any real complaints with this dish. A great price for what you get. Just make sure you're prepared for the food coma afterwards, it settles like a brick in your stomach. 4/5  The mac salad was simple, (just tatsted like mayo) but I enjoyed it. It went perfectly with the katsu plate. I ended up ordering an additional side for $1.99. The perfect bite: dip chicken katsu into katsu sauce, take a bite with rice and some mac salad all together... Perfect! 4/5  The spam musubi $1.99, was about the length of a dollar bill and had a thin slice of spam (didn't even fill the length of the musubi), some sweet gravy-like-sauce, and a brick of rice held together by seaweed. There was a ton of rice, but I ate it carefully making sure that each bite actually got some spam and sauce in, and it was pretty good. 3/5

Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco was just ok, not the type of dish you would want to doggy bag. Hamburger was dry and bland. Not my thing. $6.29

-KdbRvLwOSwkBExvDtGlbw.text: so when we finally get here, from the outside its like 'ready for some aloha in vegas' when i walk thru the doors its more like 'NOloha'  lol     spacious eatery thats feels more like a filipino eatery in nevada than a Hawaiian themed restaurant in Vegas.    bleh on the design, good color on the walls and all but they couldve gone to Aloha Swapmeet to buy some decor to really make this place 'pop'.   nice menu choices, i guess   ...hawaii esque  they got a karaoki bar here too so thats gotta be fun at some point.  line up, order, find a table, food brought out to you FOOD is OUTSTANDING!!!   ..has that home cooked flavor.   it was ery shocking to me   lol basically a better quality than the food of L&L. price comparable to that of JolliBee.  they got MACADAMIA NUT PANCAKES!   try the hash! loco moco has yummy gravy   ...all good for that added hypertension and high chilesterol level!

yOZRFbIEbO3s9R7oDIosXg.text: Aloha kitchen and bar   My friend ordered the Portuguese fried rice Omlet. He said it was good and tasty. He said it was a large portion for a single person. The rice and eggs were cooked properly.  I ordered The local plate. It had  Terry beef and chicken, Mac n cheese, 2 spam musubi. This was a lot for one person. Everything was tasting. The chicken and beef were great. Both were moist and juice. The 2 spam musubis were filling. Drinks are Pepsi flavors with free refills.   The parking is shared with other business. But there's plenty of parking available. There is Music playing is low, not to loud but you can hear it in the background. Modern theme style decor with bamboo accents.  There's a TV but it wasn't on.   I would recommend this place to my friends and family if they're ever in Vegas. I'll be coming back here once I come back to Vegas.

The kalbi ribs plate is my go to . I love the flavor and the meat is juicy and cooked perfectly .

c_adleg7di9OZiBtbJcJbA.text: Good grubbing of the island kine. We had a quick breakfast pick up here during a recent visit in Vegas with friends and ordered up a lot of food. We got the chicken katsu that comes with rice and macaroni salad for $8.49. My boyfriend got the adobo fried rice omelette also $8.49. They also have bar and karaoke attached. Recommend this place.

HD5ZRCr3tuUFmEL5GNM4dg.text: Not my go-to for Hawaiian food. Mediocre at best. Customer service is hit or miss (the women are more polite than the men). All-in-all, it's an OK spot for lazy Hawaiian food.
