ejnr-ypyrejXQcKeRbJ7oQ.text: This place sucks ass took them one Hour to realize   They had mess up my order.  was not busy at all never ever goin again

hfCGe-Kcyp5JWw0o1yElfg.text: I've been coming here since time immemorial. Still no WiFi???? Food is ok, place is ok, Karaoke is fun... I get it business is business but these days an establishment that neglects its customers, loyal customers, of WiFi signal so we can chill in a place becomes "skeptical". It ain't that expensive to provide customers this modern service. It's free advertisement if people can connect to YELP for business establishments.

-PqoXVWIvqyjRyUQ9kjj_A.text: Totally disappointed with my order today. I placed an order via DoorDash. My order included a chicken Katsu plate. Received my order from the driver without problems. Sat down to eat, opened the bag to find no Katsu sauce. Chicken Katsu cannot be eaten without Katsu sauce. Called aloha kitchen, call transferred to Isaiah who stated he handed the sauce to the door dash driver so if I didn't get the sauce, it's because the driver didn't give it to me. I called the driver who confirmed no sauce was handed to him. I called Isaiah backed who insisted he did in fact hand the sauce to the driver. Not sure why the Katsu sauce wasn't placed in the bag to begin with. Isaiah said they were busy with orders and that there was nothing he could do for me but to apologize. Well, I'm sorry, but an apology doesn't deliver Katsu sauce to me. And I just wasted money on a chicken Katsu plate that I didn't eat because without the sauce, it's not the same. I asked to speak with a manager, but of course the manager is off today and Isaiah is "covering" today. Sorry, but this is not Aloha. This is not how you conduct service recovery. Aloha kitchen has just lost business from me and my family.  Too bad, because Aloha Kitchen was one of our favorites. Oh well, Lots of other good local food eateries to choose from in Las Vegas these days.

AIP-o8-ZVkLzEIcrwM6MIg.text: I'd been following this place on Instagram for a couple months before my vacation, in Vegas. From the menu, I could tell this place was legit and authentic! I lived on Oahu, West side, and I'm always down for some good plate lunch.  My husband and I had the Samin (fried noodles with pork and cabbage) a loco moco and spam musubi.  The Samin was AMAZING!!! Reminded me of the auntie on the corner who used to sell plates to all the neighborhood, in Wainaie. Very flavorful, and cooked to perfection!  The loco moco was impressive. The gravy was full of flavor and a great consistency. The eggs were perfectly cooked so the yolk spilled all over the meat. A lot of places over cook the fried egg... compliments to the chef! The spam musubi was great too!  We brought our family and have been recommending it to all of our local friends! We will be back every time we come to Vegas!

hzGGJwINMmVEJZogNyZ7lA.text: We leisurely drove into town from San Diego, making frequent stops.  We arrived quite late and were very hungry. This location was open until 5 am, but last call for food orders was 4:30.  We have my daughter with us, but were told to stay on the restaurant side. We ordered the adobo fried rice omelette, oxtail soup, katsu & kahlua pork combo, and a spam breakfast with rice and eggs.  We were so hungry that we went back to order a second spam breakfast and the adobo plate.  We always stop in to eat here whenever we are in town.  Maybe twice. Once we introduced my parents to the adobo fries rice omelette, they ask for it every time.  The wait for our food was not long. The food is delicious, the portions are generous, and the prices are light on your wallet.  The staff is friendly and accommodating. The dining area is immaculately clean.  They do not let tables sit piled with dirty dishes.  After saying good bye, the tables are cleared and ready for the next hungry customers.   Sorry that I don't have pictures of food. We were very hungry! Maybe next time, folks!

LkN7HrrlWoyWJA3J-0oXOg.text: I never have a bad experience at this place. I need my Hawaiian fix every now and then and aloha Mitch never disappoints. First off, the menu has the Hawaiian classics. The prices are a little higher than most Hawaiian food places in town but also, there's some finds that are of quality and of low cost, like the chicken with gravy I got! (Chicken teriyaki bowl substitute teriyaki with gravy. I love their gravy!)   The service here is always so quick and so friendly, it makes the experience that much better. Always walking in and being greeted with aloha is the best thing. Especially when you go to other restaurants and you don't get near the same hospitality!   My boyfriend got a local plate which has all the staples and a side of kimchee. The kimchee is nice and crispy and the soak in their spam musubis are not on the light side.   I will be back here time and time again whether it be during the day or late at night to get my aloha fix. Thank you so much aloha kitchen for being consistent, keep doing what you're doing!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cutlet with gravy bowl
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Local Plate and Kimchee

X1RatSVSBsrs-pQ3SWzkzA.text: Stopped in randomly as I drove by and the voices from the back seat rang, I'm hungry.  Like a buzzing sound in my ear. So, do I hit the Vegas strip and fight for parking or just pull in park and eat.   Why not.  Nothing like I expected. Teriyaki sauce is delicious with its own flavor. It's hard to explain other than it tasted like teriyaki yet it was an original flavor. It had just the right amounts on the beef and so much for eating half and the rest later. Yup, I crushed it all in one sitting. Roll me out of here. The sticky rice was on point. The Hawaiian macaroni salad, boom delicious.   The ambiance kind of reminded me of an old back in the day diner. Nothing to write home about but I quickly forgot about looking around and was hypnotized by the food.   Bathroom clean and that makes me happy inside. In a warm kind of way.   The customer service was everything Aloha.   Mahalo.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki beef plate.
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki beef plate white rice and macaroni

rfrV8gtEpRPZ5QNNa18CFw.text: It's okay.. portions have really changed since 2017. I've always been use to the local places in hawaii so when we first moved out here & tried them it was definitely a downgrade compared to back home. But since then?! It's gotten worse. Portions are even smaller than before lol didn't think it was possible but I didn't really have high expectations about it. Lol just bc it's called "Aloha kitchen" n serves local food doesn't mean it's owned by a local person lol! A True local would've understood this! Their chicken katsu plates are way smaller than LULUS Hawaiian BBQ for sure. They are convenient when it's late at night n you hungry but definitely not out Go To.

PcmR-Os4tgpnDrlykjSP4A.text: I used to frequent here waaaay back in the day before Yelp existed.  Nice trip down nostalgia lane on the last visit, and the grindage still rocks..  Aloha Service & Ambiance:  Total mom and pop resto with booths and tables from when I used to frequent here back in the day.  Hawaiian mood music plays in the background.  The open dining area is clean and quaint.  You put your order in, given a number and the staff will deliver your food to the table.  The drinks are self serve so most of the staff is in the kitchen or delivering which helps get the food out quickly.  Aloha grindage:  I went with the local plate and everything was all good.  The chicken and beef were marinated and cooked well. The spam musubis were fresh and the mac salad was on point.  I tried the garlic chicken and it was delicious.  I think that's what we're going with next visit  All the plates we ordered offered generous volume and it's easy to take food home here unless you're pretty hungry.  If I was on this side of town more often, I could see way more visits.  For now it's nice to know that Aloha Kitchen is still sending out good Hawaiian food for reasonable prices.  It won't be so long until the next visit.  Mahalo!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Local plate
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlc chicken

taSG0TlhjB0bKQnZ44wO1g.text: Very delicious!! Cashier is very friendly. Local music playing in the background while we enjoy our food!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aloha Plate
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger combo

FJo7-aW2m6ThY3QWC8xbeQ.text: I live out of the state and that was my 1st stop when I got out of the airport. It is and was as amazing as I remembered! Staff always so nice and smiles! I cannot express how much I love this place. Kalbi combo is it for me and don't ask me if I want to share ;)

KpJTIJV0qyhWlgzSYIAtZQ.text: First time at this location. So happy that they are open until 5AM. Separate area for the restaurant but has a connecting door to the karaoke bar next door. They share the same restrooms.   ADOBO FRIED RICE OMELETTE is what we keep coming back here for. $8 for a huge serving, easily shared between 3. Fried rice with shredded adobo wrapped in a thin layer of egg. Your answer to any breakfast, lunch, dinner, or midnight snack problems. Also tried their spam musubi & the Hula (?) plate... the one with fish & shrimp tempura, comes with rice & mac salad.   The adobo fried rice omelette was so good... we ordered 2 more to-go. Service was good. Place is clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9bGeUaXCzYl1ZogegXK7eg.text: I wanted to order a Hawaiian plate which has pork Lau Lau and kala pig. Unfortunately, they ran out of Lau Lau at 4pm. Then again, my wife reminded me that I don't like Lau Lau. Haha, So no deductions there. I got the Kalbi Combo instead. Kalbi was really good and easy to chew! Chicken teriyaki and katsu were both yummy as well!   I only did 4 stars due to the wonton soup. We both thought it was too salty. I initially tried the soup and I can already taste the soup. The noodles were alright. The wonton itself were the saltiest part of it. You would think it would be the best part. It was tasted saltier than mcdonalds fries with extra salt.   Hopefully it was just our soup. Maybe if you order it, you won't have the same experience. But if you're meat water, the kalbi combo is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salty Wonton Soup
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Combo with extra rice instead of Macaroni or Kimchi

P4Zh0LpEcN-3YQ-7mmxkNQ.text: This place never lets me down whenever I'm craving some local Hawaiian food especially during the late night hours.  The last tine my husband and I came here, we both got the Wonton Saimin & two spam musubis. You would think that the saimin bowls are small until you get them. They are huge bowls of saimin! We of course demolished the saimin like it was nothing. The wontons are bursting with flavor, the saimin broth was delicious. And of course, the spam musubis always taste like home.  FYI: try the pork adobo fried rice. It is cooked so well, the portion is huge. You won't regret it.

lThwLl7Yyi-KLR65oTWJcw.text: I can never say no to Loco Moco! Loco Mocos are my inner child's love and my inner child was driving this morning to a wonderful Hawaiian food place called Aloha Kitchen. This place also turns into a karaoke bar at night on the other side, so that would be awesome to check out one day, but as of now, this review is only for the restaurant side.  It was about ten in the morning when I made my way here and I only had one thing on the mind, okay maybe two things on the mind...Loco Moco and Spam Musabi.  The Loco Moco was very good. The hamburger patty was cooked well done but still very juicy. My over easy eggs were cooked perfectly and they put just the right amount of gravy to cover every bite. Now the rice is what makes a good Loco Moco and they are gooood rice makers! Just the right amount of stickiness and firmness where it held the gravy on top but didn't soak it up. The spam Musabi was also freshly made. Spam was pan fried and hot and nori was still crispy with each bite. It is always a good sign that they take the time to make it to order and not premade.  Loved the diner feel to the place and will definitely be back to sink my teeth in the other goodies they offer!  Next time with maybe some karaoke!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelet

COcLp0FFZGF8z5gm6WGiZA.text: Love this Aloha location, team is very friendly and efficient.  I tried the mahi mahi today, very different way to eat fish. It was still tasty !  We love the teriyaki chicken bowl there also.  Copious portion for a good price.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-LrolOucH1SaMNeerYcHUw.text: I am a usual here. I love the food and the service. Just last time got some extra burnt something on our pancakes and got the wrong type that was ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt stuff in our pancakes

c6FsAuAXl2sw6xkp5UgJBg.text: I've been a frequent diner at this location (only) since 04' and the food + service has been consistent.   I miss the Kalbi + BBQ Chicken now that I'm a faithful Pescatarian; however the fresh crunchy Kimchi and vegetable egg rolls alone are enough to keep coming back.   Of course there are tons of Hawaiian joints but I prefer this one and my friends and family do as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boneless BBQ Chicken $8.49
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Plate
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Beef Ribs (my mums absolute fave) $10.49

NOhWP0r6aNQxM-g3oikEyw.text: Place is pretty good, price is not too bad. Place has a bar connected to it that offers kareooke which I thought was pretty cool. When I went it was lunch time so there was noone in there but can only imagine late nights. The only real problem that I had was that my food came 10 minutes  after my girlfriend's food came so I was there watching her eat for a while. Other than that I would come back. PS don't order the limpia, too small and kinda tasteless.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Limpia
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VJvhhVOV5x2ZNnCbJW9a2w.text: Kalbi BBQ Chicken is amazing!   Love how the lady that takes your orders always treats you like family and remembers your orders! Love getting a bite to eat and having a drink in the bar! Love this place !

P3hkOkjCGZhZ5THJAG1rPQ.text: What's not to love with Aloha Kitchen. Amazing local food and opens late. I've been going to 5jis location for a long time and I highly recommend it. The Kalbi combo is a big plate of barbeque meats and their Spam Musubi is addictive. Adobo Fried Rice Omelette though is a must have on the table, any other place in my opinion does not compare with Aloha Kitchen. If you're feeling soup, I recommend the oxtail soup. This location also have the karaoke place right next to it with a wet bar and while it gets pretty expensive it is a fun thing to option. It's also separate from the dining room which I thought was good because if you're not in a karaoke mood at least you're not forced to be around it.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobo Fried Rice
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Combo

ub0G4j15IFXbnzQ7LFHfKQ.text: Food was fabulous but the DJ in the bar!  Boy, what a joke! No matter what you tip him he only calls up those for karaoke he knows. What happened to Freddie? At least he used a fair rotation. Thumbs down

AseWgvlN8CMKJofbe7QeqQ.text: I always come here every time I am in Vegas. You really can't go wrong with the adobo fried rice omelet. It's one of my favorite dishes and the portions are HUGE!!   I love this dish because it is not to vinegary but not bland .... it's perfect! You have adobo pieces in every bite and it's not too little or too much!   The employees are all very nice and welcoming. I will continue to come back every time I am in Vegas!! Thank you Aloha Kitchen for making my tummy happy!!

ajIJYrJtmX4SiIcGJUEJVw.text: Another one of my favorite local spots for Hawaiian food in Vegas! This place is known for the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet. For those of you who doesn't know what Filipino adobo is it is meat simmered with soy sauce, vinegar, bay leaves, peppercorns and garlic. This is a staple food with Filipino's and I like to describe this spot as the Hawaiian/Filipino spot. Besides the famous adobo fried rice all their dishes here are pretty ono! So next time you are in Vegas, be sure to check out this spot....you'll love it!

swNGIPwlK57RQFSEj0Zviw.text: Their plate portions are very, very generous. I'm surprised at how much you get for a side item you would think is small. Their miso soup tastes just like a good miso you would find at a good sushi bar, and their stir fry items are filling.  The two best things about this location is the karaoke and the bar (I know, right?!) Their beers aren't expensive but not *too* cheap, reasonable enough to have a good time while you're sitting back watching people sing and dance to karaoke. The karaoke is a blast! Went with a group of my co-workers, one of the most festive nights we've had, and the regulars that are there are very sociable and willing to sing/dance along too!   This location isn't mobbed so service and waiting for karaoke is fast. One of my favorite local locations where I want to go for a casual and fun night out without getting dressed up, or going to an actual bar.

89mfuFjydkZlBD4H5xbK3g.text: Adobo egg omelette hits the spot. Portion is large enough to share or make into smaller meals.  Id call in my order.  Pass the banana ketchup, please.

X8P3r6AzjnoSUxd2dF6-6w.text: This place was yuck. I saw that they deliver and since I cant leave work I thought I would give them a try. It was totally disgusting and they took forever. They said between 15 and 30 minutes and that there would be a 3 dollar delivery charge. Not many places have delivery charges but when they do I expect the food to come within the time frame given. Not 20 minutes after the 45 minutes had already passed. I hope the delivery guy considers the fee his tip. The local plate was disgusting, greasy and the musubi smelled rank and old. The mac salad wasnt bad and the lupia was actually great. I will not be coming here ever again. Still a bad taste in my mouth.

wsBXPqaS9h8ZVp2BY_fuYw.text: Adobo fried rice omelet is a must try if you've never been. It's unique and can be a meal in and of itself. I like mine with a little gravy outside and in and egg yolk inside with hot sauce. I've been hooked on the  cut short ribs I can only seem to find back in Oceanside, CA at Guahan Grill, but their Kalbi short ribs are good too. The white rice on all their plates is good and consistent. The service could be better, but not indicative of rating. The cashier can get bogged down and the napkins are small and they never give enough. I need to come here in the winter as they have oxtail soup which is hard to find. Here is what a lot of people don't think about or know is that there is no hard breakfast or time to eat breakfast in the islands or in Vegas so getting their food at 3 because you didn't get to sleep until 9 am from partying all night long is not a shame, but probably the norm.

Q0sh_6GKLkZhCAa9v77F-g.text: Since everyone and their mothers on here mentions the Adobo Fried Rice omelette, a few friends of mine decided to go down here after coming back from the club to see what the hype was about.  I liked that it was open till 5am, the cashier was polite, and it was relatively cheap.    The adobo omelette itself was a bit salty but decent.  I was expecting greatness but didn't really experience it w/ this.  Perhaps the eggs and the adobo together just wasn't working for me, but I will give them a plus on portion size.  The damn thing was the size of an extra large burrito that you'd find at a Mexican restaurant.    Overall it's definitely a place worth trying.  If you're staying on the strip and looking for some Hawaiian / Filipino food to grub on it's about 5 miles and a $21 cab ride away, so go with friends.  Who knows, you might like it.

KWFm5DcEfw6pwqhMNFR8oA.text: Aloha Kitchen = best hangover cure after a crazy night in Vegas!  Order the adobo omelet - it's amazingly delicious. I also got to taste the adobo and katsu combo plate, which was pretty good too. However, I would stick with the adobo omelet for yummy stick-to-your-ribs grub.  I recommend that this place spice up their macaroni salad that comes on the side with their combo plates. It tasted a bit bland and I could only eat a bite of it.

lpTac8dLBCICAcnbDOqJFQ.text: The heat while driving on westside of Vegas got me thirsty and starving for something similar to "home". Upon seeing the large sign from Sahara's roadway I decided to have an "Aloha" lunch.  I walked up to the order station. A menu with price listing was on a board above the order & cashier station. I ordered "Saimin Soup" , "Combination Bowl with Vegetables" and "Coconut Juice". I paid and was given a number tile with the number "15", to be called out for me to pick up my food order when it is ready. I chose to sit on a table under a "tiki" canopy overlooking the restaurant's wall of windows which brings in the day's sun. Nice, feeling like in the South Seas with colorful painting on its wall to add to the feeling.  Food was served on my table. My number was not called out. Great service!! Hot, steamy, yummy "Saimin Soup" was just right for my taste. I ordered it because I like soup and it had noodles. As it is my birthday, the long noodles stands for "long life". Mmmm, goood. The "Combination Bowl with Vegetables" was not ordinary with a special brown sauce over steamy white rice in a bowl. My Mom liked that, it was tasty. Our thirst was quenched by Coconut Juice on ice. Healthy and goood drink!   The atmosphere is ambient in this Hawaiian & Filipino Restaurant serving both Hawaiian & Filipino favorites such as Pork Adobo, Kalua Pig & Cabbage served with macaroni salad & rice, Loco Moco, Chicken Curry, Hula/Hawaiian Plate, Tapsilog, Bento Box (of beef, teriyaki chicken, spam with pickled plum & furikake fish flakes), Kalbi Ribs, Mahi-Mahi dish, Lumpia Shanghai (my favorite) to name a few. Appetizers, Soups, Salads, Side Orders, Combination Plates, Specials, Sandwiches, Beverages, Breakfast & a Kids Meals are on the menu. One thing missing on the menu is Dessert. That's just fine with me as I was full from the meal. There is a Karaoke Bar in the Restaurant that opens in the evening through early morning.   Enjoyed it, a good reasonably price meal for the day!

qZattxz_F4dEd2ORBuULDg.text: This is not a place you'd want to go to for lunch if you need to be back at work on time.  Took me 25 minutes to get my order because the cook and the cashier forgot my order.  A gal working there actually offered me free lumpia but I was too pissed off to want to eat anything from them.  This isn't the first time they took too long to get my order but it was definitely the last straw.  If it wasn't for the reasonable price, I wouldn't have came back.  But I'm done with this place.    On another note, the food here is very salty.

4aex6e-N5zO5CxFM0ixXHQ.text: I used to come here n pick up my lunch all the time and it's been a while n today I craved some Hawaiian food n called to place an order for pick up. They put me on hold for about good 10 minutes so I hung up n tried again n the background noise was so loud we couldn't hear each other n made me worried if she got my order correctly. when I picked up my food that I used to order all the time didn't look or the taste the same anymore...maybe cooks or owner has been changed or what but, I won't b coming back here for a while...

SNg73j9qJ0JfhKGoXByeqw.text: Me and my husband have been coming here for like four years now. & I can trully say I love everything I've tried.! My favorites plate is called Kalbi (ribs). It comes with like a sweet glaze you can pour over the ribs. of coarse I order extra macarroni salad! Why? Because it's delicious! The kalbi plate also comes with white rice and a small cabbage salad. I've also had the student special witch is teriyaki chicken on top of white rice. Yumm! My husband also orders the loco moco one of his favorites after he has had a few drinks. & ofcoare we can't forget the spam masubi. He has to have one of those everytime we go. I love how they remodel there Decatur location looks very nice & it's always clean! It has a very chill atmosphere. It's opened late and it's cheap. They also deliver & cater. They have a karaoke bar next door witch of the four years of us going there we have never been next door lol but everytime we are in the dinning area we can hear how the people at the bar are enyoing them selves. There staff is very friendly (they know us now lol) I highly recomended when you are in the mood to eat something good not expensive and just chill.

P_pWxDKXrh8D-RZ0uoqWqQ.text: My boyfriend and I only ever order carry out from here.  We are late night eaters so we love that this place is open late at night and the food is always consistent.

muZtBL4hPJoxxdy6w338xg.text: Favorite Dinner... Kolbi Ribs (well done) w/ Macaroni... Service is good, says Hi John every time I come in to eat.  Love

xjB_qwmdesa60hARQjJVzQ.text: My husband and I ate here on our Vegas vacation recently and loved this place. It's in a rather old, smoky casino hotel called The California, and not to be missed if you love a good Vegas bargain and Hawaiian food plates. We ordered some Spam Musubi to try, which is pretty much Spam sushi with the seaweed rolled on the outside. Unusual and delicious! Not to mention cheap. I ordered the Teriyaki Hamburger Steak, which comes with the prerequisite rice and creamy macaroni salad. It was really good, with brown gravy and onions but reminded me more of Salisbury steak than a teriyaki dish. The portions at this place are huge too! I couldn't finish mine. My husband could, but he's an Italian guy who can eat. My husband got the Teriyaki Chicken and let me try it. Friends, this is how teriyaki should taste. Grilled and tender, with a flavorful teriyaki sauce that tastes fresh made and not from a bottle. They have the best hot green tea, too. It was a roasted green tea, and I loved it so much I hunted it down at an Asian supermarket in Vegas before we left. It's called YamaMotoYama Hoji-cha Roasted Green Tea and it's delicious. Didn't have any room for dessert, though. Very friendly staff there. You order and pay at the cash register and they bring it to you. Decor was delightful yet understated Hawaiian/Asian. Prices are unbelievable, especially with the quality of food and the portions - our dinner plates were $8 or less. Enjoyed it immensely!

DFUE0mWhd0QYT3xJaOGPpw.text: I've heard a lot of things about this place. The good and the bad, but all I seemed to get when I finally decided to give it a shot is the ugly. There was a long line with two working registers, but only one person working both. It was pretty sketchy because one register was only excepting cash and the other one only credit cards. It caused such an inconvenience and their system was very inconsistent. They had one other person behind the counter expediting and running out the orders. I ordered the local plate and the ahi poke. My friend had the kalbi and lumpia. This is the culmination of my very disappointing lunch: carbs doused is sugar with a side of protein. Everything was just so sweet. I am all about the balance between sweet and salty but damn what a shame! It was all too sweet for my liking. AND the poke! FROZEN in the center! It was just big cubes of frozen fish. Tuna is a beautiful protein and should never be frozen, any seafood in that matter. When I told them about it, they sent it to the kitchen and when it got back to me the plate was warm. They popped fish that was meant to be served fresh in the microwave. WHAT A SHAME! My friend's kalbi was too sweet as well. Good char but too much sugar. The lumpia was mediocre. I didn't care much for it. Also, the place was very dirty. It looked so unorganized and dusty behind the counter.  Will I ever come back? That's a definite NO.  Would I ever recommend it? HELL NO.

KWcdBq4BKK3YKaAI3oR4YA.text: I come here often. Food is good and all but customer service is horrible. Specially over the phone. I made a pick-up order, got to the restaurant and one of my orders was not  included in the order. Girl taking my order implied that I did not order it over the phone. For the sake of argument I said it's okay just put in the order. She keeps implying that we didn't order it and that I am rude. I told her she shouldn't talk to their customers like that. She said she's been in customer service longer than I have lived. And kept saying I'm rude in Tagalog which is a Philippine dialect. Worst experience ever. And this was all happening in front of the manager and she just stood their. And did nothing. Very disappointed of the restaurant.

q5pdTFgqBf-h5fm_-FI-jw.text: We've been here several times and can affirm that it is a reasonable meal for a reasonable price. It is pretty basic stuff that shouldn't really disappoint anybody. But at the same time, you are not likely to be blown away.   My only complaint is the heavy usage of a very sweet teriyaki sauce on many of the dishes. The bottom line is that Island Style on Sahara (and in the Green Land Market) does a similar menu much, much better.

L9-bdSeNMYbbNaKSSVd-Ww.text: The food is alright. I had the local plate. The chicken and beef were ok, but the spam had way too much rice (served as a "sandwich").  I would only come here if i was in the area, but wouldn't be my first choice.

ZmXzoin-Un85rD9I7coxZQ.text: Came for an event and was impressed by some dishes but ultimately let down by the one thing I actually ordered. Because I'm lazy I'm gonna make it quick. Get the fried saimin. It's really good. I'd go for some right now if i was near there. Don't get the lau lau. It sucks. Sort of dry and bland.

IRP498OVg7Y4eiHbxNpyag.text: Good food but horrible service! The fat lady is very rude to the guest! Like she made my experience horrible I rather go l&l.... I asked for a halo halo she said hell noooo! Like what kind of service is to say that to a guest! Like damn what is her problem? Rude as hell!!!!!!!! She wears glasses she thinks she all that!

R8AnresrPo93IiKTJ4Y1yw.text: never had hawaiin food before, wasn't sure what to expect. It was good! atmosphere was lousy.  transfriendly - i guess it was way to busy for anyone to even notice

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ribs!

ftK6UzJ-T05QkdKlqxYHlQ.text: A perfect place for Las Vegas. Open late at night for those of us that work late at night.  Very friendly staff. While I'm not really big into Hawaiian food, there still are a few menu items I can have that satisfies my hunger. It's also reasonably priced when you're having one of those nights losing money to the blackjack tables.  There are also pretty cool people that hang out here and eat.  One of the better places to eat at in Vegas!

Py5whj81y27_39gs8ef-vQ.text: I love this place! Food is delicious and prices are reasonable. The staff is super nice and their Karaoke Bar is a fun place for locals!! :)

yW0aerYJpetRQUsOAqiGxg.text: Nice place. Kalbi ribs with kimchi there rock! I return there every once in 2-3 weeks. Service is okay, too.

KQLsWUDRUg7OBvUcynL-Qg.text: After watching a show in Vegas, we were hungry and wanted some soup. It was freezing outside and I remembered seeing The Aloha Kitchen sign traveling down Decatur. My friend's from Oahu and she said her friend told her about Aloha Kitchen and to give it a try. So after the show I yelped them and the pictures all looked so good and the best part of it all..... they close at 5:00AM! I was craving Ox Tail soup too so F it.. we're going. I was a bit bummed that the Ox Tail soup was not on their menu so oh well... i'll just get the Loco Moco. But while standing in line and look what I see..... A printed out sign. OX TAIL SOUP Special !!!! Mahalo!!   It hit the spot for real! My wife had the Spam Musubi and she said it was pretty good. There was a Karaoke bar next door but we didn't venture in there.

LMZz5aJshRQtERi_ASqFLw.text: Best food I have had in a long time! Fusion of hawaiian, filipino, korean, japanese . I ordered the kalbi combo and split the adobo rice with a friend. My taste buds where going crazy. Each thing on my plate was cooked well. The kalbi was grilled just right, the katsu was evenly fried to a golden crisp and the rice was cooked perfectly to my liking. I could eat here everyday but I'd probably get a heat attack. At least I'd die happy right?!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbie combo. Bomb!

vkjheojEhA9pNI-kgPaYtw.text: I'm addicted to gravy so i always get the loco moco. Its basically a burger patty & 2eggs of your choice on top of the rice drenched with gravy!! Also have to try the lumpia shanghai. Service is fast eventho everytime we come here there's a line. :-)

wmaMTsIzqXXZMud4ijKatQ.text: I usually don't leave reviews. But after the dinner I just had. I had to come on and express how terrible this place is. We were the 1st ppl to Order. After about 35 minutes I notice that there are about 6 groups of people that all have their food. While we get 2 dishes brought out to us. When I asked them about the rest of the food. They say it's almost done. I've heard good things about this place. But I think that goes to show that you shouldn't always believe what you hear. 45 minutes into our dinner we finally just get a refund and leave. To top it all off. The Loco Moco that I got has to be the worst I have ever had in my life. And I'm polynesian. I've eaten Loco Moco from everywhere I know sells it. And this was the worst. Meat was dry. Little bit of gravy. And only 1 piece of meat. I would not recommend this place to my biggest enemy. If they had only half a stay that's what they would get

_w1S7U0tezH6_q-6lCceWg.text: I had the Kalbi and it was very good.   Clearly this is more of a "fast food' joint than a sit down place, but the quality of food for the type of restaurant is excellent.

VssXtaX41iW4KPIVVyY_kQ.text: Rude. Unprofessional staff. Ruins the experience every time. And the food isn't that great to be a repeat customer.

HR45xsvfhz_fTFulylcQoA.text: Open till the wee hours of the morning?  Meaning the dozen of us drunk girls can get food?  Bless you.  Adobo omelet with extra adobo sauce?  Thank you.  Letting that sauce marinate in the leftovers till tomorrow morning so we can groan about never drinking again while devouring everyone's food before they wake up?  Awesome.  Other things that tasted delicious:  spam musubi, local plate, some teriyaki plate.  Service was so sweet and kind.  They also have a bar in the back, but we were not in any condition to go into that.  Price is great, if I attended college out this way I would've gained a thousand pounds, haha.  We'll always be back here!

KHBXIr8QhzC09y-zsa87QQ.text: Only gave 1 star because I could not give zero.  I will never spend my money here again. The food is pretty good quality which is why i always came back even though they mess up the order every time, by either giving me the wrong food or incomplete order. I just made a mental note to check after being burned a couple times. Everyone i have talked to had the same to say about them too. Except going in today on my lunch and waiting for more than 30 mins just to find out that they had not even made my order, it was just me and there was no line and the dining room was not full, i also was sitting at a table in plain view with my order number tag on the table. nobody ever bothered to check into it although they kept seeing me??? like what am i just bringing my own number tag into the place and sitting there for my health, I dont like to be rude to ppl at work or to piss anyone off who makes my food especially, but after 30 mins i had to find out what was going on. i simply asked that if they hadn't made my food yet, just to give me my money back because i was going to be late to work. Then they tried to give me someone else order, the wrong order, and after i realized that they said they could switch my order to someone elses food that was sitting on the counter, wtf? so i finaly got my money back and went to del taco on the way back to work and i will be in trouble for being late, but thats my fault for not being more pushy. either way i have forgotten about this place and would recommend that anyone else do the same unless you like no service and getting screwed over. btw i do not yelp and have only really signed up for this review.

rUijopL1zIdDMukOssaEHQ.text: First time here and it was Soooo good! I got the Kalbi combo and it was big and tastes great. The husband got the adobo omelet and he loved it. The cousin had the fried noodle saimin and she liked it. Everything was great. We will forsure return with friends...1

f62cvCJD-MWMsJq_wl2Jyw.text: Good food. Found a hair in my food , and they didn't do anything about it.  Disappointed but the chicken katsu, bbq chicken and beef was good; but they didn't do anything about the hair in my food.

EeV6dl5gefW_EInzAhn5bQ.text: If your looking for "Fast food" Hawaiian style, this is the IT place to go.  Food: 4/5 The food here is actually pretty good, so good I swear aloha kitchen was thee place that caused my freshmen 10 (gaining of 10 pounds once you become a freshmen in college) I love getting the short ribs dish or something simple like the Teriyaki bowl. I usually don't order burgers but I recently decided to be adventurous and tried a teriyaki burger which was delicious.    Service: 3/5 The service here is pretty good but I think that just might be part of that laid back Hawaiian culture. The place is kind of a mess though, I decided to dine in and I noticed a couple of booths were covered with left over rice and drips of sauces from the previous customer that sat there. Also maybe Aloha kitchen should remodel a bit because some of their booths chairs are ripping.   Price: 4/5 The price here is cheap & the food comes out fast in good portions so your getting your moneys worth.   Karaoke Bar: 0/5 I've never been in the karaoke bar but every time I dine in the walls must be thin or something but you can definitely hear some annoying chick on the other side screaming her lungs out. Very annoying while your trying to eat.

6jx4aoi2xQgeR4EEaX0tqA.text: This was decent comfort food from back home.  Not worth a special trip but, if you're in the area, it is pretty good.

jcnHEAQVtONJXDhGgr9cuQ.text: As good as its gonna get for mainland cookin Hawaiian food. Not gon complain cuz I get my kimchi and sticky rice, not like that minute rice they have at other joints. Smh.

Next time I'll try to try some other dishes that they offer but for now, Adobo Fried Rice Omelette is my favorite!!!

I come here atleast 3/4 times a month. 24hours and the nicest people work here. they even bring you your food to your table if you dine. this place hits the spot for late night food cravings. expect to spend about 8$ to 12$ for a meal after tax. which is very worth it for the amount and quality of food.

0LqOYCpMnWk2X2Rpx4k55A.text: Love kalbi ribs there. Add kimchi and you got a nice satisfying dish. I go there at least once a month and will go ahain.

BaNDE2CXH0J2UN9fEQ45wg.text: My husband and I ordered 2 aloha plates with double katsu each in addition to multiple sides for pick up. After picking it up 20 minutes after placing the call, rather then getting fresh food, all was soggy, lumpia was soggy and cold and the forgot to give us katsu sauce. eDb9dEUiy8iqRuTnREIXkg.text: I used to come here a lot and I remember it being decent, but my last visit wasn't so good. We came in about 2 hours before they closed and I got my usual, spam musubi, I've been in love with this treat since I was in middle school and I love when I get to have some in rare occasion since spam is not too good for you, but my treat was ruined that night... It seemed that I was given old already prepared ones because the edges of the rice parts were hard and crusty. Such a disappointment! I barely ever have this food and this one time I was craving it so bad and I wasn't given their best... Not even good. So aside from my food being a total waste of money, the place was clean and I love the layout of this place! My friends and I would come here some times. They have a door to the place next door, I think it's a bar... I like their drink selection too! I recommend the guava canned drink! It's so good! I had some good times here but I won't be back. I'm not happy I was given old crusty food.

T7eIHE2IUzIMLoLz0pyEzA.text: I love this place! The combination plate is my favorite , it's beef & chicken teriyaki with rice . You can ask with veggies on the side. I personally thought that they would be fresh but they were steamed , still good though & of course I always get the macaroni salad. It's my favorite ! I've been coming here for years and I highly recommend it :)

SyEgHj8YKa8-GKgUsg0eNg.text: A last minute decision to go and was happy that I stopped in! Found local grinds and priced just right.  Plenty of room for any size of party and the service was prompt. Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamburger Steak

NeTVRbqsiRflLDLPZWbazQ.text: 3 1/2 stars for sure.  Me, I'm local boy living in Vegas since my UNLV days.  And I always crave for food from back home.  If it comes with 2 scoops calrose rice (not this Uncle Ben stuff), and 1 scoop mac salad I give it a go!  I haven't been here in a while so I'm gonna leave the prices out on this one.  Sorry Hawaiians!  Food at Aloha Kitchen is pretty good, think of it as Hawaiian fast food if you will.  Not the healthiest of menus, but in a crave this place definitely fills a need.  I hope you aren't cutting carbs on this day!  The menu is a mix of Hawaiian, Filipino, Chinese, Japanese, Korean all rolled into one.  Just like the people of Hawaii!  Chop Suey kine!  Popular are the Chicken Katsu and the Kalua Pig plates, big buggah servings with lots of rice and mac salad!  I like the Teriyaki combo with teriyaki chicken, pork, and beef, and I like the Kalbi combo too with Kalbi ribs, chicken katsu, and teriyaki chicken.  So ono!    The menu is pretty big, there's apps like manapua, egg rolls, shumai, chicken wings, and poke.  Of course there's saimin, and wonton soup, as well as cheeseburgers, teriyaki burgers, and a mahi mahi sandwich as well.  And we can't forget the locals' fav...Spam Musubi!  There's is very good, I usually order 2-one for me and one to share (sharing optional).  There's lots of daily favorites like their teriyaki bowls, fried saimin, Loco Moco (yum), curry, Lau Lau (more yum), tempura, beef stew, and garlic chicken w/gravy just to name a few!  My biggest vice here though?  The Adobo Fried Rice Omelette.  This thing rocks!  I get it everytime I go!  Pork adobo fried with rice and lots of garlic, and put into an omelette.  I would have this thing for breakfast if I didn't for lunch!  I love mine with ketchup and shoyu on top...with a Spam Musubi (or 2)...and a side of kim chee.  Brok' da mouth!  Comfort food for me at it's finest.  Now don't go here expecting gourmet anything, your food will not be served on fine China or be expertly presented.  What you got here is some good no frills eats!  When you hungry this place will do on a budget.  Oh and don't forget the Aloha Bar right next door!  Karaoke contests and cheap drinks galore just about every week.  Although the last time I ate Aloha Kitchen sounded like cats were screaming Aerosmith's 'I Don't Wanna Miss A Thing' next door.  Meow!

S4SDvYTbVfCSnPJp6UpWnw.text: I've eaten here twice now and love the food. The spam musubi and lumpias are great. Their poke isn't the best I've had but still decent and would order it when coming back but i wish it was available at all their locations.  My only problem is bringing the kids here. While they love the burgers, they wont eat the teriyaki chicken because of the fat and the skin.

1Q6lC-EjGHJ8US0gMPAShg.text: Hate dropping a 5 star review down, especially down to a 3 star...  But the food just isn't the same anymore.  The value is still there, since it is still fairly cheap food, but the quality has went down.  Not sure if I caught a new cook or just a bad run, but the place was very slow and my food just didn't have the flavor it did before.  I need another Hawaiian spot to check out...please msg me if you have one

mzHXccrJ9vu_-ZCccq4zrQ.text: Delicious food! There is not a bad dish on the menu. I prefer the local platter. They Spam Musubi is a must to order as well, no matter what you order. The place is always very clean and the staff is friendly. You should definitely check it out if you are looking to try something different and out of the ordinary. The prices are really good as well. Pretty cheap considering the portions they give you.

9xuNeZ_C8gCVg_-_CfmdIw.text: Aloha Kitchen is an awesome place to try some awesome food. Their extended hours make it convenient for us night owls in the city. The staff is always awesome and the food is as well. It's only getting 4 stars, though, because I had gotten a bone in my teriyaki chicken the last time I went and it just creeped me out.

ZSKJ2mEv7xmHK30rZqYDsQ.text: No trip to Vegas is ever complete without a visit from this place. Either its the first or last stop of your trip, you just have to, HAVE TO, drop by and get a taste of their Adobo Burrito.. YUMMY!

Ix3UO89eIQeecIZwpEDJpw.text: Simply the best! I visit Vegas once a month for work and I have to come here or l just doesn't feel complete. Can't go wrong with the Kalbi Combo!!! I can't believe this place doesn't have 5 star average...so underrated!

y0uN95JXlBhzNjRr4umLwg.text: The Sahara/Decatur location is my favorite local style Hawaiian diner/bar in Vegas. They have a lot of the "Local Grinds" I loved growing up in Hawaii....even poke on Fridays. Karaoke...live bands...UH Football parties during the season...it's just a little taste of Hawaii lifestyle in Vegas. Gotta love it

F46j59HeY3t9bCQH0kPIZw.text: I've been here many times for lunch during work hours and today was no different. The people are not very personable. They take your order and that's really the only time you speak with them. I've had many different things from there because they do have some good food. The only thing I got this time was spam mitsubi. If you've never had it I recommend giving it a try.

v01XE0i5SeK6cNdR8NuqEQ.text: Not real local food. And this is coming from a local from the big Island of hawaii. More Filipino with a couple of local basics. Fast service though and nice clean restaurant. Go to ISLAND FLAVOR. They have real local food, owner is from Hawaii and great family oriented and friendly True hawaiian style restaurant. None of this fusion crap. Local food is already a fusion, why would you need to fuse it more lol.

z5fANOa8Vf9zkF6k0-4M5Q.text: I can always count on Aloha Kitchen and Bar to feed my hunger at midnight or later.  Other than casinos, this is the only place I know of that serves Hawaiian local food till 4:30am.  The only downer is how far this place is.  I live in Old Henderson and this restaurant and bar location is on Sahara and Decatur.  No place is far though, when you're on a local food fix!  Last night I had one of those cravings, so I came by to visit everyone at Aloha Kitchen.  I've been to this location many times because of the karaoke bar next door.  Everyone is AH-MAZE-ING.  First off, you're greeted by their bouncer, Greg.  Then you have Shawn at the bar.  Probably the coolest guy you'll ever meet.  Jovane (sorry if I misspelled your name) was the cocktail server and super sweet and Izzy is the KJ.  Very entertaining.  In the restaurant, there's Cyndel who's been a part of Aloha Kitchen for over 10 years.  Everyone's just full of Aloha and treats you like family.  Tonight I got the chicken katsu, spam musubi and the Shanghai lumpia.  The katsu is super crispy and good.  What I really like though, is the katsu sauce. Best katsu sauce I've had.  It's more tangy and savory, rather than sweet.  To me, it compliments the katsu very well.  With the musubi, they add their teriyaki sauce to the spam so it flavors the rice.  Packed with a lot of flavor.  The lumpia is small and filled with pork.  Served with a sweet chili dipping sauce.  Super good with a beer next door.    One thing that I could do without is the constant fighting this place has on late nights.  Lately though, there hasn't been any sketchy activities.  All in all, I love visiting this place because of the food and people.  If you're ever in the area, come down and check this place out.

VGyCu7OWbxCM0lSXIpNQbA.text: I decided that I would try this place considering I have not been here in a few years, since the Webjoy days (for those of you who are familiar). I used to get the chicken teriyaki bowl, but I walked in asking what would the employee prefer.  The kalbi plate happened to be the preference today. I dislike white rice, so I had to get a salad as a replacement. (a little bit of an off taste) I believe the teriyaki chicken is still great! Each bite had a crunch with just enough flavor to keep you wanting more. The kalbi and chicken katsu almost seemed like fillers though.  Next time, I will get the chicken teriyaki plate. No exceptions.

5n5J-EXNDYSglmLbr5LPTw.text: This place sets the bar for fast Hawaiian bbq. Everything I have tried has been good to excellent. I love their mac salad and chicken teryaki, its the best at any Hawaiian bbq places I have tried.   Note: they offer call ahead take out orders which is fantastic for busy professionals.

h_2Jxoo2E4GmWQ6KAVEu9g.text: The worst place to ever order on the phone! They don't make it until you get there. What's the point of ordering in advance?

1Y8aEv9gZbK_hN6V50P1Qg.text: Aloha Kitchen! Can never go wrong when you want some quick Hawaiian food. My favorite Hawaiian chain in Vegas. I always get the Local Plate. Bbq beef, chicken, and two spam musubis. Highly recommend!

oTB3SFXVSTuKFUeK7yVbhA.text: Closest place in Vegas that I have tried that comes close to the islands Ono taste & cooking! I've tried basically all the Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas, but the cooking here comes close to home and I love it!

zjrrZMw56CJ4aaPELraAlA.text: Horrible!  I'm from Hawaii and I was really disappointed.  It was a cold day so I wanted something warm so I got the saimin.  Yeah... bad choice.  Reminded me of the saimin I ordered at high school football games in Hawaii.  Could have bought it for $1 at the market and made it at home.  My sister ordered a combo plate and it was really greasy.  We got the banana lumpia and it was rock hard and greasy.    Sad :(

2XJuOL3cBy7r3QzcfiwW9w.text: This is my favorite place to get hangover food...LOL. I usually get the adobo fried rice omelet. If you haven't had it you need to try it...it's delicious. The only thing is if you sit in the dining room the service isn't the greatest. Very slow.

_jOaGGBWLGOBICy4vSLkhg.text: I visited Aloha Kitchen for the first time yesterday. This was a place that my co-workers ordered from a lot since it's in close distance from our workplace.  I ordered the chicken teriyaki and a side order of spam musubi. I enjoyed both but my only gripe is that the chicken teriyaki didn't come with vegetables. I don't know, maybe I always expected any chicken teriyaki plate to be mixed with vegetables?  Either way, it was still good. Would I try it again? Sure. There was some other things on the menu that caught my interest.

dc58GYz83l0grCwHZyn2nw.text: Usually when I come here Cyndel always takes my order and when she does, she is super friendly and nice. She always welcomes us. It's always nice to see her and I give her a 5 star. The reason why I gave a 4 this time is because another worker took our order & wasn't that friendly. Her & another worker didn't greet us & they were busy chatting away.

eO6rLfKPmdTFyUjFk4C47g.text: nothing beats the terri beef, except of course manapuas and musubis to go along with it, good food and friendly service equals great times

nb1nuGU3FQpVO--Wr_gkDQ.text: Karaoke every night!!!  I love to sing!  Yay!! The foods not bad either. Go see one of the great bartenders and ask for the shot special!  Mmmmmmm good:)  Definitely makes me sound better:)

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1cuKiaDKgDd1NMFCIF8eqw.text: If you've never been to Aloha Kitchen, you're missing out, my friends. I flippin' love the food here!  I'm gonna get right into it: this place has the best teriyaki chicken in town. I don't care what they say about L&L having good food (it's ok), THIS IS WHERE YOU GO FOR TERI. When you order the chicken teri plate, you get three pieces of chicken, two balls of rice, and a little bit of mac salad. The mac salad here is the best, and I routinely order an additional serving of mac salad because it's so good!  If you've never had kalbi ribs, you need to. I remember the first time I had kalbi ribs, I thought, "man, these things don't look like what I was expecting..." and then they blew my mind. I recommend you try the Kalbi Combo, too. It's just so delicious.   Everything here is good. The problem is that since I love the Chicken Teri and Kalbi Combo so much, I usually wind up getting that and not expanding my horizons. I mean, I've had a bunch of other things (katsu!) but I just go back to my favs.   The prices are affordable, too. I was just there and bought two meals, two drinks, and an extra mac salad for $22 even. It's a really good deal when you consider that you get a lot of food for that amount of money, and it's really delicious, too.   The place isn't the most high-end establishment in town. So what? It doesn't pretend to be. Their thing is awesome food at a great price, and they really deliver on that front. I've taken a few people there, and they've become addicts, as well. It's just that good!

oR8xx4uawBSbbs73T1faVQ.text: I absolutely love this place!!!! The beef bowl is awesome! Always so flavorful and juicy!! They do not put potatoes in their Mac salad which makes this anti potato girl super happy! The lumpia is my favorite! The staff is always super friendly and the service is quick!

e0gKYXzFcMYYklfduk-CwA.text: Give me some Kalbi!!!  It always gets the job done after hours of partying and even just whenever we crave for some Hawaiian food.  The Hula plate is great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hula plate

UC88YE9ixKfh9tP30jvYWw.text: I went  to Aloha Kitchen and bar last week and had a blast, The food was amazing and you have the best of Hawaiian and the Philippines. The owner Liza and her husband was there and they introduced themselves, I really enjoyed the hospitality. I had a drink from the bar and overall was very happy with Aloha Kitchen. I lived in Hawaii for 5 years and this place made me feel like I was back on the island. I can't wait to go back because there are so many items on the menu I want to try. Thanks Aloha Kitchen see ya soon

WqJwcqiBIOyvzMxCZ4TJIA.text: I used to love this place. I got take out nearly every week for about a year. But tonight I went in with friends and it may have been the last time. The lady with her bun on too tight who is always behind the counter has always been very short with me. I look the other way because it's decent food, convenient to my home, and open late. But this time Ms. Tight Bun took it too far. She was rude about answering my friends' questions about the menu while we were ordering. Snapped at us twice and never did answer our question about what was in the soup. There were 4 people at the table and they brought 3 meals out. We waited. Then my friend said what he was eating was not what he ordered. He took the plate up to the counter and I asked him to ask about mine too because my food hadn't come. She told my friend he was eating my food and she would get his. The food he had that he had already started eating wasn't what I ordered either. So I took it back up to the counter. She argued with me about what I ordered, slammed the plate down, and said "you'll just have to wait." It was an average night. She wasn't especially busy but it took 30 minutes to get our food we were snapped at while we ordered and then it was wrong and got to deal with her attitude. I really like this place normally but tonight two out of four people left hungry and angry. I'm afraid I won't be able to go back without checking to see how tight her bun is on that day. I feel like I should open the door and toss some Midol in at her to see if it's safe to enter. Wow! You can't treat customers much worse. Take a vacation lady. Come back a happy person please!

0oNsQWCPeMB3kHdPuaJ0cA.text: This is one of those places you gotta go off the strip. As an islander, this is straight up comfort food for me. We went and got the spam musubi, kalua pig and cabbage, and the adobo fried rice omlette.  Spam musubi - typical verison. No furukake though.  Kalua pig & cabbage - pretty good for a fast food version of this dish. Savory, sweet pork mixed with the bitterness of the cabbage is a mix that I love. Meat is moist and tender. Something I'd probably order each time.  Adobo fried rice omlette - very flavorful dish. Mmm...good stuff. Everyone else has pretty much covered it, so I don't feel the need to say much.  Overall, service was friendly and punctual, food was good quality, good portion size, especially for the price. I'd definitely hit this place up for breakfast on my next trip to LV.

0WxofZ_6-KtrBEVluw-grw.text: Got the teriyaki chicken bowl. Rice was absolutely disgusting and tasted like it had been sitting in the back in a pot of water for quite awhile. There was more fat in the chicken than there was chicken. Not only that but when my total came to $4.15 she told me I couldn't make an order under $5 with a card. I don't have money on me all the time. Did NOT enjoy this place whatsoever and the customer service is HORRIBLE along with the food. Do not recommend whatsoever.

BT3fbGPGhwxSd0XG_6RLig.text: I ordered the "grilled" mahi-mahi plate and ended up receiving a mahi-mahi omelette. I politely went to the counter to clarify my order, but the employee, a young kid, claimed the mahi-mahi plate is cooked with egg. If that is the case, then the menu should clearly state that. Not grilled. I didn't want to argue simply because I was wary of having something done to my reorder, didn't want to waste food, and was already starving. On top of that, the mahi-mahi omelettes were extremely bland (along with the side of mac salad) that I needed to add a lot of Aloha soy sauce which was probably the only best thing about my meal.

lNQuA76I2HlVO7e0gkMBzw.text: As everyone else has raved, the adobo fried rice is amazing. Who knew taking left over adobo, shredding it up and combining it with fried rice would be so wonderful? Did I mention they take all that and wrap it in a giant omelet? I'm a pretty big guy, who am I kidding I'm fat, but approach the menu with caution. This is where your eyes crave more than your stomach actually has capacity for. Though when is that not the case anyways?! The spam musubi is decent and I've only had a few other things from the menu that looks as big as a Baskin Robbins 31 flavors listing. I've not dared to venture further from what I know here, not because I'm scared but because I only eat here once or twice a month. For those few times a month, I'm already craving the adobo fried rice omelet.   Caution: the omelet is pretty overwhelming 3/4 of the way through. If you've never had it or seen it before, do not be fooled by the name of it if you were to assume it be the size of a standard size omelet. It's the size of a newborn wrapped in an egg.   Hopefully you enjoy it as much as I have!

TRrRiv3ikxwTMLSbSjrccg.text: There are Hawaiian restaurants everywhere in Las Vegas, but this is one of the more "ono" spots in my opinion!  * Chicken Katsu - Can never go wrong with deep friend strips of chicken and rice, right? * Adobo Omelet - Scrambled egg wrap around rice mixed with shredded pork adobo.  It's in the shape of a burrito and is pretty huge (although I can easily gulf down one myself!).  I know a lot of people hype this dish up, but to me, it lives up to the hype.  It tastes like home cookin! * Loco Moco - Gotta love hamburger meat smothered in gravy with egg all over?  I've tried many a loco moco and Aloha Kitchen has one of the best I've tried in Vegas (best I'd ever had is in Hawaii). * Oxtail Soup - Delicious and a must try if you can.   * Saimin - A little too salty for me. * Tapsilog - Tapa, egg, and garlic fried rice just like my dad's standard breakfast.  Prices are reasonable and the decor is cute (there's a location on Sunset that is aesthetically nicer) .  My one complaint is that the food can take long sometimes and the service is par.  There were a couple of times we got the wrong order/order never called when eating there and a couple of times we got a cashier who just seemed angry all the time.  This could have been due to the busyness of the place though since it does get pretty crowded late nights.     We frequent the bar next door too.  They have a pretty great song selection, although it can be hard to get on the mic on busy Friday and Saturday nights.  Drinks are normal priced, but the karaoke is free. Have some drinks there then walk over next door immediately after for a complete night out!

uqqi8sYWeUSGlVI1rYbyyA.text: Five words: Pork Adobo Fried Rice Omelet  Whaaaa???? I looked at the Hubby like he was crazy when he told me he was going to order this. Apparently a good friend recommended this to him. A True must-order if you're in Vegas and worth driving off the strip for. The fried rice is so tasty - not too salty but the perfect marriage of tangy and saltiness. It reminded me of my Mom's adobo and I have yet to find a place who can cook adobo like my Mom. It's pretty big too - think of a 1lb burrito you'd order from a mexican shop only instead of a torilla, it's egg. We also had their SPAM musubi and mixed BBQ plate...can't complain. It was all good. Friendly service, tons of parking, open late...I'm coming back for you Aloha Kitchen! :)

Sm4AZ7nfXQvxa13rCqkGHw.text: I really enjoy Aloha Kitchen.  Whenever I'm in the area I try to stop in.  On my last visit I ordered the Kalbi Combo. Which comes with the kalbi short ribs, teriyaki chicken and chicken katsu, rice and macaroni salad.  Now I've tried their katsu several times and I don't really like it so I swap my katsu for teriyaki everytime.  The short ribs are a little pricey if you order an entire dinner of them, so I order this combo so I at least get a taste of them without breaking the bank, but it always leaves me desiring more.  This and the actual wait times that it takes to get your food sometimes is why I ranked them 4 stars instead of 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Combo. Mmmm...it tastes like Heaven. You won&#39;t be disappointed.

y0Wkj3paR-_bWKsml4NvqA.text: This is one of my go to when I want hawaiian food. Im no expert but i love their food. My favorite being kalbi ribs plate.  My boyfriend is a huge fan of their Kalbi combo (terriyaki chicken, katsu chicken , ribs). My boyfriends second fav is their fried chicken. Price is good. Service is fast and if you live nearby they even deliver. They are also open late.  I first tried this place when i lived in las vegas. When i go back to visit its one of those places that makes me feel like im home again. Flavor is still the same.

qibev9fyxcmpp2FOMY2bdg.text: Been coming here for years and this place is a dope mainstay of Vegas. Fabulous Hawaiian food!

DcMMaC_MHCfL7hLd8TxDOw.text: Great atmosphere. Yummy food. I suggest come on a weekend for good music and dancing.

_GuFAHrb7qEd4jTK38htTg.text: Not my favorite Hawaiian place around town but they are conveniently located and seem to be close by when I am craving Saimin as they have four locations-  1.) South Decatur 2.) South Maryland Parkway 3.) East Charleston 4.) West Suset Road  What I do like is the diversity of the menu. The menu consists of a variety of Hawaiian, Filipino, Chinese, Japanese, Korean and American items (yes, there are cheeseburgers!). My favorite dishes from here are the Chicken Katsu, Saimin, Poke and Kalbi Ribs. If you want to try a bit of everything I would recommend the Aloha plate ($8.49) which comes with Chicken Katsu, teriyaki beef and teriyaki chicken. The adobo fried rice omelet ($7.69) is also another popular item.   Although it is not listed on their menu they sometimes have an Oxtail Soup which Filipinos call Bulalo. It is really good here and I recommend you ordering it if they offer it.  Today I was able to call in my order and pick it up on my way home from work. I was able to save time and skipped the long line and waiting at the busy restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Bowl with Veggies to go!
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yay!

uWJhcT0cX74YotBR48LWHg.text: They always have good food and a clean eating environment. I definitely recommend giving them a try.

Z3KzW1etBLCd9sq1hH1kog.text: Walked in and noticed a customer sort of complaining and arguing with the the cashier. The cook was eavesdropping and the customer got mad. The cook seemed like a Latino man talking under his breath. I noticed the cushions on the seating area torn and the tables a little dirty.   I ordered a bento box and since I don't eat beef asked to substitute the meat for either chicken or more spam. The cashier seemed clueless, and went to the back and asked the cook, not a manager or owner, but the Latino cook.   Reading some of the reviews while waiting for my meal leaves me wondering if this place should be called "Aloha" kitchen? Do the cashiers know what Aloha means? I felt a smile and a warm welcome greeting would have been a better touch than questioning me why I was asking if the food here was authentic.  Ok, so I get my meal, take a bite and am surprised. It tastes good. My friend liked his Katsu and the rice was perfect.   Overall, the food is better than most but the service and attitude needs to go! I'm being fair, the food is a 4plus and service a 2.   Foodies; it's a place worth trying, the food taste good!   PS, the teriyaki pork taste like back home in Hawaii.. Nice

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks like too much sauce on this thing
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not a very nice looking place

p6Rn4fjfdyk_FlpOSAom1w.text: I ordered my meal from here through UberEATS due to being stuck at work. Needless to say I was highly disappointed in the food quality. It seems that the cut of meat has changed to a low quality. The steak was these hard little cubes, the rice was over cooked, and my pork was slightly burnt. The portions of meat were very small. The only decent part of the meal was the macaroni salad. Definitely not reminiscent of my visits to other Aloha Kitchens. Don't think I'll order from this location again. Looks like I'll stick with L&L BBQ.

TdVj0sWHo3pDYnvfbOuT_A.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Great food, amazing service you can never go wrong here!!! Cyndel is such an amazing person and really gives this place life and we always enjoy seeing her!!!

95mdgqMwcyz7ZMNVGBWTqA.text: Been to Vegas several times and and this was my first time at this location. Came here for the Adobo fried rice omelette and also the Oxtail Ramen and Katsu Musubi. All the food was delicious and the service was excellent. I highly recommend you try this place whenever you're in town. 5 stars!!

7jPTifSXAjdNpRIJVX3eQw.text: We always come here when were in town. The customer service is great and the food is even better. Gotta try the Adobo fried rice omelette! Its delish!

yf7IM0OYMawh8Ti5dWvgGQ.text: Great food. Decent service! One of the best Hawaiian joints in LV! Highly recommend for people who love hawaiian food. Portions are good!

CqQwzd0FQIVkSUsRaBLyyw.text: Unlv student. Usually goto the one by the school. This locating was convenient and the by Isaiah was great. I order the Chicken teriyaki bowl and Lumpia. Definitely enough food to fill you up.

YLyAZG6btXeN-UsWdraW_w.text: Amazing place with amazing food . Come here all the time !! I order the Kalbi combo which is my absolute favorite .

WoG7RYaNpERfX7F4RK8DIg.text: I love eating here. We where just at California Hotel, but, I rather have the ox tail here.

SHWC09FRc9nw1U5z2jyUuw.text: Great environment! Delicious food! This is our first time here and it's pretty legit! Home feeling, comfort food, I really enjoyed the amount of tables and space this restaurant has! Parking was easy, and the space looks great for families!

WdeSi0MZulEMDfND1WG2zg.text: This is the absolute best Hawaiian food in the city! Incredible amounts of food for great prices, and they're open til 3am everyday. They have all your favorites of Hawaiian bbq, and many of them all in one or two combo meals. I usually get the kalbi combo, which has kalbi ribs, chicken katsu and chicken teriyaki all in one, along with mac salad and rice.. all in one order. One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas! Especially late night!

g1OixixokY8L-GTAmA5vkQ.text: Hawaii BBQ just the way I like it. BBQ chicken Masubi is not on the menu, but they will make it for you!!  AND love the lumpia!!

Q354iBRyCBw4YNOAbI4g1g.text: I've been coming here for years & I still love it! So much better than L&L. The loco moco and Adobe fried rice omelette is my go to!

vv5JvUNzkXhZNEAWFIdYfw.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Las Vegas ! There's always great food and service. This is a great go to spot late at night. Everyone should try Kalua pig

se_QDzomd2O18cMc-eePIQ.text: The staff is very nice especially Cyndel.  I come here often. The food is great and the price is good given the portions are pretty big.   My favorite part is the macaroni salad!

ZNIkwa8STuGAb-QnqefqgQ.text: I have seen a lot of my friends checking in to Aloha Kitchen... Some visiting from Hawaii and others who are LV residents. So, I quickly bookmarked it to try...  We recently bought tickets to a show, but wasn't too hungry to have dinner before the show, so we opted to eat after the show gets out. One of my friends looked up late night restaurants on Yelp, and found Aloha Kitchen. When he said that they have Oxtail Soup, I said YES! Oxtail soup is always the right food for late night grindz! The taste is good, but I think it would be better if they had peanuts and Chinese parsley in the soup, like what I'm used to having in my oxtail soup. We had an order of lumpia shanghai too. That also was good. I wanted to try the adobo fried rice, but there was no way the three of us could finish that, plus all that we ordered. Perhaps next time. See you again in our next visit to LV, Aloha Kitchen! \m/

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Soup... perfect for a cold evening!

5Fs-TaJbt4Lcsdhn5jE6TQ.text: If you are In the mood for Hawaiian then this place is pretty good. To be honest the only reason I continue to come back is because my girlfriend really likes it. The staff is not very friendly and the decor is horribly outdated. The spam musubi is the best thing on the menu.

Gq6_vmX6f9VmI2luY023KQ.text: Spam musubi=good Chicken katsu=good  Mac salad=ok Katsu sauce=bad Curry sauce=bad  I decided to order some food for pickup after work. Called my order in around 6:50, and it was ready when I got there about 7:10. I ordered the chicken katsu, with a side of curry sauce, and a spam musubi. I have to say the musubi is probably my favorite thing there. The katsu was crispy and hot, but I probably wouldn't order it again. It lacked flavor. The katsu sauce was weird tasting and the curry sauce was lumpy and had an off taste. The Mac salad was warm and tasted just like mayo. I have had much better Hawaiian food at L&L. I probably won't be back, unless it's for the musubi.

S_HUOP8odptqpOCbfV0i4g.text: I had the fried rice lovers omelette with portugese sausage in it. You can choose from char su pork, portugese sausage, ham or spam. My wife had the bento box with soam, teriyaki beef and chicken. And my mother in law had ox tail soup that comes with 2 scoops of rice as always. No complaints over all, good local food just like home. Lots of seating inside, not sure how the bathrooms were but they have public restrooms. Also a karaoke bar on one side that is separated

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice lovers omelette with potagee  (portugese) sausage.

27zOyh0i-Cm_olZ0zGqRlg.text: I had such a good time here. The food was good with big portions. The kareoke dj did a great job keeping the crowd Laughing and having fun. My friends and I will be back for more.

2WnbrMeoXL5uvcwVqcsaXA.text: I love this place. Service is super fast and the food is tasty and cheap. What more can you ask for? If you like Hawaiian food, you definitely need to come here.

RgfAHEDnCr6-WooWwreAjA.text: The food at this Hawaiian Restaurant is sooo good! I love how they offer a wide selection..from Hawaiian, Filipino and Korean! I ordered the beef kalbi and my husband ordered the chicken katsu. We also ordered the lumpia as our side dish. The beef kalbi and the chicken katsu are both delish! But the Lumpia was just like a wonton wrapper and 1/2 pork on it. It was good food with reasonable cost.  I'm giving this restaurant three stars because of their bad service. My husband asked the lady behind the counter 3 spoons but the lady just gave her one. Then he asked for a highchair and she just pointed to it like there it is go get it type of an attitude. Lastly when we asked for hand soap in the bathroom as the container was  empty it took them a while to get back to us.  I would definitely come back for the great food but next time I will just take it home with me to avoid all the hassles.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Kalbi. Chicken Katsu &amp; Lumpia

W9t_RWcisBoXMS0iAl7frQ.text: I would give them 5 stars but poor service. I orders Kalbi which supposed to come with Kalbi sauce but I guess he forgot so I walk there to ask for Kalbi sauce and instead of get me the sauce first he said he'll be right with me and continue packing Togo order for 20 mins and he messed up so he have to repack it but could've get me the damn sauce first. Really disappointed but overall was okay. I love love love their Kalbi and their spams are good as well :)

jEorzilduJFx3jiBA6IzwA.text: i guess its more of the "hawaiian experience". With ...um...hip hop music and rap playing....   As a person from Honolulu, The atmosphere was nice. Reminded me of home, but  not the food. And the music made me feel like I just walked into a trap of Hawaii food, and the hood. The first time I was there I ordered the adobo. Not bad. That I can't complain about. Theres actually good rice that doesnt taste like it should be fed to a bird.

6kDRbZ3a7emmOJTvlSHuGQ.text: Food is good but can't get a order right . They Forgot two things that come with the meal . Smh

L42o8CZ-v4vwGSj0Kwxfow.text: First I'll say the good things. I ordered the eggrolls appetizer and that was delicious! The place looked clean and our waiter was tentative.   Now the bad things. I bought a Dr. Pepper in the restaurant and was told I couldn't take it in the bar area. The soda had to have a different cup. They didn't have Dr. Pepper on the bar side so I had to choose something else. I mean really I just bought this from you guys. Who cares where I consume it? My friend and I went there for karaoke on a Friday night. BIG MISTAKE! I will never go here again. They Falsely advertise karaoke. We go there at 8p.,m and didn't sing until an hour later. Then we submitted another song and it was not called on until after 11:20p.m. I mean really there were not that many singers. Also other singers got to sing two times in a row, when I waited two hours to sing one other song. I had to drive my friend home and I was tired of waiting. I got home at midnight with one song sang. The DJ whatever you want to call him, talked too much, played too much dance music and had a dance off and a person celebrating their birthday come up and have a sick dance of three women around him. It understand it's his show but fix your website. Say it's karaoke, dancing and partying. My friend told the DJ we were leaving soon and he said he'd move our song up. Well three dance songs later that lasted 10 minutes and another singer he had not called us up yet. So we left. This is Vegas! Why can't there be a good karaoke place without the party? I come to sing not watch a guy air hump and stage and dirty dancing.

6Ysg8P6-1LwRw-tMSD4WvQ.text: For my Hawaiian fix, this is my spot. Fast, friendly service.  I usually get the fried saimin and add spam to it. yum. This visit I went with chicken katsu. For around $8 you get 2 chicken breast! Rice and mac salad. My boyfriend got the kalbi.  For dine in, they offer tent service.  They give you an order number then they deliver food to your table. Attached to the restaurant is a bar with karaoke, fun stuff. I like aloha kitchen way more than L&L.  Also the place is clean and they turn tables pretty quick when it is busy. Aloha!!! :-)
