Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu

35jRFtwPROIzD03yHBhvzg.text: Shout out to our Bartender Nellie!!! You are the best! Thank you for making sure my family who came out of Town for a family wedding was taken care had drinks in their hand. We came it was packed we asked Nellie if we could have the next available table to celebrate Mr. and Mrs. Fuimaono wedding party. Nellie was quick.  We end up taking over the entire place. Everyone had such a great time. We will see you again when we have another celebration to come out for.

KyQJqXFbbId60lQ1uMkHbQ.text: Would never easy here again.  Food is horrible.  The rice was microwaved.  What kind of retardant does this.  Who stores cooked rice in a fridge and warms it up in a microwave when some orders food?  And you can tell a lot of stuff was reheated and not cooked fresh to order.  The discoloration of chicken,  beef,  or pork is a dead give away.    I use to love this place.  Food use to be great till about 2006 or 2007. Then it just horrible now.  Rather eat fast food over this place.

fm66CUnq8tC7fbW4_HiyIQ.text: The WORST customer service EVER! and here is why...  1) I was at Aloha kitchen with my friends, and was trying to pay for my own entree.  Their fugly manager was asking me to pay for EVERYONE! and of course I said no.  Why would I? I am not Santa Claus and It's not even Christmas yet.   2) After I told her no I can't due to my financial hardship, she asked me to sell my bag that I was carrying with me.  (YOU DON'T FXXXING ASK YOUR CUSTOMER TO SELL THEIR BAG TO PAY FOR YOUR CHICKEN) 3) Then, in front of my boyfriend and everyone, that fugly manager asked me to switch a boyfriend that would pay for everyone, and laughed.  (I WAS LIKE, "WHY DON'T YOU JUST SERVE YOUR FOOD FOR FREE THEN, BITCH!)  4) I told one of the guys that I will treat him a nice dinner next month because I am financially struggling these days.  And she told my friend to hang up on me if I ever call! (WHAT A BITCH!)  I have never written a review before and I never thought I would ever write a review as horrible as this one.  BUT what I am writing here is the truth, and the truth is powerful.  The personality of the  manager at ALOHA KITCHEN is as hideous as her appearance.  Even though I was extremely disappointed and angered by her HORRIBLE service, now I pity her because she is just OH SO!! hideous inside and out.    SO!!! whenever any of you (who are reading this review) ever sees that fugly manager, you better be a BALLER and pay for EVERYONE you are with OR ELSE she will embarrass you to the MAX in front of everybody.  GREAT JOB to the MANAGER at ALOHA KITCHEN! I will definitely spread the "GOOD WORDS"  :D

sjWVuy06Ij3L2k3yURfe0A.text: BEST HAWAIIAN FOOD IN LAS VEGAS!!  And if you get the chance, find out when they have their street food cart set up on the sidewalk.  The smell of the BBQ is mouth-watering!  Great food, exceptional prices, highly recommend!

o_IQ3ndMerp0lO_NQvRVmw.text: Forget the 2 hour wait at Bacchanal, what more could you ask for from Filipino/Hawaiian fusion. Unfortunately, my favorite Vegas day club had a wait time that did not fit within the time constraints of my day. My sister and cousin, mentioned Aloha Kitchen and I've always been wanting to try it, so why not that day.  It's about 10-15 minutes from The Strip and especially for Out of Towners, it's worth the drive. The menu is more Hawaiian with a Filipino twist. The BF and I ended up trying 4 dishes: the Loco Moco, the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet, the Kalua Pig and the Banana Macadamia Pancakes. Not sure if it was the hunger, but everything tasted amazing.  The Adobo Friend Rice Omelet did NOT disappoint. I did wish the omelet was a bit thicker because I LOVE eggs, nonetheless the flavor was on great. I did feel that it was a little TOO salty, but the BF, my sister and cousin disagreed.   Everyone talks about the pancakes and now I know why. The pancakes are fluffy and soft and you really can taste the subtle flavor of the banana and the macadamia nuts perfectly topped it off.   For all 4 dishes we paid half the price of one person at a buffet on The Strip. We enjoyed the food and got full.

i6WQn8WLO0ErDfrZfIn5xw.text: We always come here every time we're in LV.  My kids love the adobo fried rice/omellete and my husband always gets the oxtail soup.  Staff is very nice, plenty of parking and they close late (5am).  Highly recommended.

pN26cOGVonTXz5jbiF3OoQ.text: i LOVE aloha kitchen. their food is delicious, food portions are generous and food prices are cheap! clean place, fast and friendly serivce, one of the best little local spots for foodies. I love the adobo fried rice and spam masubis yum!

5-_aCwDtN2SeGrK7I1eqhw.text: Looks like they lowered their quality in meat. This is suppose to be Tapsilog. Looks more like thin sliced beef for a Philly cheesesteak. At least let the customer know while ordering you've changed he meat. I use to get Tapsilog here all the time and it was never like this. At least they changed the order for us. You lowered your quality but kept the same prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WTF is this?!?! That is not Tapsilog!

SLiqgu0ukau5EzTGb00kXg.text: Yum! This place was great quality food at an affordable price. I don't mind paying the price for good food, but it better be good.  I had the spam musubi. Fresh seaweed and moist rice. Kids chicken teriyaki plate was good to. Portions were generous. Great fast food style hawaiian food in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken teriyaki plate

iA3Zho0MhikFqlrNbYABdw.text: Food was lit definitely food network status! Had some adobo and rice omelet, pork adobo on the side and my wife got the Korean BBQ plate! This was a good experience definitely super cheap and convenient late at night dinner!Definitely stop by whenever I'm at Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food network 1am

C5oBiN5z1lRD8FjH4e_16w.text: Waited almost an hour for food. Come to find out it was sitting on the counter the WHOLE F'ING TIME! They saw us waiting. No one cared to ask us if we needed help or if we were waiting for food. Never going there again. Don't order take out. They'll forget you were there.

a1GPuYeSh3OUkzg15MLI2g.text: I love their poke bowls.. Tha lady at the counter is really nice and helpful.. highly recommend!!

v9tjpDNI-qsQ_aV10qmoVw.text: So yummy. I can't wait to come again.  I came here for the first time on Dec 16th while we were in town celebrating my son's birthday. I always see relatives of mine check in here on FB and it made me curious after seeing the yelp reviews and photos and menu. I brought my parents along with me and my son of course.  After my first visit, it's probably now my favorite place to eat when I come out now. My parents said the same thing. They said they are probably only going to come and eat there now when they come to Vegas. I got the adobo omelette which was so amazing and so ridiculously huge, my mom got longanisa, my dad got hashbrowns and eggs, and for my son, who is insanely picky, i got the kids teriyaki plate, which he surprisingly ate and I finished of course. I ate off of everyone's plate and everything I had was so good. I would post photos but my phone is not allowing me to right now for some reason. All of that food we ordered for about 30 something dollars. Totally worth it. My mouth waters thinking about eating here again. I wish they had locations in LA or the valley!

-7ZuCV1wovbxTqeSTS3deA.text: When I lived in Las Vegas, this was my go to place for Hawaiian cuisine. Anytime I craved Hawaiian food, this place hit the spot each time. This place also stays open until really late (yay!). Their portions are very generous and you don't have to wait too long for  your order. Spam musubi and mac salad are my favorite items on the menu and their Loco Moco is pretty legit. Prices are fairly affordable for how much food you get. I loved coming here with a group of friends because they also offer karaoke next door. Tasty food, affordable prices, and karaoke...what more can I ask for?

_WLTeVf_gRUYiB3AtvN2tA.text: This place is is hella chill. Its more of a lounge with the chairs and couches they have for seating. Bar was just as expensive as the rest of course. Paid $24 for 6 buds (bucket) and $9 for mixed drinks. Thats where the word 'Pre-game' comes in heh. I find it interesting to drink and watch people dance, that is until im forced to join them.. alcohol is not the greatest friend. :{ Its pretty unique to see a restaurant attached to the karaoke bar. Prices are cheaper than i thought, plus quantity and quality paid out as well. Pretty convenient so everyone can sober up with some carbs before the trip home. Dont worry, its a whole seperate room so you dont have to hear the wonderful intoxicated singers.   Cant throw my 5th star just for the fact that i was standing most of my time in the bar area. I recommend a UYE for this joint soon. Who wants to sing?!

l3bx6zO98oUHrI27gDl29w.text: I've been a loyal Aloha Kitchen customer for years. It's my favorite Hawaiian place ever since my college days UNLV days. It's cheap and really flavorful comfort food.  However, tonight's visit is another story...  I was enjoying my stir fry veggies with chicken plate, until I found a plastic object in my food.  I was 3/4th done with my meal, so I suppose there was no point in complaining about it. And it's an Asian (Filipino) establishment. I know I won't get much sympathy from the owners.. So instead here I am venting about it on yelp.  This is the first I've experienced something like this from Aloha kitchen..Sooo disappointing. If I do come back, I'll make sure to check my food ahead of time from now on for foreign objects.

_SscPE5vv8lQzgF8RlpV7g.text: Everyone has hyped this place up soooo much for me but its pretty average.  A big plus that its open late, and that food is tasty, good portions, but my personal preferences wont allow me to say this place is a have-to stop by everytime type of place.  I had the Garlic chicken, which consists of a pan grilled chicken fillets smothered With garlic gravy, on rice and mac salad. Im not a fan of overly sticky/mushy rice so I just ate it with the MacSalad. Pretty goood.  Tastes identical to the grilled chicken plates from Chinese fusion cafes.  Besides that i give them props for The hours theyre open, and the promptness of the food. Not a place id crave.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Chicken

jEDCzgwtgF-3XObkoD7eCA.text: This is the best Aloha Kitchen we been to. The tables, floors, and bathrooms are always clean, the staff always friendly, and service is on point. Auntie at the counter always remember us and our kids when they come. This is like visiting ohana everytime.  Love the fact they stay open so late. If you want the atmosphere of fun and positive vibes, this is the place you're looking for. Price and quality of food is on point.   Now as for the cons. This place has none.   Conclusion, you want a place to be a regular at, again this is the place to add to the list and mark as a fav. Mahalo Auntie to you and the staff. Our ohana will be coming here for generations to come.

-yDWwWpSemPHbwpdEY6yMw.text: Amazing food - open late - superb staff  & karaoke allll night! Def try the kalbi the katsu & the Kaluha YUM! also they've got the BEST macaroni salad & I don't usually even eat that stuff but theirs is BOMB!

IHZvQGQLUgxCxK2qdlwiDQ.text: The adobo fried rice omelettes here are amazing. Huge portions. Friendly staff. Don't know what I'd do without this place!

h72lhFZ7pH3rRmf-E6AB6A.text: I got the kalibi ribs with Mac salad. Oh my. This is the second best Hawaiian food I've ever had, aside from Da Kitchen in Maui. Ribs were tender, sweet and the little blacked bits on the edges were the icing on the cake. I liked the Mac salad as well. My husband likes his with tuna, which this didn't have. I'll definitely be back the next time we're in Vegas. Restaurant was clean and the perfect temperature too.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

azhGH6gvpvc9zuTf0vCN7Q.text: I had AWESOME food catered from Aloha Kitchen for my wedding reception (which was at Jackpot Bar and Grill, another place owned by the same owner, Liza).   A little background: my now-husband and I live in California but we got married at the MGM, so we had to plan everything from a distance. I did some Yelping and found Aloha Kitchen, and made an appointment to meet Liza a few months in advance. Liza and Myla, the front of house manager, met us at Aloha Kitchen, gave us an amazing tasting menu of Hawaiian food, and were incredibly friendly.   For our reception, we ordered: Kalua Pork Vegetarian Egg Rolls Kalbi BBQ Pork Stir-fried Vegetables  Korean Street Tacos (from the Jackpot Bar & Grill menu) Rice  ALL of the food exceeded expectations and was super ONO (Delicious)!  I'm from Hawaii, and it was a dream come True having authentic Hawaiian food for my wedding reception :-D

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food was so good, I actually forgot to take a lot of pictures! Will post more when my friends send their pics :-)

Kkhv2ZM-1enllN-XCOmWTw.text: Been coming here for months, the food and hospitality is great. I highly recommend going to Aloha Kitchen if you're seeking that island flavor.

RRbqqDKgxDbZUO3bI5IY7A.text: Love it, i love their musubi and that I can place phone orders. They are always quick with their food and also very friendly in person and over the phone .

NBiog8w4k-1MOmryfxjVZg.text: I ordered the spam musubi plate and my brother ordered chicken katsu plate, both were delish. I've only had l&l to compare and I have to say that the chicken katsu here is really really good. The flavor and breading was perfect, even had the perfect crunch. I always go for the spam musubi I grew up eating them in l.a.  and it takes me back every time.   You'll always get good service too, food is made timely. Next time I come I want to make a review on their bar, got too full from the food this time around.   Look forward to eat here when I'm in the area or atleast pick up and go.

mUyrNkzYU8bDqwvEJhWleg.text: This place isn't as good as it used to be. Especially the workers (not all of em) not too educated on local food.  I ask a question about a dish and he had a blank look on his face. So I order a won-ton min...he's like, "won ton min? We only have won-ton soup" huh? So for over 100 years, we've been saying it wrong?  It's saimin with won-tons in it, hence the name WON- TON MIN.  My uncle ordered pork adobo... taste like crap. French fries are borderline burnt, mac salad loaded with diced onions...etc, etc. This place is a "local" restaurant,  they should be hip to the local dishes and how to make them

g8999hVIqsp1f2a5gSvhNA.text: I was excited to try this place because one of my Hawaiian patient's suggested it. The food itself is delicious and reasonable for the price. I got the local plate which comes with two spam masubis, chicken teriyaki, beef, and mac salad for only $8.99! Everything was flavorful, but we started feeling sick afterwards. We also ordered turon and wish they were fresh rather than straight from a container because the banana was tough to chew.

d3cE5j4hiEGHEbXTpC2-rA.text: Love this place! It's such good comfort food! The food come out so quick and hot! The Loco Moco is a must! The owners are the sweetest and make you feel right at home! Don't forgot to order a few spam musubi to go!

toR-MVcOPuYB7ESWzquCYw.text: I have to say I had great expectations when I got here because a few people had raved about it. Although the prices are pretty good some of the dishes lacked the flavor I was hoping for. Now its very hard to replicate flavors of things you have had . Now don't get me wrong there food was decent but I've  been to Hawaii and I have had plenty of the same dishes this place serves up. I will definitely give them  credit for effort on certain dishes. Let me start by saying Banana Mac nut pancakes are pretty good. The Korean BBQ was good it had nice flavors and a pretty good serving . Now the Tapa wasn't all that great they use a thinly slice meat like you would use for cheesesteaks and flavor wise there wasn't any. The Spam musubi had way too much rice and also lacked that extra sauce on the rice to give it that extra punch.  The Macaroni salad was missing something I fell flat on flavor( maybe it was the Mayo). I would come back but maybe try something else.

g6U9metqYgwET2puAf6mFw.text: The service was horrible, the millennials these days lack respect, professionalism and customer service skills. Very disappointed because we brought a large group of family to eat after a family viewing and the person who recommended Aloha Kitchen was sorry he did. We are islanders and we know that islanders are always so warm and welcoming but this place was run by young people so I can see where the lack of respect comes from. Food was ok, it did the job, but nothing extra ordinary from what we are used to. Definitely not worth going back even if the good were excellent I still wouldn't go back just because we are big on customer service and it sucked sadly. Management needs to train their millennials that us seasoned people (40 and up club) frown on lack of respect. Teach them how to handle customers and their concerns. We brought a group of 25 and sadly one bad experience is enough to not have us go back.

CfSVCU8cQ8b01oxbpqV3zg.text: Very sad that you have to have cash to eat there or be prepared to spend more than 10$. It's a new thing there apparently. It's unfortunate because I live right behind them and have been going for over 2 years now. Sure fire way to lose customers. Guess I'll have to remember to bring cash next time if I want to get my chicken bowl I always get.... you lost a customer for today though because of it so might want to rethink this decision.

k7xA2-1jHHBh2zNewgxlmQ.text: Okay, I decided to come back here again despite my previous review. But oh boy do I regret it.  I don't comprehend how difficult it is to get something cooked well done. I love crispy and burned edges on my skinless chicken and Kalbi ribs. I always let them know and even tell them twice. To top it off we also order egg rolls which are my favorite and a side of lumpia. Well guess what, they never came. We waited and waited for nothing. Eventually when we were finished w/ out food we decided to get a refund because this was ridiculous. Over all I will NOT COME BACK to this location ever again!

i7WKbnfx6on13oJiqQRX7Q.text: I've been coming to this place since '08. I always order the same thing. Today was the very first time I was unsatisfied. I no longer live in las vegas,so after driving in from cali I was so excited to stop in and order my favorite. Maybe there was new cooks.I order stir fried chicken and veggies,and an order of Lumpia. The lumpia individual portions have gotten smaller. My veggies were horribly under cooked. I'm not a fan of raw onions.It seemed that my food was filled with that a yellow cabbage hearts. I was super upset.it was busy,I didnt even bother to complain. I just went come back again.

QNlpzl6axT_ByyzGz0zVgw.text: This is one of my go-to places and one of my favorites. Food that I could never get sick of. My usual order is the student special, which is just a bowl of teriyaki chicken and Japanese sticky rice and a drink for just $6.05 (including tax)! I also love getting the $1 turon (banana egg roll). The Teriyaki Combo (teriyaki chicken, pork, and beef with rice and macaroni salad) is also delicious. The tapsilog (rice with sunny side up egg and beef) doesn't really taste like legit tapa (beef). The spam musubi is something you can easily make one at home. You can order better eggroll at an actual Filipino restaurant, but it's nice that they offer it. The Saimin Soup is kind of salty. There is also a karaoke bar adjacent to the restaurant, which I have been meaning to check out.  This place is good for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or after a night out partying!

9sRnbScBGBvYRWxvuW_QbQ.text: Don't even know what to say about this place. First off if they are going to serve Hawaiian food they can at least make it right.. Mahi Mahi wasn't Mahi Mahi at all. Teriyaki chicken was horrible and so was the garlic chicken. A family member got the kalua pig and cabbage said it wasn't bad. So far the worst Hawaiian food I've had in Vegas will not be returning.  They also brib you to give them a good review on here in exchange for free egg rolls...  P.s. I'm from hawaii I know how Hawaiian food is made and taste and this was not it at all. If you want some good Hawaiian food your better off going to L&L or so far the best I've been to is 808 Mix Plate

m-wNr2P1UKodXdMbrgta7Q.text: It's Saturday 4.1.17....1230pm-ish ..long morning of games..we decided to come eat our comfort food...Hawaiian food...so last time we went to Aloha kitchen is when my cousin was working here over 3 yrs ago..      ATMOSPHERE  - When we came...atmosphere is nice...wasn't too busy and the dining room was clean....(but they got really really busy when we sat down...the rush came in...)  CLEANLINESS  - the place is clean..except the coffee station was kind of messy.  CUSTOMER SERVICE ..they are still polite and friendly   PRICES - the prices are reasonable for what ur getting...however I am extremely picky abt my Hawaiian food...  FOOD- So let's to get to the main reason why I came.....The food kinda went down from what I remember... prices are good......but the food aww man...small kine not too good this round..   The breakfast plate- Portuguese sausage eggs and rice...First the rice was mushy..the eggs should have been scrambled with cheese so they made it into an omelet looking style and put a regular American cheese slice..really?! The Portuguese sausage did not taste like Portuguese sausage.. it didn't have that chili pepper saltiness to it like a Portuguese sausage should have..call me picky but I know my sausages  My husband has a Bento box ...mushy rice the spam was thick and not all the way cooked and the teriyaki sauce that was on the meat kind of tastes like it was from a can... The only thing that was actually good..was the  chicken skewers..but they were a little raw looking...  I had to give 2 stars (my husband didnt feel they deservd that...) ...but i dont feel they no longer represent the True Hawaiian style food ...almost cutting corners.. ...

2ZVt5RB6qniqejrZCYcQiQ.text: Came from Hawaii and got Hawaiian food. lol The food was very good! The prices were even better!! My mom lives up the street and it was her first time here. She loved the miso soup and adobo fried rice omlet. My son LOVED the banana pancakes w/ vanilla cream sauce. My kalua pork & cabbage was amazing! ms4XFhQ36cBYh1kBLSUi5A.text: Probably my favorite location of Aloha kitchen. Timely food. Great quality and the staff is always excellent!  My go to are the barbecue mix plates, the loco moco and their huge portions of fried rice!   If you're looking for a clean and filling place to eat for sure Aloha.  If you're looking for some late night food, this place is also open until 2 am!   Pro- great food, good staff, clean Cons - a bit far from other locations

pG8LgoyZ24bTOABlgeYoqA.text: I've eaten here numerous times & my experience has always been the same: Food is good, prices are reasonable, and depending on the dish, servings are either sufficient or a lot! So, you can't go wrong there!  If you're a newbie, it can be a little confusing whether you need to tip at the table or not. You order at the counter, you get your own drinks, they serve your dish at the table, and they clean up the table when you're done. I typically tip, but others could differ.

ydhtTo9i5AVbQ_nn1-FVbA.text: This place makes me feel like I'm at home. I like to eat their loco moco, oxtail ramen (yuuuummm), and Portuguese sausage eggs and rice. Chicken Kiatsu is great also. vakDiasGfl-RAPGiGzMxDQ.text: Delicious food and great customer service. My 1st time eating here. They made a great recommendation in the Kalbi Combo. Highly recommend others to try!!!

fOPQV2lgGPnudD7_hpiKvQ.text: Drink: 0/5 Decor: 5/5 Cleanliness: 2/5 Service: -2/5 Avg: 1.25 stars  Short Version: The new decor is nice. The doorman and waitress were nice. The KJ and bartender are rude. KJ not aware of standard queue protocols and what songs are in the library. The bartender would rather argue about a drink and try to intimidate a customer than own his mistakes. The upside is that the staff should turn over in a few months (if their trend keeps up). Maybe we'll try again then. Toilet handle broken. Bathroom dirty.   Long version: This used to be a fun karaoke place. Their main host has changed, and they have struggled to find a replacement. Everyone in here was new the last time that we went, which isn't too surprising because it seemed every few months there was a different team there.   The customer service is horrible. I asked for a Black Label with a splash of soda and was given Black Label and tonic. I walked to the bar and let the waitress know as she is swamped and has the entire room. She apologized and let the bartender know. He comes to me and says, "I put soda in there." Then he holds up the store brand bottle they got at a grocery store and shakes it in my face. I told him, "If you're not convinced, taste the drink. It's tonic and not what I ordered." He stares and me. I don't blink. He grabs the glass and throws it in the sink and says, "Fine." Then he gets a cup and brings the soda bottle and says, "This says soda." He pours it in a cup and asked me to taste it. I tell him that it is soda. He then says, "Good. I don't want to waste this stuff (holding the Scotch bottle). It's not cheap." He proceeds to make me a scotch and soda, which isn't what I ordered. I just didn't care anymore.   I sit down in the booth. The host comes to me and says, "We don't have this song." I tell her, "Yes, you do. I've sang it here before." She comes back and tells me that she found it. When it's finally my fiance's turn, she plays the wrong song. He tries to help her find the right one because he has sang it there before. Finally, he tells her that he'll give her a different song, so she bumps him to the bottom of the queue! How? This is your mistake, and he gets punished for your incompetence. After 7 songs, I get up to ask when he is going. She says, "Soon enough." I told her, "I needed a specific number of turns because you put him at the bottom for your mistake." She glared at me and said, "Three." I told her, "Thank you."  Bathroom was dirty. Toilet hand was broken. Only one bathroom now. No one cares.

BX53VPs9aChG1XsrZa5frw.text: Best Hawaiian in the city for at least a decade. Always new and classic stuff.  Also they postmates etc

MFreMKEXkG_7enc-1l_qJw.text: Food isn't that great anymore, like how it used to be!  I wanted to order chicken katsu with curry on the side with fried rice to go.  The person who answered my call stated I couldn't order it with fried rice.  Uh, really??? When I got home, I had 5 tiny strips of chicken katsu, and a bowl on the side of curry with boneless chicken in it!!!  Wtf????  Never again will order from here!

reXzIqdw7cAGwezkA4DzRg.text: Came for breakfast and ordered loco moco, adobo omelette and a plate of kal-bi.  Total came to just under $30.  Ono, just like home.  Menu is full of local favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BUGBw5qbtnmUf0JivLfggg.text: Met my husband for lunch since this place is close to his office. We placed our orders - an order of lumpia, a beef teriyaki bowl, and a mixed plate - and sat down. I went to fill our cups and the beverage dispenser seemed to be broken...not out of something, but actually broken. It sprayed me with fruit punch which seemed to set the tone for our meal.   When I got in the bathroom to wash my hands, the bleach smell was overpowering. It was so strong it made my eyes water, and even though I knew bleach had been used, it felt really grimy. Of course there were no paper towels.   When our order finally came out, the lumpia were nice and hot and crispy. They were the high point of the meal. The beef bowl was smothered in sauce, it didn't taste like any teriyaki sauce I've ever had..almost like a burned gravy. It was disappointing because the beef itself had a good texture, no gristle or fatty globs.   My husband's chicken was really unappetizing - it honestly looked like a slab of meat from a frozen dinner and he said it was rubbery. He described his beef as being "well done and then some." Not a fan.   There are too many good Hawaiian places in this town to settle for mediocrity, and that's definitely where this place ranked for me. The staff was friendly, and the dining area was clean, but the cons definitely outweighed the pros here.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo plate

yruMDb_KAMdAN5xM5jgq-g.text: Just what I expected - great service and excellent local (Hawai'ian) plates at a great price.  I had the curry chicken and katsu topped off with Filipino karioka for dessert.  Yummers!!!  Honestly I was so excited that they had the karioka that I inhaled them first and even went back later that night to buy two more after I went out to dinner!  I wasn't crazy about the Mac salad, which was disappointing because a good Mac salad is a great compliment to an excellent local plate.  There was some kind of funny after taste to it.  Perhaps it was a bad batch of mayo or something but hopefully next time I dine there, they can rectify that.  Also was disappointed that although they had Pepsi products, they did not carry Mountain Dew, my vice, lol.  I may sound nit-picky but believe it or not, I've chosen Pepsi product restaurants over Coca-Cola establishments simply because of the beverage choices.  I will be spending the month of March in Vegas so expect me to be a frequent customer here!  So ono!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ono!!!!
Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t wait to try all the other local dishes!!!

fUqo9o9aJ-TGdv1fjW426g.text: Recommend this place if you love Filipino food. Their adobo fried rice is a must! Great customer service as well! They also have Hawaiian bbq so plenty of selections. There is karaoke night every night at 8pm so it's definitely something I'll want to try someday!

-KmPUviL_P6Bkoge1tQG5w.text: Hyped by a coworker as her favorite place for Hawaiian cuisine, I made a point to stop by and order some of the dishes she'd suggested. My experience didn't live up to what I'd expected, but it wasn't awful either.  Service was great, staff are friendly. Restaurant is clean. Didn't experience the bar. Opted for the Local's Plate (beef and chicken teriyaki, two musubi, sides of rice and mac salad) plus a lumpia app. I'm not the hugest fan of teriyaki and this was not one I would necessarily come back for, spam on musubi was thinner and less flavorful than what I've had at L&L, I preferred the lumpia I've had at actual Filipino places, and I'm generally not a fan of mac salad in the first place because of my aversion to mayo. The dishes weren't bad, they were just a little lacking in flavor and not the punch of flavor I'd expected.   Would come back to try other dishes suggested: oxtail soup, adobo fried rice omelet, manapua, but I'm not in a hurry to do so.

8desV0SEu2Vd-31LQ3h1MQ.text: Last week - I dropped by the Aloha Kitchen and Bar for lunch. Had high hopes that this would be a location that would come close to being like the food I love and miss when I'm back home on the islands. However - I've learned to live with disappointment in life and my visit here was just another added to that list.   The dining area is nice - somewhat clean, open and modern(ish) compared to other "local" style restaurants I've been to. The names of the dishes were promising and the prices seemed in line with the portion sizes I had seen on people's tables as I waited to place my order.   I was coming down with a cold so I wanted saimin - even with it being in the 90's and humid which they don't serve. A Hawaiian style restaurant that doesn't serve saimin - odd. Even fast food joints in Hawaii serve saimin.  At least they serve fried saimin. So, I settled for that.   Too much vegetables which normally isn't a bad thing however, after a few bites, I started to separate the cabbage and celery. Sorted thru and picked out the minced meat and noodles and with the leftover vegetables, it looked like I hadn't made a dent in the plate. I also chose a side of macaroni salad. Ugh.   All I'm going to say is that I have to wonder if the cooks have ever been to the islands. Either that or the cooks have started tayloring their dishes to the tastes of people who haven't been either. Or maybe, I didn't choose the right dishes that they specialize in ... whatever the case, I didn't like what I ordered and I doubt I'll be back any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Saimin

L0jqqRWx-4OnfHWRi2mETA.text: Always loved this restaurant.the staff knows us and are aleays nice and welcome us. The sauce for the chicken teriyaki plate is so yummy that we always order extra and completely drown our chicken.also the loco moco is to die for. We live in summerlin but make the long drive anyways cuz its worth it

-SED4WQogvD4Sbz0iEFl0A.text: Everytime we're in Vegas we usually stop by. I ordered the Spicy Adobo Fried Rice for about $9 and if you write a review on Yelp your also get free lumpia (6pc). Cheap eats for a Filipino Hawaiian fusion.

hcb0UwLZijFMjfOyY7vFww.text: This is like my second home when I visit vegas . I been coming here for a decade now.. and love it here. Mackly is an amazing entertainer and the people that come here are down to earth. Can get a little ghetto st times but it's all good fun.

6Xwle3czygRo1oyOi1LT2Q.text: I have been frequenting aloha kitsch since high school, around 10-12 years. I used to ditch to here actually lol. 80% of the time you'll see people order the student special which is about $5. It comes this chicken teriyaki, rice, and a soda. My personal fave if I'm super hungry is the kalbi combo or just the kalbi plate. The combo comes with kalbi, chicken katsu, chicken teriyaki, rice, and your choice of mac salad or Kim chee. The kalbi is fricken to die for its so tender and flavorful! I swear I could just sit and eat and eat and eat these ribs lol. You can also order them for catering! It's $40 to feed 15ppl and $90 to feed 30ppl.   I have seen this place go through so many decorative renovations and I think the current decor is my favorite. They moved the drink station away from the order counter so it helps traffic TREMENDOUSLY!  OH and don't forget your ID they ALWAYS check it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Counter.

4rRgJjMLJu29lnh0AOKYrQ.text: I've been coming here for years and I absolutely love it here. There's a lot of nasty comments out there but I've never had a problem here. Their clean and fast!

anoB2RDOLBPUpsUNTAu_Nw.text: I've gone to aloha kitchen my whole life and never had a problem. On Friday 11/17/17 my friends and I were eating, and thiis guy joined us. We asked the manager for a refund, but they refused. They been on dirty dining before, I thought they solved the problem. Apparently not .

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mnA0OI6adyQ2R-IjfFW5ZA.text: Delicious food love coming here but the other night my card did not go through and the new girl said it was declined so I ask the lady that's been working there since for ever to help her swipe the card again she said she can't control the machine so I had to pay $4 to use the ATM and took my money somewhere-else accordingly them I did not have a valid debit card. Bad customer service

CxDTR5B3COm-L89L-stamw.text: New management new owners suck here the old hawaiian knew was better now owned buy fobs or filipino!! I have no problems with  filipino cause I am one myself  !! I remember when they were generous on food portion I went here today was totally disappointed with the food portion this new owners gave like talk about being greedy go to island flavor food is much better and there food portions are really huge

dyDts3tWBzZ0Jl1U_DHcww.text: Always great food.. Recommend.. adobo omlet is amust!! People friendly as well.. come have some great eats

Fs7MwLCW07rL6KGpSF2OOQ.text: Great food always the best and freshests food! The local plate is alwags great food for breaskst lunch or dinner! Great customer service like always! Mahalos!

xcJqjRkPTFVLw8UsEDCOZA.text: Although there's other Aloha Kitchens out here, this is one to go to.   In regards to taste (my opinion): 1.  Katsu: not the best in town. BTW, look up Katsu on urban dictionary. 2.  Spam Masubi: Okay, sometimes too loose. 3.  Loco Moco: I recommend  4.  Fried Rice Adobo Omelette: The best!!!  If you're looking for Hawaiian food and want have fun at the same time, come here Friday nights. Can get crowded and tough to find a seat though.   I've also learned not to wear all black and stand outside when I'm here. At least 3 times, people thought I was a bouncer. I even joked with someone and almost got a cover charge from them.

_WDFQjQFMq9CHOK9lhR7dg.text: Aloha Kitchen & Bar was a great experience for my husband and I! The waitress was welcoming and helpful when we had trouble deciding on ordering. My husband ordered the loco moco while I ordered the adobo omelete and we both ordered a spam musubi. Both dishes were bursting with flavor; the gravy, the burger patty, mixed well with the rice and my adobo had a great balance of vinegar and seasoning. We will be visiting again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam musubi, loco moco, and adobo omelet.

x_EiZ4BYpvS1UZCBenFGUQ.text: Love this place. Eat here 2 to 3 times a week.. Chicken fried rice omelette is my favorite.

msqkQqoLnDNkiqVK8AbXfQ.text: Stopped in on Friday night/Saturday morning around 1 am for some karaoke, since the place we were at closed early.  Not too bad...I'm afraid I might have been a bit too intoxicated to really provide a very detailed review, but here's what I remember:   Drinks:   Kind of expensive...$28 for 2 beers, and 3 well shots.   Karaoke:  fun...but the KJ had a pretty sizable queue, and sang 2 songs himself within about 7 minutes of each other.  As a KJ at other venues myself...you don't do that.  You don't sing in the queue unless you have less than 8 people singing.   Also, there is a sign on the KJ booth that says "2 drink minimum."   WHAT?  I know most people like to drink before singing, but what if your DD wants to sing?  Is it 2 drinks for the whole party?  Per person?  I don't get it...  Staff:  awesome.  When they were closing down, my friend and I were waiting for our very drunken men to finish in the bathroom.  The staff didn't know this, and came over and said they were closing...when we said we were waiting on the boys, they started joking around with us about "what are they doing in there?" (to which my very clever friend said "Hopefully not sword fighting.")  They were gracious, and very nice.    I'd come back and give it another go...I'd like to find out more about the drink minimum for karaoke...

O-EoCoSNID4UqXxhkE0ZoQ.text: I love it here! I haven't tried the karaoke (which I hear great things about) but this is my go to place when I have a hankering for delicious hawaiian food, late at night especially. I love that they're open late; the menu is very reasonably priced. The kalbi bbq is out of this worrrrlldddd, I am obsessed with how it's marinated. I like the chicken katsu as well, and the banana pancakes are a really nice finishing touch if you like dessert. I only knocked it down a star because I don't prefer the katsu curry style here, it's like they give you a side of stew with potatoes and carrots to pour over katsu. I personally prefer L&L's style of katsu curry when it comes to that. Still love everything else though!

oiydg9-VprubkoeqDjv5lQ.text: The best Hawaiian food in the city! Been coming here for 8 years and it always delivers!

i4BLF0PqFX162JeDkewAKw.text: I think it's great that this place is open until 3AM because my boyfriend and I don't get off work til 1AM. If we're not too tired then we'll drive from Green Valley to here for some chicken katsu or adobo.  On our most recent visit here, we both ordered the adobo and chicken katsu combination plate to go. The chicken katsu was good but the adobo was SALTY.  By the time I got to the adobo, I ran out of rice. And the only other rice I had at home was the boil-in-a-bag rice that I buy just for my dog. So I decided to save the adobo for the next day and make a sandwich out of it. I've had their chicken curry in the past and I remembered it as being quite good.  The service is always great with plenty of seating and there's plenty of parking.

UNPHZCt2uSvNqdyjKxANwA.text: Best place in town for Kalbi Robs. Better than anything I found on the Big Island. The other meats not so much.

iWUeYR0dO2odkUvrDRscag.text: I love hello hi kitchen for a quick protein friendly dinner for reasonable price. Right now in the restaurant and smells like Hawaii exactly more like purple punch if you get my drift. I'm neither pro nor against the use of marijuana however not in a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Liner .... !

CfAguuA2IT_xBEigQqQgEw.text: I ordered mahi mahi plate, it's an omelet  with very little fish and all egg. Dry and tasteless. Ox tail was so ordinary. They don't even have fish sauce to make it taste better. Not going back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi mahi plate was dry omelet with a couple of fish flakes. Pinoy don&#39;t waste your money here.

nbvrxs7lseOtUYPnjVMXpA.text: Came in for dinner at 7:12pm on August 5th , and JANE helped us at the cashier , and specifically asked if they sale BACON , and she gave me a look like "What are you talking about?" I was already annoyed that I had to wait , if you don't know what bacon is then I don't know what kind of style you're living! And then I repeated myself numerous times and she asked "What is that?" REALLY? So i just ordered the Portuguese sausage eggs over easy and rice ! BECAUSE I asked if they had bacon and she literally asked me "what's that?" Overall I come ALL the time and everybody else knew what I what I like to order , but apparently she didn't know what bacon was!

BSiE1AMSPpFavVvCXgV9nQ.text: I like this place. It's not my favorite but then again I don't care for Hawaiian food that much. I do have some times where I crave it though and that's enough for me to say I like it! It's clean, good cheap food, and the workers are nice, It's not a place I'd go out of my way for but I'd definitely eat there!

SMXTgZgtmg7fH16aug1i8g.text: Good Hawai'i style plate meal with Hawaiian, Filipino, Korean and American selections. The pork Adobe and pork adobo fried rice omelet was delicious, and the saimin is one of the best.

j7imqFqt_2E7iTkM2IsPDQ.text: Aloha LV Yelpers :D  After a long week of dancing in Vegas... all I wanted is HAWAIIAN food! mmm... gotta love comfort food.   Came here yesterday... my 2 favorite local spots are closed on Sundays... and I wanted to take my friend who was visiting from San Diego to a cool Hawaiian spot... and Aloha Kitchen seems to be one of the few Hawaiian spots open on Sundays! (I'll give them a star just for being open on Sundays!)  I was kind of iffy on trying Aloha Kitchen due to the reviews... But one of my friends from Hawaii Richmond works the bar here and he mentioned that was food was great so I figure why not try it out for myself :))  I ordered the Hawaiian plate, with all rice (I substituted mac salad with rice), kalua pig and laulau. It was yummy! I had to get a can of Hawaiian sun :) My friend ordered the spam and eggs.  I wasn't disappointed with my Hawaiian plate. If I closed my eyes, I could picture myself eating Hawaiian food at my grandma's house on the Big Island.  Okay prices... Order came out pretty fast. Meal for 2... $20. Casual indoor seating.  If I'm craving Hawaiian food on Sundays... Aloha Kitchen will be my go to hot spot.  Mahalo Aloha Kitchen for my 15 minute vacation back home to Hawaii...! Now to work off the 1 pound I gained.  I'll be back, when I get my cravings :D  If you're in the area... stop by Aloha Kitchen! and if you're at the bar... and Richmond is working... tell him I sent you!  Aloha!  -Miss Yelp 2011

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AQ5_DL2eupnxIo9wEC3cXA.text: The food is way better here then any other spot and the service is great. Got the local plate last time and it was amazing today got the chicken katsu and it's another amazing but I can live off the spam musbi the price is great for what u get.

gPAAR3nc8TpqxMkfDOpQIg.text: This little hole in the wall gem is in a not-so-great area of town kind of in the parking lot of an industrial strip.  But go inside and the menu makes you feel like you've landed in a slice of Honolulu.  Teriyaki beef and chicken plate lunch, spam musubi, loco moco and macaroni salad.  Unless you've grown up with it you don't really appreciate how good it is here--better than a lot of places in Hawaii.  Order at the counter, sit at one of the linolium booths and they will bring the food to you when it's ready.  Reasonably priced, friendly service and good portions.  It's not the healthiest stuff but it fills the urge and you won't find anything like for miles around.

dsSmB4udvJPJ3TqsZAJVdQ.text: How hard is it to grill cabbage on the griddle? I ordered mahi plate that comes with raw cabbage that's placed under the fish. I asked if they can cook the cabbage and they said NO as if it's illegal or something. Last time we're coming to this joint because they won't honor a simple request such as grilled cabbage. Forget this place, Go to L&L instead! Peace

DSPVy5x_4xq09ArC7pvKtw.text: Yummy and cheap, cheap, cheap.  The boy and I were looking for a place to stop at on our way home from Chinese New Year, and decided to stop here, never having tried a hawaiian place before.. Which aparently, is an awful lot like Japanese? I guess? But with pineapples? Anyways, the boy got a teriyaki chicken bowl for under $4, and I got the garlic chicken with gravy for $7. Mine came with macaroni salad, which was meh. No real flavor at all to it. I'd probably just skip that part next time. But the garlic chicken was sooo so good, and the portion size was massive, 3 pieces of chicken and two rice scoops. I had to take half home.  The boy liked his teriyaki chicken bowl as well. Not as much food as the garlic chicken, but still more than enough. The teriyaki sauce had a nice pineapple tang to it, and the chicken was super tender.

7uydjcS2NqzRT_kpaspUPg.text: I go here usually every Sunday and is usually somewhat busy. They have amazing food but I usually order the Local Plate which comes with chicken, beef, macaroni salad, spam musubi and rice. Workers are very friendly and the place is sanitary. Would definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

Ch5ZKuQsYm1ZT59aBX0WSQ.text: After a quick workout at my old school LVAC on West Sahara, I decided to cross the road and hit up an old school Hawaiian food place - Aloha Kitchen.  When I walked in, I was happy to discover that Oxtail Soup is a winter special. It was a no-brainer and I certainly enjoyed it. The oxtail was a little tough and fatty, but the broth had good flavor. Then again, I'm not that picky. Overall, I think the Oxtail Soup at Market Street and even Island Flavor is better, but this one satisfied just fine.  Glad to see Aloha Kitchen is still worth visiting.

ahaG-NYwmQD6J0AvtasoxQ.text: I used to get take out and order my favorite  garlic chicken  all the time.  But for some reason the last few times I've been there the chicken tasted like it was old and dry.  Not fresh like how it used to be.  It's sad because now I won't  come back.  I might it one more time in the future  and hope that they will cook it with fresh chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Kitchen & Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic chicken tastes  like it was microwaved  :-(

HRfxPDosPUy09PsyNTZULg.text: Categorically the best cheap little Hawaiian food spot in Vegas, this little bar/eatery is the place to be when taking refuge from the splendor and chaos of Las Vegas. They are kind and cool. The place is not flashy, posh, trendy, nor is it dirty, dank, greasy. Enlightenment is in the middle road. And this place hits the middle gracefully. Drinks are generous. Service is sweet. Karaoke is fun. Try the Kalua pig and katsu combo plate. Most everything I tried here is delicious. They will bring your food to you in the bar. There is video poker, karaoke, roasted pig, deep drinks, fresh rice, cold beer, hot katsu, and kind company here. Prepare to park it for hours here. Have fun and don't be shy.

2vzmz5TMg1zkUDdJcRFonQ.text: Fabulous, the food is very delicious! The service is good, some of them are nicer than others but overall its consistent, affordable and quick!

i9zjMI8NRCdE4e4hGqWVag.text: Good enough to get my Hawaiian/Asian food whenever the craving hits.  Only downside: minimum $5 for any debit/credit card transactions.  Ugh...that was annoying. I only wanted to order my usual chicken bowl, with tax it was around $4 and some change. So I had to order something that I had no intention to get in the first place. Even Mc Donalds takes debit/credit card with NO minimum amount...get your ish together Aloha Kitchen.

B4YSCC0_4qlh3SijOMC7_Q.text: POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! at the register a guest asked to exchange his order. He was told once the order is out they don't take it back.  When our order came the chicken Katsu was obviously burnt hence the darkness of the coating. When my daughter-in-law took it back they told her "it's because of the oil" she ask for a refund they offered her to exchange. She declined. The cook remembered her when she returned a plate of chicken katsu that was still pink inside. Proceeded to tell the cashier if they  refund her she will no longer be serviced there.  Once I ordered a dish when it came I advised the cashier it wasn't what I ordered and she stood there disagreeing with me. She wouldn't correct my order. Very sad customer service.

LPIeeDBTtZR-w452Iq7mBA.text: We love coming to Aloha Kitchen for their yummy food! Whenever my husband feels homesick we get Hawaiian food and Aloha Kitchen always fills us up! We like to come to this location because they're open later than the one by our home.  We like all their foods, but my kids favorite is the Fried Saimin.  The staff is always friendly and the eating area is always clean when we chose to eat in.

UAnYazmk9g0VXMufxLHPkw.text: I'll def be back here next time I'm in Vegas. I love Hawaiian food and BBQ, but I've never seen adobo fried rice on a menu before, let alone an adobo fried rice omelet! I almost never order an omelette, because it brings to mind the dull, thick, multiple egg dishes at diners. Luckily my lady friend had heard of it before, at this place, and ordered it. I ended up ordering the combo plate with chicken adobo, katsu, and rice. It was good, and a plentiful portion. As soon as they brought her plate to to the table, I knew I'd made a terrible mistake. It looked and smelled delicious, and when I took a sample bite, it was even better! The egg is cooked thinly with lots of chopped green onion in it. For lack of a better term, Chinese style. The fried rice wrapped inside is great, not as greasy as I had been expecting. Even writing this now, I want some! They have plenty of other stuff on the menu from lumpia to musubi to saimin. I'm sure there are other good things, but next time I'm in town, I know exactly what I'm ordering.

kPCfMvfJR4VpnoWLnlchLQ.text: Huge portions, inexpensive, yummy.  I had manapua and fried saimin.  Manapua (sweet pork in a puffy thing) was good but a little sweet for me.  The fried saimin (noodles with pork and green onion and stuff) was so delicious I tried super hard to finish it but just couldn't.  My companions had some good stuff too -- pork adobo was good and portioned as if the whole pig was used; chicken katsu was light and tasty.  It was just a short cab ride from the strip (it's near the northern end of the strip, off sahara blvd).

0gNik9hdfc-uZzZ3emBYnQ.text: whenever we go to vegas, we always meet up here with our vegas friends. it's not the best hawaiian food EVER or is as well known as the hawaiian joint at the CAL, but it always fulfills the hankering my bf always has for their adobo fried rice. i usually just get the combo that comes with the chicken teri/beef teri, mac salad and spam musubi. they give you plenty of food and it's not that expensive.yum!

6Qkt9yLSCji9UfkaK3ciPQ.text: Whenever I'm feeling for some of the local food. Aloha kitchen is the place to be. Food is great, prices are decent. Adobo fried rice of is one my favorites and I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one.
